house_rules: Please study our groundplan floorplan layout. KNOW what a railroad / shotgun layout style is. There are three rooms for rent here. This One is TINY but private (bed size is TWIN, please research that size), one Room is medium sized (full size bed) but part of the walk-through.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
I'm an English Teacher by day so I'm out alot. Between my two jobs, and heading to my wife's apartment, I'm rarely home. I've been renting out my NYC apartments for over 20 years, and I love hosting. I've finally been convinced that the "list of craig" is a dead horse, and so here I am on airbnb.

:)

Hope to build more and more great relationships through travelling: (But I also go out of my way to leave the apartment as much as possible, to give you your space. NOTE- My midtown apt I try and give you as much space as possible. But at my Hamltion Heights home, I'm there alot. (When I'm not in school. Or working my other job. Or coaching soccer. Or out at my girlfriends place. Shoot, maybe I'm not there as much as I think!)

reviews.comments: I had a great time staying in NY with Jack! He was so responsive to my messages and made sure to be available when I came into town. He had everything set up for me and both he and his girlfriend were so welcoming and friendly; I felt really comfortable with them and in the apartment :) The room was small but he made that very clear before accepting my reservation so there were no surprises. Anyway, the bed was so comfortable it hardly mattered. Small room, big city, cute dog (Miko)...what more do you need!! I would totally stay there again.

Great visit,  great host. Jack was so helpful and clear in his first e-mails that the room was exactly what i had expected: this is a long 'railway car apartment' - so you go through two sleeping areas and a living area to get to the private room - which has a door and no one going through. Imagine the  nicest train roomet you have seen - tiny, tiny room but with a firm beautiful bed.
 The host was exceptionally helpful and friendly, as was Miko the pug. The apartment was clean and the great cereal and English muffins for breakfast were an added bonus. The place is on the ground floor and sitting in the backyard  in the morning and at nightfall was a treat.
 I do not walk well and crucial for me was that three good bus lines are right outside (bx19 one block to connect to the m4 and m5, and the m101) and the subway is five minutes away. I often came home late after concerts and felt safe: enjoyed the people I met daily on the buses.

thanks darcy, constance and miko for such a great visit. Highly recommended.

Thanks Jack for a very nice time there in NY, you both helped us to have a much more cozy and enjoyable stay in NY :)) apt was very nice, kitchen and terrace and everything, of course the room is really tiny it probably was a wardrobe sometime ago but we got used to it and in the end it was a very cozy room :) 
The apartment is in a very good place its just few minutes walk from both the local and express trains 145th station so everything is very easily reachable. 
Thanks once more :)

Jack was very nice, he helped me during my time in his house, for family is sus i couldnt stay any longer. The place was exactly how he describes it and its a very good neighboor hood and you have 2 metro station very very close. 
THANK u for a lovely stay jack!!!

Loved the tiny room! I was warmly welcomed with some great conversation. The homes ambiance is one of immediate feel "good'n home"as soon as you walk in the door and for the time, you are lucky enough to spend there.
Even amidst all the hustle and bustle of the town, this is a place of peace and contentment for you to come home too, the quiet tasteful music and Mikos loving presence just rounded my stay up perfect. Did I mention the strong shower head that just feels wonderful after lugging your rucksack around all day? If you want to be social, you can, the host is also very respectful of solitude needs.
Would love to stay again when in the neighborhood.

I spent a wonderful week in this apartment! Jack is so nice and Miko as well!! The apt is warm and welcoming :) the neighborhood is safe and close by there is the 1 train and A express! Amazing the sweet from the cart next to st nicholas street ;)

what can i say. we had such fun!!!....i felt welcomed immediately, the room was as described, tiny but nice. the breadfast-station introduced me in real american breakfast ;)Jacks girlfriend was great, the dog was amazing! to jack, i really had a great time and couldnt have had a better accomodation. he helped me out whenever i had questions, wether about the City or where to get bargains to shop.... also very good tipps for hooking up ;) it wasnt an accomodation at all, it was my home for two weeks ....and i found real friends which i hopefully can Keep contact with...big hugs

Jack nous a très bien accueilli et nous a permis de nous sentir alaise et chez nous très vite !
Il a fait beaucoup d'efforts pour parler un Anglais simple et compréhensible, ainsi que quelques mots en français.
La chambre est certes petite mais vraiment confortable : endroit silencieux et calme, pas de fenêtre donc obscurité totale pour dormir, température idéale, matelas, couette et oreillers bien dodus ! Nous avons vraiment bien dormi dans cette pièce ! 
En plus le petit déjeuné est super : Fruits frais et variés (pamplemousses, bananes, kiwis, oranges, pommes, poires, ...), thé ou café, pains, miel, confitures, Nutella. C'est agréable de se lever et de pouvoir prendre un petit-déjeuné tout de suite, sans sortir de l'appartement.

Le chien est vraiment très sage, adorable ! Il n'aboie qu'un peu lorsqu'on rentre à la maison, et après on ne l'entend plus du tout. Il est discret et ne se fait pas remarquer. Nous, on l'a adoré, mais si vous n'aimez pas les chiens, vous ne remarquerez même pas sa présence !

Séjour génial, grâce aux conseils et discutions avec Jack. Il est à la fois présent et disponible en cas de questions ou problèmes, mais peut aussi être très discret et vous laissez vivre votre voyage seul si c'est ce que vous préférez...

Un grand merci à lui pour son accueil !

J'ai passé un excellent séjour chez Jack. Il arrive à être à la fois parfaitement rôdé à l'accueil d'hôtes, de sorte que tout est prévu dans son appartement pour les visiteurs, et en même temps à ne pas être désabusé d'avoir vu passer tant de monde – il est très chaleureux et toujours prompte à aider. Idéalement situé entre l'arrêt du métro 1 et des lignes A B C D, on est rapidement partout dans manhattan. Le quartier est agréable et assez safe. Très bon plan pour ceux qui veulent se loger à moindre frais dans la ville.

Staying at Jack's was SO AWESOME! He was such an amazing host! It was almost as if I was just visiting friends!

He and his girlfriend had organised she would be able to be there to welcome me initially as he was at work...from the moment I was greeted I knew it would be a great stay! They were even worried for me as I was late arriving and they hoped nothing had happened!
 
Their little pug is THE most adorable, chilled out and intelligent dog EVER! Super friendly, but not really demanding, loves attention but also her own time! She knows heaps of tricks too!

Brilliant apartment, used the space well; the room you will stay in (most likely) appears small but more than enough space for sleeping and loads of very cleverly arranged storage (I was able to fully unpack my huge suitcase into the drawers and wall shelves); if that were not enough, you're made to feel very welcome in the lounge/kitchen all the time!

Great variety of food for breakfast with Jack specially paying attention to things I may have been preferring to ensure he didn't run out!!! (How legendary is that?!!)

Location - seemed safe and civilized enough! I guess always just exercise caution as you usually would being out late etc! 
VERY easy to get to anywhere from here - I was so surprised (I made it to the Brooklyn Bridge in 35 mins!), and the 'subway'/trains are very good!

They are very organised (they even have a crib sheet for guests so you can easily understand the tv, the wifi etc etc with ease!), caring and just generally awesome! 
You'd be missing out if you didn't stay here!
Jack is a wonderful host and the pug is adorable. The backyard is a really good place to chill at!

Jack nous a accueillis très chaleureusement chez lui. Nous sommes enchantés d'avoir fait sa connaissance ainsi que celle de son amie. Et leur chien est adorable! Nous avons apprécié de discuter avec eux chaque jour.
 Situé à proximité des transports publics (station de métro express notamment), l'appartement est agencé de manière originale mais il est très confortable et spacieux.
Nous vous recommandons vivement cet appartement.

Jack is a wonderful host and it was amazing to stay in his house during our trip in New-York! We had a lot of fun with him, talking and drinking French wine on the evening ! His girlfriend is very nice and Miko, his pug, is adorable !

This room is tiny but it corresponds exactly of what you can see on the pictures so no bad surprises ! We are two friends and we slept in this room for 5 nights without any problems so it's good enough for a short stay ! Besides, you could stay in the living room and use the kitchen as much as you want and Jack's house is very cozy ! There is a breakfast station with everything you need to start a long day of visits in New-York !

Location - this room is very close to subway stations and it's very easy to reach the center of Manhattan from here.

I definitely recommend you this place, if you want to spend a great time in NY !
Thank you very much Jack, I hope we could keep in touch and see you again, may be in a Paris' theater !

Staying at Jack's was exactly what my best friend and I needed for our visit at NYC: a private room in a friendly and clean house in close proximity to a subway station. Jack was super nice and offered us plenty of tips on how to get around and what to see. Extra bonus was the lovely breakfast station he has setup for his guests, and Miko (his pug). It was overall a very positive experience and I would definitely recommend a stay at his. Thank you Jack!

This was my first airbnb experience, and I'm glad it was!
The description given is very accurate, or, to be honest, less flattering than the real thing.
Jack welcomed me warmly, gave me many pointers about what to do or how it works around.
Miko (his dog) is adorable.
I'm bad with comments, just note that, shall I go back to NY, I'll ask Jack for his room before looking elsewhere.

Awesome spot to stay! Very close to the subway which made traveling around easy. The hosts were great, very welcoming and accommodating to my schedule. I stayed in the private room and it was perfect for my stay - lots of storage for all my stuff and the bed was comfortable. The layout was not an issue at all. I'd highly recommend this place!

Jack has a lovely place with a really positive atmosphere and plenty of places to check out nearby (along with convenient subway station locations if you want to explore more). 10/10 hosts, pets, and Airbnb, you'll feel right at home! Book if you like good conversation, pizza (literally a 10 second walk away), wine, piano, and/or Netflix.

Location! Location! Location! 

Did I mention location? Anyhow, my stay at Jack's was a dream. I loved the layout of the apartment. I chose the front room, as it better suited my wants. The apartment was a block away from Bikram Yoga Harlem and a laundromat, Super convenient to multiple subway lines, and the garden was a perfect spot to enjoy a morning cup of coffee/tea or some dinner. 

Jack was an excellent host and catered to any question or concern I had... which were few as I am in the city often for work. 

Highly recommend this spot! 

Also, Miko and Saki are so much fun to play with, if you are a dog person.

Jack and Constance are amazing hosts. They gave tons of tips about NY, helped me save money and it was really nice to have evening conversations. Location is really good for those using the subway and there is everything you need within a block or two.

My stay at Jack's was comfortable, and he's a very flexible and available host. I had to make changes to my reservation and he was very accommodating. The description of the room here is accurate (no windows, the door doesn't fully close, no access to A/C unless the door is open) but I found it cozy. The dogs are very rambunctious (but sweet) and shed a fair amount, but this wasn't a problem for me. The location is amazing, super close to multiple subway lines and in a great neighborhood. Overall, I would totally recommend Jack's place to a tight-budget traveler looking to explore NYC.

Jack and Constance were incredibly welcoming. Their tiny room really was tiny, but it was exactly as described. The apartment was close to multiple subways lines, a supermarket, and various other food options. Sake and Miko were also excellent furry hosts. I can't recommend this tiny but welcoming room enough.
I had an amazing time! Jack is a great host, always available to have a great talk or to help you out!! Thank you for everything! Also the location is really great!!!

Jack was the best host!  super attentive, funny,nice and pleasant to hang around. The atmosphere is chill with the 2 dogs and patio where I spent much of my time. I sure will miss him and would recommend to others.

Jack, and his wife Constance made me feel like home! It was my first time abroad and they were very nice to me, gave me very good recommendations and made my experience friendlier, I'm very glad I met them! They're always available for any questions you have  and for a little chat about your day, it was  great! The apartment was nice and the room is tiny but very cozy and the bed is confortable, there are many subway lines close and some buses so it's very easy to move around Manhattan, and to get to Queens and Brooklyn. It's great they offer breakfast for you, you can use the TV, like I said before, it was like home! I totally recommend staying here! And the dogs are very sweet and very good company!
Jack and his wife are amazing people! I’d recommend this place to anyone! I already miss the two puppies and the tiny room was perfect for me, a young girl who came by herself to NYC.

Okay, The only thing that I can say is..that it is very very very extremely rare to enter a strangers house and feel so warm and welcomed! Constance and Jack are phenomenal people, incredibly nice and I couldn’t have imagined staying somewhere else. They were very considerate and communicative. I am beyond lucky and happy that I got the chance to have met you and spent time in your apartment. 
The location is literally perfect for anyone travelling to midtown or wherever you wanna go. The neighborhood is pretty nice and i won’t forget to mention the pups.. they are incredibly sweet and i fell in love with both of them. 
The room is small but it’s sooooo cozy! And really comfortable!! 
I honestly couldn’t have imagined living somewhere else in my time in the city, i loved the talks at night and the kidness and i highly appreciate all of that. If you‘re ever in Germany, please let me know, i would love to see you again!!!

Very convenient  location and safe neighborhood, I had I great time at Jack’s place. He gave me a lot of good advices about what to do in the city and has adorable dogs. I would recommend his apartment for a single traveler who wants to discover  New York.
Jack is an awesome host. He give very good advice for travelers. I recommended him to everybody :)

name: Honu Studio with Pearl Harbor View
summary: Our Honu Studio is one of two newly renovated studio suite rooms we have listed for our guests to enjoy. Honu, meaning "turtle" in Hawaiian, doesn't disappoint with sweeping sunset views of Pearl Harbor.
space: Our Honu studio room comes with your own private entrance from your own lanai (patio) where you can enjoy the wonderful view of Pearl Harbor. There are separate guests staying in the studio next door and tenants separate upstairs. From the street, there are two flights of stairs to get to the rooms. Please be sure to take note of these stairs and the need to bring up luggage when considering the studio. There are two completely separate studios next to each other, each with its own private entrance and private bathroom. This studio is the one on the right when facing the house. The studio is 10 x 18ft and comes with a refrigerator, microwave, electric kettle, tea, dishes, an iron, a hair dryer, closet, a full size mattress, earplugs, soap, and clean fresh linen and towels. We also have a combo lock for the keys so late check-in is not a problem. There's also very fast wifi to enjoy your Netflix after a full day around the island. We also have some boogie boards, beach chairs, beach mat
description: Our Honu Studio is one of two newly renovated studio suite rooms we have listed for our guests to enjoy. Honu, meaning "turtle" in Hawaiian, doesn't disappoint with sweeping sunset views of Pearl Harbor. Our Honu studio room comes with your own private entrance from your own lanai (patio) where you can enjoy the wonderful view of Pearl Harbor. There are separate guests staying in the studio next door and tenants separate upstairs. From the street, there are two flights of stairs to get to the rooms. Please be sure to take note of these stairs and the need to bring up luggage when considering the studio. There are two completely separate studios next to each other, each with its own private entrance and private bathroom. This studio is the one on the right when facing the house. The studio is 10 x 18ft and comes with a refrigerator, microwave, electric kettle, tea, dishes, an iron, a hair dryer, closet, a full size mattress, earplugs, soap, and clean fresh linen and towels. We also have
neighborhood_overview: A real Hawaiian local community vibe. No touristy overcrowded throngs of people and we like it that way. :)
notes: We've had some complaints with noise so unfortunately we do not allow guests with babies or pets.
transit: The bus stops conveniently across the street right in front of the house. There is public street parking available around the neighborhood. Two spots right in front of the house are available for guests, but are not guaranteed since it's still public street parking. Waikiki is about 20 min by car, 1 hour by bus.  Downtown Honolulu is 15 min by car, 30 min by bus. Lanikai Beach and Kailua Beach is 30 min by car.  North Shore is about 40 min by car. Pearl Harbor Memorial is 10 min by car, 30 min by bus. Honolulu Airport is 5 min by car or taxi.
access: Guest have access to their own private studio with private entrance and bathroom. The lanai (patio) is shared between the two adjacent studios.
interaction: We rent out both studio rooms downstairs so you get to enjoy fellow travelers touring Hawaii. We are always available for questions and needs.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking on the property, this includes inside the room, outside on the lanai (patio), and the stairs leading to the house. If you need to smoke, please do it on the sidewalk away from the house. If you are found smoking on the property you will be fined and forfeit your deposit.  Hawaii has one of the highest rates for electricity. Use of portable A/C units is not allowed. Excessive use of electricity will be subject to fines.

host.host_about: Aloha! True travelers at heart, my wife and I have called Hawaii our home since 2013 and want to share our home to fellow travelers.

reviews.comments: The hosts were really nice and friendly.  The rooms were extremely clean, even cleaner than some of the hotels i stayed while on the road trip right before Hawaii. The place had an amazing view from the porch. There's a bus stop right across the street, which was very nice since we didn't rent a car there. Very convenient location, not far from Waikiki, Pearl Harbor. It was a nice, clean and quite neighborhood. Michael and Cristina were even so nice to give us rides to Waikiki couple of times. Really nice couple.

The stay was great, everything we expected. Somewhere close enough to Waikiki but in a super quiet neighborhood just a quick drive away. Host where extremely friendly and they know some great places to eat. Dont be shy to ask.

Michael and Cristina were very nice couple. The view was beautiful and the room was very clean. Good size fridge and even had a coffer maker. The bathroom was great roomy shower and nice sink. Micheal and Cristina had awesome beach chairs and beach mats for us to use as well a set for snorkel mask .  Parking was never a issue when we stayed looked like it would be but ever night that we came back we always had parking. A bit of a climb up the stairs to get up to the room but well worth it.  We loved walking down the stairs every morning and seeing all their beautiful landscaping as well as all the geckos on the walk down.  The location is great if you want to get away from the hustle of waikiki . Really close to the aloha stadium that has a swap meet every wed , sat and sunday. We really enjoyed our stay . Adam it the next room was very nice didn't even meet him till the 3rd day of our stay.

The house had a wonderful view. It was in a good location, not too far from anything but not right in the city. Finding parking can be somewhat difficult but we were always able to find a spot. If you're a light sleeper at night it can be kind of noisy outside (dogs barking, bus stop right across the street). Over all it was enjoyable, and the hosts were nice and gave us a lot of recommendations!
Michael and Cristina were very nice and accomodating. The studio was just as described and was pretty close to everything.

A laid back and comfortable stay, with friendly hosts and very well kept accommodations. The location was close to where I needed to be - airport and Pearl, and an easy drive to the places I was able to visit - Diamond Head, North Shore, Dole Plantation, Paradise Cove...

Highly recommend!

I had a great stay, Michael was very friendly, very close to the airport, which was important to me as I arrived late and left very early. The appartment was exactly as described, very clean, parking was no problem. Close access to H1. I would highly recommend this location as a base to explore Oahu.
Compact but affordable suburban option in a convenient location for exploring Oahu and avoiding Honolulu traffic.

We had a wonderful vacation on Hawaii and especially at Mike and Christina's place. The apartment is very cozy, with a lovely view of Pearl Harbor. Mike and Christina were exceptional, always welcoming, happy and in good mood. Thanks from Czech republic ;)

Enjoyed this place a lot so it was really sad to leave it. Everything is close enough on this island if you have a car and avoid rush hours but this place is really close to the airport so you never be late even if freeway and major highways are jammed. Studio is a brand new, fresh, clean and cozy. Breakfast on a patio with beautiful mountains and Pearl Harbour view was a good start for every day we've spent there. Mike and Cristina were extremely friendly and welcoming, we even got a little toy for our baby! The only difficulty we had was related to a street parking. It looks like local customs imply every household should have 3-4 cars in average so all streets in Honolulu are pretty busy and this street is not an exception. So sometimes it was really hard to find a place but on the other hand hosts allowed us to block their car which helped us a lot a few times. So highly recommend this place to everyone.

We enjoyed our stay at this apartment. Mike was very friendly and helpful, he even let us use his aloe plants when we got sunburned on the first day. We didn't get to meet Cristina unfortunately because she was busy with their newborn baby. 
The space was nice, with a good view of Pearl Harbor. We appreciated that, even for a smaller space, it still had some nice amenities like a few dishes, hot water kettle, and microwave. 
Our main discontent with the space was that it is directly across the street from a bus stop that has stops all through the night. When we closed the doors and just used the fan we were able to sleep better, but it would have been nice to have the fresh outside air without the noisy bus.
Overall, our stay was enjoyable and we would recommend it, especially if you are a heavy sleeper!
Very nice and clean apartment. Michael and Cristina are very friendly. We loved breakfast on terrace with awesome view. We recommend this place to everyone.

Mi marido y yo estamos encantados con el hospedaje que nos ofreció Michael y Cristina! La habitación muy limpia y tal cual se muestra en las fotos. La zona tranquila con gente local y muy agradable y lo más cómodo es que justo delante de casa está la parada del bus! :) 
Estamos muy contentos y seguro que volveremos! Michael muy agradable y amigable. Nos quedamos con las ganas de conocer a Cristina pero a través de mensajes es muy amable! :) 
Sin duda estamos muy contentos con esta experiencia y sin duda recomendamos la habitación de Michael y Cristina 100%! :)

After visiting Waikiki where most tourists stay, my bf and I were glad to have cancelled our hotel reservations and opted for this studio. Michael and Cristina were great hosts and responded quickly to our messages and questions. The studio was clean, modern, and just enough space for two people. Located in a quiet area, it was nice to sit on the balcony and enjoy the view after a long day at the beach. Parking was not hard to find and most places we visited (Waikiki, beaches and restaurants) were within a 20 min drive, which was very reasonable. We will definitely consider renting this studio again the next time we visit Honolulu! 

-L & B

So very happy to have found this gem! It was so relieving to have a place of my own to come home to during my work trip to Hawaii. Michael and Christina were so very welcoming and accommodating and their schedule was super flexible to meet my needs. The best is one of the most comfortable beds that I've ever slept in! It was so nice to wake up to the cool breeze and birds chirping and to enjoy my mornings sitting on my very own porch. I would highly recommend staying here and I cannot wait to book again when I return!

Die beiden sind sehr nett.  Es gab tue Begrüßung sogar eine Blumenbeete.  Ganz süß. Es gibt Alles was man braucht um der Umgebung und die Aussicht ist toll. Es ist nur sehr hellhörig im Haus. Man hört jedes Wort des Nachbarn. Nachts ist es daher auch etwas lauter. Aber sonst wirklich eine super Zeit.

Staying with Michael and Cristina was lovely. Their cute studio is part of a beautiful terraced house in a chill local neighborhood. There's a great view, day and night, and a neighborhood rooster might encourage you to get up on the early side. The amenities were thoughtfully selected and the beef was very comfortable.
Michael and Cristina had excellent recommendations food-wise; we checked out several of them and ate very well.  They are a very considerate couple but will give you plenty of privacy. This was an ideal place to stay if you're looking to visit Pearl Harbor, avoid downtown traffic, and get a feel for laid-back, local lifestyle.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Michael and Cristina's private room for a week. We rented a car so we didn't need to use the bus which was right in front of the house. Parking spots were easy to find. We didn't really get to see much of Michael or Cristina because we would leave very early and come back very late. The times that we did talk, they were very polite and made sure we had everything we needed. The room was very clean and cozy. We will rent again from them if we come back to Hawaii.

We stayed here for 5 nights and it was lovely. The room itself is small, but still has enough room for two people and the patio out front has such a lovely view. It is really clean and organised, with a little fridge and microwave which was very handy. 

It is located close to Pearl Harbor and not too far by car to Waikiki or about 40 minutes by bus. The area it is in is really safe, we walked around at all hours with no issues at all. 

Mike and Cristina are such a nice couple and really went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. It was a privilege to stay in their home. We would highly recommend staying with them and would absolutely stay here again.

Thank you so much for a wonderful stay. 
Mahalo!

Aloha and mahalo for reading my review! \m/ *NOTE: Going to mention this first as this wasn't mentioned in their profile and previous reviews. The house is located on a hill so it would require for you to carry your luggage's up a flight of fairly steep stairs, through the hilly front lawn, then up a few more stairs to get to the lanai/rooms. SO PACK LIGHT AS POSSIBLE. We didn't mind the stairs, but it would have been nice to know about it ahead of time. Didn't expect to climb up Diamond Head w/ our luggage's on our backs on our first night, lol! We flew in on a Friday night, checked in close to 10pm and stayed for 8 days. We felt bad for coming in at that time b/c we didn't want to inconvenience our hosts, but they were very understanding, very flexible, and also very considerate. During our stay, we barely saw them, but they were very quick to respond to us when we needed something. We LOVED the area! In fact, we plan on coming back same time next year and hope to rent out both rooms! P.S. We left 2 Kona beers in the fridge for the next guest(s) to enjoy - hope they pay it forward. ALOHA!!

The studio is in a great location and matches what the pictures show. The lanai is perfect for morning tea overlooking the city. The bed was comfortable and the room was cozy. The only downsides that we saw were out of the hosts' control - parking can be an issue at night, the neighborhood tends to be a bit noisy (mainly because of the bus and neighborhood dogs). Even with these minor drawbacks, it was still a great place to stay and a convenient location for pretty much everything we wanted to do. Michael and Cristina were helpful but not overbearing. Wonderful experience overall.

we were looking at a few places when deciding where to stay in oahu. originally, we had planned to stay in waikiki and now looking back, we are glad we didn't. it is too busy over there and parking proved to be difficult. however, the location here was perfect. we were close enough so that we can go to waikiki (as well as other parts of the island) whenever we wanted as it was close. we literally almost drove around the whole island with our base here. 
the room was very clean and great for two people. the room came with beach chairs and snorkel gear, which we used when we went to north shore. it was warm when we were there but we slept with the fan on and the door open (screen shut) and we were happy without AC, plus you weren't shocked when you walked outside with the temperature difference. the room also came equipped with a small fridge and microwave. fridge was perfect to keep our drinks cold. parking was also easy while we were there. if there are guests in the other room, the walls are thin. but we didn't really mind, as we were out most of the day.
i would definitely recommend this place again. clean + great location

First off, the property was exactly as advertised.

The room was well laid out.  A double bed against the wall allowed ample room to get around in the compact space.  The microwave, small refrigerator, and coffee pot allowed light cooking.  The shower stall was surprisingly roomy as the space was designed for a full size tub.  The walk-in closet was also spacious.

To get to the room, from the street, a rather steep set of stairs needs to be climbed,  then a short walk across the grass.  (The landscape is gorgeous.)  This would be a problem for some potential guests.  For the rest of us, the stairs add extra security.

Street parking initially looked like it might be a problem, but turned out not to be.  Five of six nights, we parked directly in front of the property, one night across the street.

Directly across the street is a busy bus stop.  For some, this is a plus.  For others, it might be a minor problem.  Some of the early morning riders liked to talk while they waited.

There is no air conditioning.  The screen door locks from the inside.  To keep cool, the glass door needs to be open and the fan running.

We experienced no problems.  The property is conveniently located to Pearl Harbor, which is visible from the lanai and Aloha Stadium.  My wife enjoyed hearing the band as the flag was being raised every morning and lowered every evening at Pearl Harbor.  The property is west of Honolulu proper, making the drive to Ewa, Pearl, and Hale'iwa relatively easy.

Our hosts were out of town for a wedding, but through AirBnB email, and other arrangements, took care of anything and everything within an hour or two.

Overall, the location and the property itself were perfect for our vacation needs.

This has been a great place to stay for the week. Great location and very close to the airport. Hosts are very friendly and are also helpful in time of need. Friendly neighbourhood complete with a great view as well.

This was a wonderful place to stay for our week in Hawaii. I stayed with my boyfriend and everything was very spacious for the size of the room. The closet had a lot of room for both or suitcases and we were able to purchase some food to have for the week and put in the fridge. There was no Air Conditioner which was uncomfortable at times but we had the door open for the cool breezes at night and in the morning. Michael and Cristina were wonderful hosts and made us feel right at home and helped us with anything we needed. The parking was very easy and we had no trouble with it. My favorite experience was having a cup of tea in the morning on the lanai and listening to the National Anthem every morning from Pearl Harbor. Truly a wonderful stay. Mahalo Michael and Cristina! Thank you for everything!

First of all this place is really nice and has the perfect scenery. Just the time I went was really humid and hot. The rooms had no ac just a ceiling fan. Please check the weather when you book. Other than that everything was clean and awesome stuff in the closet for use around local areas. Parking was a hit and miss but overall no problems. The stairs is a nice work out to get to the room.

Belle première expérience avec AirBnb! La chambre était très propre et bien accommodée. Elle était aussi très bien située puisque l'autobus passe directement devant la maison. Située dans un quartier calme, parfait pour dormir la porte patio ouverte. Les hôtes étaient très gentils et serviables. Je recommande cette chambre à n'importe qui!

My boyfriend and I are thinking of moving to the island and we really want to experience the local life style and neighborhoods. This was the perfect spot for us. The condo offered everything we needed, we even ordered in one night. Michael and Cristina are great hosts. They gave us wonderful local food spots to try as well a beautiful beach recommendations. We would totally stay here again and highly recommend it to others. We did not need a full kitchen so the bar fridge and microwave were perfect for our snacks and to heat up leftovers. 
The view from the lanai is amazing, make sure to take it all in when you're there. Thanks again Michael and Cristina!!

The host was very helpful when i needed to extend our stay  because of my own oversight. The place was clean and well appointed, everything was as described or better. Great midcentury modern decor was a pleasent surprise

Michael was a great host. He helped us figure out the parking right away after we called him. He helped us to our room, gave recommendations and answered all our questions. He was very hospitable and we definitely enjoyed our stay. The streets can get quite packed with cars parked but we managed to get parking on all our nights.

Unkomplizierte Gastgeber! Kleines Zimmer, aber alles was nötig ist, ist
vorhanden. Es hat alles reibungslos geklappt!
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) Vielen Dank!!!(:

Wir verbrachten 5 Nächte in Michaels Apartment. Es ist sauber, ordentlich und hat einen günstigen Standort zur Erkundung der Insel. 

Ein Problem kann die Hellhörigkeit darstellen, wenn Nachbarn da sind, denn die sehr sehr Dünen wände dämpfen den Schall kaum. Wer es nachts ruhig braucht, ist hier eher falsch. Wir hatten leider das Pech, eine laut schnarchende Person nebenan zu haben. 

Ansonsten wären wir mit dem Apartment zufrieden.

Unsere Gastgeber waren sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.
Die Unterkunft ist zwar recht klein, aber für 2 Personen völlig ausreichend, wir waren sowieso den ganzen Tag unterwegs.
Es war alles sehr sauber und wir haben uns dort sehr wohl gefühlt.

Das Apartment war sehr nett eingerichtet, und alles Nötige war vorhanden. Zusätzlich wurden Strandutensilien wie Schnorchel, Bodysurfbrett usw.       
zur Verfügung gestellt. Cristina hat uns freundlich empfangen und war sehr hilfsbereit. Die Lage der Unterkunft ist optimal, um die Insel zu erkunden. Eine klare Empfehlung!

We booked the studio for 3 nights and it was a great experience. The unit looks exactly like the pictures, and better: compact, modern and efficient. Great location: very close to everything by car. The hosts gave us complete privacy but were helpful and responsive at all times. Cristina was very friendly and nice talking to. Would definitely stay again!

All was perfect. Nice location. Thank you very much Michael.  Kind regards
Martin and Frederike

Great spot to get away and relax. Michael and Cristina are gracious hosts who were kind enough to answer any questions that came up. The property is located near both a Safeway and a Target, which makes getting any last minute items easy. Parking was rarely a problem. Thanks for having us!
The room was great! The location was convenient and the extra beach amenities were a really great addition to the room. We would book the room again if possible for our next trip!!

Having stayed in busy Waikiki for a week I was looking for a quiet, relaxed place to spend my last few days in Honolulu and Michael and Cristina's place was just what I was looking for.

Whilst I did not get to meet Michael and Cristina, they provided me with detailed and easy to read instructions on how to access the property and checked in throughout my stay to see if I needed anything, which was most appreciated.

The room is cosy and comfortable with everything needed for a relaxing stay. If you are the kind of person who likes to relax in front of the tv at the end of the day you will need to bring your laptop with you but with a strong internet connection there was no difficulties in watching programs online.

I found the bus stop to be very convenient and used it every day however if you want to travel directly to places such as Ala Moana Shopping Centre or Waikiki in a short period of time you may want to rent a car instead as the trip can take 45 minutes to 1 hour and the bus can get crowded. 

This property is close to the airport (a 10-15 minute cab ride) which is very convenient if flying out early in the morning, like I did.

Thanks for letting me stay at your property as it was just what I needed at the end of a very busy holiday!
Mike was a great host. Clean cozy room with a nice view. The bed was very cozy and I slept great.

Although we didn't get to meet Michael and Cristina  were quick to respond to any questions or needs I had. The place was perfect for my needs which is a clean place to crash and shower.  Pictures are exactly how the place looks in person. It was centrally located.  We had a car and had no problem parking but seriously The Bus  (it's really named The Bus) seriously comes like every 5 minutes right in front of the house in case you don't want to rent a car.  The view was amazing.  It was fairly quiet for the most part but the 2 studios share the same wall so I felt bad as me and my hubby were talking in normal voices early in the morning and the neighbor knocked on the wall I assume telling us to be quiet.  Overall it was a decent  experience especially for the price.

We stayed here for 5 days during the Christmas holidays and while the hosts were away, they assigned someone to respond to our needs.  Firstly, the view from the lanai was lovely, location was close to town, spacious shower area and storage, and  communication with hosts was good prior to arrival and checking in was easy with good instructions.  On the other hand, the stairs leading up to the unit was poorly lit, pathway to unit was slippery, parking was a daily challenge, noise coming through the very thin walls from the other Airbnb guests in the next unit, the bed we slept on was uncomfortable and the bottom mattress was smaller than the top one by 6 inches!  The size of the unit is most ideal for one person, but with two people, it felt cramped.  The place has a local vibe for sure and I grew in Hawaii and appreciate that the hosts offer an alternative to experience the real local people and culture.

We had a comfortable stay at Christina and Michael’s studio. The room/bathroom was clean, bed was comfortable, clean towels and there was useful furniture in the room like table, chairs, stools etc. Everything matched the description. There were other things in the studio that were not mentioned in the description like laundry washer fluid, dish soap/scrub that made our stay more convenient. Parking was bit of a problem on first day but once we got the hang of it, it was easy to find a spot. We did find 2 cockroaches in the room at night but we can’t say if they were already there or we let them in when we opened the door. The refrigerator had some issue which we didn’t know about. We kept ice-cream in the freezer that melted. But those were minor things. We spent 5 nights there and we were comfortable. We really enjoyed the view from the balcony every morning. The greenery and the chirping of birds was a great start to the day. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a nice place to stay in Oahu.

We have stayed in Honu studio for four nights  and  we really enjoyed it. Lovely little place- quite and cozy.   Both the room and the bathroom were kept  very clean.   

Michael and Cristina are very thoughtful - studio is equipped with everything we possibly  might need during the stay.

We loved the location, away from busy Waikiki.   Bus stop is right outside the house which made it so easy to move around.

We would definitely stay there again when coming back to Honolulu.

Michael & Cristina were a breeze to stay with.  Though we didn't have any interaction until leaving, the check-in & check-out was smooth as could be.  The Honu Studio was charming & perfect for my boyfriend and I & had all the essentials with a rad view too. For as packed as the neighborhood looked, it was surprisingly quiet. Location is central & allows EASY access to town and freeways are super close by to get to any side of the island you wish.  Highly recommended stay & we hope to do it again ourselves.
We had a great stay at Honu Studio! Though small, it's cozy, clean, well equipped and has an amazing view. Highly recommended!

Met Michael and Cristina briefly upon my arrival and felt comfortable immediately. The studio is charming with the only entrance being a double-pane sliding glass door with screen accessed by the porch/balcony. Public transit is nearby with access to major areas of the island. The area seems suburb/rural as you can be awakened or greeted by chicken(s) in the morning. Since I was from the area and understand big city life, ambient noises do not bother me as much...

Very cozy and nice view. Although not very big, but definitely enough for couples or individual to stay. The bed is very cozy, and the apartment very clean. I do not see anything negative about this apartment.
Perfect room. Very clean and very friendly host. I woud book this flat again.
Perfect amount of room for two! Comfy bed and good size closet.
Very nice room with great views. Uncomplicated communication with. Christina. Could even earlier into the room. Thanks for the lovely stay!

Property was as described. It was convenient to my work place and a nice place to rest while discovering Hawaii. Michael and Cristina were gracious hosts who were attentive. Thank you for the opportunity to stay. Mahalo~

Our stay at the Honu Studio was just what we were looking for. We wanted a small, accessible base camp for trips out to Pearl Harbour that didn't require a car. Shops are within reasonable walking distance, and we even managed to happily walk to the memorial and back. The studio is small, but is exactly as advertised - comfortable and reasonably well appointed for the size. The lanai is a nice touch, and allowed for some great sunsets over the far hills.
Overall we'd highly recommend a stay at the Honu Studio - especially if you're driving and want to stay somewhere outside the busy city.
We had the most comfortable stay, with beautiful views of Honolulu to boot. Couldn't have been better!

This felt just like home. It was perfect for us, had exactly what we needed. The neighborhood was great. Far enough from the tourist but close enough if you wanted to be one for a day. Def a must stay
Very great space, very clean and quiet and most of all comfortable. Thank you!!

We arrived fairly late but easily made our way in to find a cozy little room. It was perfect for our stay! We definitely made use of the snorkeling gear and beach chairs that were left for our use. Everything was clean and a BONUS that there was always parking right in front of the house. Also a beautiful view! Definitely recommend this place!

Michael and Cristina were wonderful hosts! The house was clean and comfy. The view from the balcony was great-we watched 4th of July fireworks over Pearl Harbor. Location was perfect-right on bus line too. We would definitely come back. Many thanks to the both of you!

I had very little interaction with the hosts, the only reason I think we spoke in person was because I was so tired when I arrived, I walked up to their place at about 2:30am local time. He pointed me in the right direction. They seemed very nice, can’t say anything negative about them. However, once I left I noticed an additional Airbnb charge on my credit card for $75. I’m sure its for the one towel they couldn’t find after I hung it out to dry on the porch. $75 for one towel, which had definitely not been new, with holes in it and I also didn’t lose it. 
Just be aware this is not an entire home you are purchasing, its a private room, with no A/C (which is advertised) I overlooked that amenity when booking. Also the views of Pearl Harbor are not that great, but the views you do get are very beautiful regardless. My suggestion for anyone staying in Hawaii for any reason, is to just shop around EARLY. I secure this place about Feb sometime, for my trip in July 13, 2016. Places were already booked for those dates... Just FYI. 
On a good note this place isn’t horrible, its just not a place you would want to spend a lot of time in, go out and see all of Oahu!!!
Really enjoyed my stay. The room was as described.
great stay, nice location
Pretty Little Studio with Pearl Harbor view. It was clean and comfortable. Perfect for a couple.
We recently relocated to Honolulu from the mainland and had a great stay! The room is cozy and comfortable, on a quiet street. It was perfect. No complaints!
My stay with Michael and Cristina was very good.  Id recommend the room to anyone who coming to Honolulu for a holiday.  Looking forward to my next trip to Oahu!

Michael and Cristina were very accommodating upon our arrival, making it easier for us to find the studio as we arrived late at night. 

We found the studio to fit our needs perfectly. It makes an ideal location for any couple, making you feel right at home. We made good use of the amenities provided (i.e. cutlery, dishes & microwave). The location was ideal, meaning we were able to easily access places of interests. 

When contacted, Michael and Cristina were quick to respond. 

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone :)
Nice hosts, very clean and pleasant room with great view.

Everything that was listed was accurate, it was a small studio but it's also next to their other small studio with thin walls.  I could clearly hear others talking in the room and when they say next to my door on the lanai.  Also there is no AC so you pretty much have to leave the sliding glass door open to get a little fresh air.  Having the fridge and a place to sit was nice to have.

初めてAirbnbを利用し､また､ﾜｲｷｷ以外の滞在も初めてでしたが､静かでﾜｲｷｷの喧騒を逃れて良い滞在ができました｡
車があればﾍﾞｽﾄですが､なくてもﾊﾞｽ停が目の前です｡
室内は清潔､小さな部屋なので物を整理するｽﾍﾟｰｽがちょっと少なかったけれど長い滞在でなければ十分だと思います｡ﾎｽﾄは親切で部屋や周辺からの眺めもとてもよかったです｡

I would like to thank Michael for very nice stay at his studio. The view on sunset over Pearl Harbor was simply incredible. Since we had no car with us, we really appreciated quite simple connection with the city center by the public transport (The Bus). We also would like to thank Michael for arranging our transportation to the airport at very early hour.

We had a good time at this AirBnB spot.  The view of the Honolulu skyline was priceless.  We thought the lack of air conditioning would be a problem, but it was not as the nights were perfect with the wind coming in from the deck area.  It was a small spot, but somehow very quaint and appealing.

We enjoyed our stay at Michael and Cristina's place. The only issue we had was with parking - there is a space right in front of the house as the description but it didn't feel big enough for two cars without blocking the driveway. Cristina was very accommodating, so just communicate with them and it'll be fine.

Alles ist super sauber, Michael und Christina sind sehr freundlich und offen. Ich war eine Woche dort, leider krank aber es war der beste Ort um krank im Bett zu liegen, denn vom Bett aus hat man eine wunderschöne Aussicht! Das Apartment ist klein, aber alles da was man braucht .... ich liebe dieses Apartment! 
Sehr gerne wieder:-)

We had an excellent time staying at this location. It was well away from the craziness of the rest of the island, particularly Waikiki, so we really appreciated the quiet, relaxed feel of the place. We also really enjoyed sitting out on the lanai at the end of every day. The space was tidy and exactly what we needed since we wanted to spend most of our time outside. The only thing we thought would make the space better was a larger bed (but my husband is 6'4" so that's mostly his problem, lol). Also, it would probably get a little toasty in the summer as there is no air conditioning, but we didn't mind as we were out at the beach or elsewhere during the day. Our hosts helped whenever there was any confusion with parking and they even added some lights along the staircase and path to our room to help us navigate when we came home in the evening. It is fairly out of the way of most of the city, but there were several chain restaurants close by for a quick bite to eat so we would definitely recommend having a rental car for this location. We used the bus a couple of times, which is conveniently across the street, but as per usual public transit, it takes awhile to get places and we didn't want to waste time sitting on a bus when we could be on a beach. Overall, great experience  and we would definitely stay here again!

Michael and Christina were very communicative and accommodating. Our flight into Honolulu got in late, but they made sure we had all the information we needed to find their place and let ourselves into the studio. 
We loved that they had stocked the studio with everything we needed to spend a day at the beach. Would definitely stay here again!

Our second stay with Michael and Cristina was great. Clean, comfortable, and convenient without being in Waikiki. We enjoyed the new addition of the lockbox checkin! Be prepared for the noise- you can hear the people in the room next to yours and the footsteps upstairs, as well as the bus. And the internet is incredibly fast!

AirBNB Rating - Wanaka St - Pearl Harbor, Honolulu, HI [ENG – POR] We traveled to Hawaii to attend the events related to the 75th anniversary of Pearl Harbor attack in WW2. So the location of the lodging was very important. And Michael/Cristina's apart served as a glove for us - perfect! This place is great for a couple with no frills. Very clean, with ceiling fan and another on the floor. There is a shutter on the front porch to 'avoid' a little the fury of the sun and keep the room a bit cooler. The bathroom is nice and spacious. The 'closet' is large and accommodates two suitcases on the floor, with room to hang clothes. There is an umbrella available and two beach chairs, plus diving goggles/snorkell and beach mat. Also, a drawer with three drawers to organize the other clothes. We were lucky with our apartment neighbors (there are two apartments, side by side), ther were very discreet. It was possible to keep up good with their musical and television taste because of the sound insulation, but there was no problem with loud sound, loud conversations, was really fine. Above the apartments is the house of the owners, and they are always available for any eventuality. The couple's daughter wakes up around 7:30 AM but we were never bothered by crying or moving on the upper floor. Access to the apartments is done by a staircase and requires some effort, especially on account of the suitcases. How we wore vintage uniforms, staying for almost ten days, we took more weight - smaller stays will require less physically in that regard. But for the day-to-day, it was ok and comfortable. We liked the bed, big enough. There is a fridge, and the microwave oven, that we never used. There are two chairs in front of the apartment and a small armchair on the inside. The view over Pearl Harbor is good and the sunset usually turns into a spectacle, especially on days with a few clouds. It is easy to dispose of trash, including recyclable. We do not face the higher temperatures because time of the year. However, the fans installed were enough to allow us to sleep closing front doors. The bus stop is well ahead and the noise generated by the engine can disturb a little bit. In our case we were always exhausted and slept very well every night, with the door closed, the ceiling fan turned on, and hardly noticing the outside noise. Now the best part - the people. Michael and Cristina were sensational. Very educated and so gentle. Michael is very calm and helped us out the first night indicating Nico's restaurant at Pier 38 (and it was great), as well as other nearby shopping & food points. Also explained how to park the car: there are two parking spaces available on the street and the vehicles need to be parked correctly. It is interesting to note that Hawaiians seem to...
Michael and Cristina's place is exactly as described. It's clean, cozy, has fast wi-if and is perfect if you don't want to stay in downtown Honolulu or Waikiki.
It was very clean, cosy and confortable. The view was awsome. The bed was a little bit small for US standard but it was enough for us.
Highly recommended! View from the room is amazing!

The view is nice, and the bed is comfy. The fridge is handy. It's not very close to Waikiki. If you want to be there often, then this isn't the place for you. If you want to explore, feel free to stay. Just be aware of the noise. There are roosters, thumping/running feet upstairs, neighbors in the next room are clearly audible, you can hear the bus like the window is open and the National anthem at 8 am every day.
If you're driving, parking isn't guaranteed. You may have to drive up to the end of the road or more to get a spot. 
Check in isn't 24hrs, but only from 3pm. 
The bathroom has a musty smell, and airing out will be necessary. However, since we did that, a cockroach found its way in. (Tropical places I guess?) 
 The toiletries are hiding behind the mirror (didn't find them until checkout day... Oops.) 
The blinds are fragile. Be careful! I think they have broken before. 
I don't think I will stay here again until these things get fixed or if the price is reduced.
Just what we needed: a bed and shower. Small space, with a nice view. Street parking was available within a block. Some steps involved.

There is no AC in the studio but there are two fans that you can use. The ceiling fan seemed to just push around warm air but they were excellent for airing out the room. There is a musty smell once you enter the room -especially if it's been closed up for the day. Michael and Cristina were very kind to provide, tea, bathroom soaps and shampoos, soy sauce, and ear plugs. We should have used them while our neighbors were having a great time. The walls are fairly thin so you can hear everything including the child running around upstairs. If you're in need of a place just to sleep,l and you're a semi heavy sleeper, you'll like it. :)
This is a great find if you want to be close to the action in Honolulu. It's a cozy little room perfect for one or two people.

This is a great spot if you plan on spending the majority of your time exploring Oahu.  We were there for a total of 3 nights, and planned on spending most of our time hiking and exploring the entire island.  It was the perfect location for us, as we planned our days based on location.  We used this space to sleep, freshen up, and store our luggage until we jetted off to Kaua'i!  It was perfect.
The other review's confuse me. The place smelt really damp and I could hear the people in the room next door to is talking quite easily. It was just low quality so not sure why such good reviews?

Micheal and Cristina's studio is perfect for the "wanderlust" adventurer looking to explore the island or to sit on the porch during a rainy day (yes this did happen) and just enjoy the beautiful views. The new renovations make this a perfect get away for any single our duo making a trip to Oahu. Besides no AC there isn't anything I could add.

Great little studio in a non-touristy neighborhood that's close to transportation with easy access to all the sights and attractions of Honolulu. Clean, simple studio with great view of Pearl Harbor in the distance.

Thank you so much for having us Michael and Cristina. The views were amazing, and the area was quiet. Perfect if you want a nice, and cosy spot away from the more tourist heavy spots, but is a quick drive to popular areas. Especially Pearl Harbour.
Loved the beach gear available as well as central location on the island.

Great stay at Michael and Cristina's place.  Apartment is small but perfect for a single or couple.  Decorated very cute with great views.  Check in and out was super easy, and communication with the hosts was excellent.  Would recommend!

Small but very clean and comfortable studio, close to the busstop. Michael and Christina responded very quickly when we hade some question and the communication went very smooth. Thank you for a lovely stay, we recommend this place!

This studio is exactly how it is described. It's really nice and cozy inside and I love how it had a microwave and a mini fridge (makes life so much easier). The view is absolutely amazing! Almost every night my husband and I would just sit out on the balcony and just relax. Everything in the studio was clean and if I needed anything Michael & Cristina were just a few clicks away. There was even beach stuff and board games in the closet which was awesome!  The only down fall is the parking. We noticed that if you returned back home by 7pm (the latest) you'd find decent parking, def not in front of the house. Our second night here we wanted to stay out a little later (9pm) and had to circle the neighborhood to find parking. Luckily, after circling around the block 4-5 times a car just so happened to leave that was parked in front of the house. If you end your days early this studio would be perfect but if you're more of the exploring type and don't want to "rush back home" for parking...this may not be for you, at least not in July from my experience. But aside from that the studio itself was great and for a great price, too.

Si vous cherchez un endroit typiquement local et loin de la face touristique de Honolulu c'est ici qu'il faut venir, l'endroit est propre et bien décoré. La terrasse est parfaite pour prendre son petit déjeuner ou repas du soir, la vue sur Pearl Harbor est sublime. J'ai cru lire que la vue n'était pas surprenante sur Pearl Harbor, il en ai point, c'est jusqu'il y a la végétation plus loin dans la vallée qui ne permet pas de voir l'uss Arizona mémorial. Mais on peut voir, la tour de contrôle rouge et blanche, et quelques bateaux militaires actuels. Le studio est équipé convenablement pour prendre un petit déjeuner et préparer un repas simple(couvert s, micro-onde, assiettes etc...) La dimension du studio et de la terrasse sont suffisante pour y rester quelques jours et ce sentir bien. Attention toutefois (pour les sensibles de l'ouïe) aux bus qui font un peu de bruit. En tout cas, super séjour passé dans ce studio.
Great spot! easy access to a lot of places and not far from HNL. Comfy and felt like home. Def recommended
Michael and Cristina's place boasts a spectacular view of the neighborhood with the backdrop of the ocean and mountains. Although the place is quite small, it's cozy, clean, and comfortable.
This is a great place to stay for business for the week in Honolulu I recommend it if you need something close to town and the airport.

I thought no air conditioning was going to be terrible but it wasn't bad at all. 
It was quiet and peaceful. I enjoyed the stay.
Thank you guys for allowing us to have such an amazing experience in Hawaii.  The room was cozy and had every we needed.   Aloha! :)
Really good place for two people. Small and clean with a front porch(lanai) to drink coffee in the morning:)

We were only able stay at this place for 10 minutes and had to cancel and find another place. Sure I lost a lot of money but it's not worth sacrificing a some good rest over. The studio itself is clean and the view is nice but there's a serious mosquito issue. Not even 5 minutes there my husband and I had our blood sucked several times in the room. Yes I get this tropical weather can attract mosquitoes but I've never had this issue with any other Airbnb among the islands. Mention this to host and they didn't seem to care or offer any help. Just a reply that basically said ... sorry nothing we can do for you it's the weathers fault. Besides that pictures of the area are somewhat misleading. Definitely seems more worn down that the pictures represent. Parking is not easy to find. Streets are extremely narrow. Area safety seems kind of iffy.  

Overall I wouldn't ever go back to this place or recommend it to anyone. If you want to enjoy your vacation don't come here. You'll save money but it's not worth it!!

Everything were exact like what's describe on the details, keys were easy to locate and room was exactly like on the picture. I think room is a bit too hot the fact that it doesn't have AC unit.  It doesn't have a window either to circulate the air inside the room, but the view at the balcony is stunning. It does get hot at night time even with two fans on. And i think the room is on the small side for two adults. The host was really nice and share some organic grown bananas from her backyard. The bus stop accros the street is very convenient and it takes us to downtown directly as well.
Great place!

Such a great place to stay for sunsets! Michael and Christina were gracious and hospitable for suggestions, equipment and/or towels, even just general conversation! They were great hosts and would definitely recommend them to others who would be staying in the area!

Great place to stay if you aren't worried about being central to the Waikiki beach/nightlife. It was about a 30-40 minute bus ride (route 3 was great) to Waikiki- I didn't rent a car so can't speak to parking but the streets were usually full of cars. About a mile from target and able to walk there (they have bags you can bring there too so you don't have to buy one). No windows so it can get a little stuffy during the day if you lock the door when you leave, but airs out quickly with fan and screen door. Might be tight with two people but certainly doable.

This place is close to the airport, very clean, just as described and pictured.  There is a bus stop right across the street which is very convenient. The only downside was parking, the street is public parking and was usually full. Other than that I had a great stay for the weekend.

Michael and Cristina’s place was perfect for my short trip exploring Oahu. It’s a very short drive from the airport and from Pearl Harbor. The space is very modern, comfortable, clean and the view from the lanai beautiful. There are beach chairs and body boards in house which was very convenient to use all over island. I would definitely recommend this space to anyone looking for a simple place to stay on Oahu!

We stayed three nights at Michael and Christina's place for a short visit to O'ahu. We had picked the place for its close vicinity to a bus stop, as we didn't feel like renting a car. Looking back we would have chosen a place with restaurants, shops, etc, a little closer by. The place itself is exactly as described, and we really enjoyed staying there. The interior is nice and cosy; everything was clean and well taken care of. Unfortunately, we never met the hosts, but the communication was swift and easy. Would recommend if you have a car for exploring the island.

Nice little studio, perfect for a couple! Nice view and friendly neighbors. Quiet neighborhood but can be noisy at times because there's a bus stop right in front which causes buses to pass by frequently, roosters and upstairs neighbor with kids but they provide earplugs for the noise if it becomes too much :) 
Well equiped and close to highway! I recommand it.

Michael and Cristina were overly accommodating to all of our needs and made sure our stay was perfect.  The view was beautiful and you can see the sunset perfectly on the deck from your own chairs. They put a lot of care into the place and it's very clean. They even provided beach chairs ans snorkel gear for guest use.  We loved our stay and would definitely return.

This place was great! Wonderful place to lay your head and store your things as you are running around. With a day bus pass for $5.50 you can go anywhere, do anything, and be dropped off right in front of the house. Target is even in walking distance. We had a blast!

Michael and Cristina's place was amazing! I loved how clean it was and the thoughtful little things they provided that actually came in really handy, like the umbrella and beach mat. Overall a really great stay!

The room is located in a good neighborhood and right in front of the house you can find a bus stop. But no worries it will not bother you at all. The location is great (I have to recommend for everyone to rent a car). There is a Target store nearby (4 minutes driving) and it is also close to the highway so commuting to city is super easy. You can get to the city center in 20 minutes-depends on the traffic. We did not have a chance to meet the hosts but the communication with them was quick and easy. The room was clean. I can definitely recommend this one.

It was our first time in Hawaii and we loved every bit of our adventure. The location of this place suited for our needs and was exactly what we wanted. It is a lovely place for couples or single travelers. Parking was a bit limited since we did rent a Wrangler but we made the most of it. They provide gear if you want to go snorkeling or boogie boarding. We would come back to this place. I recommend this place for everyone looking for a decent place to sleep after a long day of adventures!

Nice accomodation, well located to go to different locations on the island.  Good price as well.  I recommend going down the hill couple of miles and visit the Pearl Harbour museum.  Nice view from the apartment over the Pearl Harbour area.
Michael and Cristina's place was really nice and cozy! Has a great view especially during the morning. Would stay again.
Perfect and easy place to stay while I was in town for 3 nights. Easy and quick check-in and check-out. I would stay again

Lovely studio. Great for singles and couples. I have a knee problem and the stairs are pretty steep so if you got knee issues you might have a problem but other than that Mike and Cris were really nice and very responsive. Also loved that they had little shampoos and conditioners and tea pot. No stove so if you like cooking you can't here. It's pretty and the views of the area are gorgeous.

Michael and Cristina are the perfect hosts. Very nice, helpful and understanding. We found their place perfect, it was super clean and we had everything we needed, and even some more! (snorkels and boogie boards) We liked the decoration and the style very much. If I would stay again at Honolulu, my first thing will be check the place if booked. 10/10

LOVED staying here! This was mine and my husband's first airbnb experience so we were a bit nervous but everything was super easy and we were so happy with our decision to stay here. The location is very convenient to Pearl Harbor though we ended up renting a car and drove all over Oahu. We absolutely LOVED our time on the island and used the provided snorkeling gear to go to Hanauma Bay twice (by far our favorite part of the trip!). They provided a small refrigerator, microwave, plates, cups, silverware and even tea bags. We were so pleased with the cleanliness of the room as well. We didn't know what to expect with the bugs and such in Hawaii but we never saw a single bug inside the room and felt comfortable walking around barefoot in the room (and we are total neat freaks). Parking was something to get used to as the other reviews have mentioned but we got lucky several days and parked right in front of the house, other days we parked within close walking distance so it was never too bad. Overall, I would highly recommend this house to others!

The place was beautiful. At night, it offered the best view of the city at night. The lights glow like embers in the distance. In the morning, the beautiful gardens bring in little creatures and the sounds of birds chirping. Overall very nice place
Very nice view. Parking is a little tight but overall the place is clean and decent.

Great location, very close to night life and great restaurants. The sliding glass door was awesome, allowed for tons of natural light and provided a wonderful view. The room was neat and clean as well. I would definitely come here again.

Very clean room. Very very nice view. Small bed for two. Very comfortable though. Not very central. Parking is really inconvenient and hard to find on the weekend. No real kitchen. Unpersonal contact. Good but not superb.

Perfect studio for two. Very clean and cozy. Great location if you want to visit Pearl Harbour. Beautiful view from de Lanhai. Bus stop right in front of the house which is perfect. Be aware that it is at least 1hr of bus to go to Ala Moana or Waikiki and about an other hour if you want to go to Manoa falls or the Southeast of the Island. So location is good if you don't mind doing a lot of bus to visit. Calm neighbourhood, it was really silent at night when we closed the doors, roosters would not bother us. We could easily hear people walking upstairs though. We enjoyed our stay. Mahalo !

It was a great stay at Michael & Cristina! Everything as expected. Super clean and a great apartment for an adventure in Honolulu.
The hosts were more than friendly and even gave us a great late check out. Thanks again at this point.

We would always book this airbn!

Christina's and Michael's place was great, it was clean and comfortable, and convenient to where I had to travel to work. The Lanai outside was also a plus, great view, especially at night. Thank you once again for allowing to stay in your Honolulu studio, I look forward in staying there again during my future trips.
Great place

Michael and Cristina’s place was great! Our studio was clean and just enough space for my boyfriend and I. We will definitely be staying here the next time we are in Hawaii. It was in the center of all of the places we were interested in visiting. Thank you again Michael and Cristina!

Small cosy yet beautiful. Place was as described.. it fits two. With a beautiful view of Pearl Harbor.. its away from city so those who want to eat and dine near to city may need car.. we had a car so not an issue.. parking was available just outside the house .. Carrisa the cohost was very helpul in all communications..
Mahalo

We had a wonderful time there. The airbnb was so cozy and clean, we really liked it. The only little „bad“ thing is that it‘s not so central, so when you don‘t have a car it‘s not so easy to get to Honolulu and to drive uber everyday is really expensive :) But all in all we had a wonderful time.
If you’re a single traveler or traveling with a loved one or friend, this place is your best bet!

Had a great stay at Micheal and Cristina's place.  
I  stayed for just one night from another island  for an early morning meeting in Mapunapuna.  The directions were very clear, the condo was very clean, and there was everything I needed for my stay.
Amazing host great views

Wir waren das zweite Mal dort, es war wie erwartet. Man kommt von dort aus gut in alle Richtungen und ist schnell am Flughafen. 

Es wird auf jeden Fall ein Auto benötigt. Das Zimmer ist wirklich sehr klein und wird sehr warm.

There was a situation where my place was not cleaned on time when I first checked in.  When I contacted Michael and Christina, they were very courteous and made sure I had everything that I needed.  They even refunded me for one of nights.  They were very nice and pleasant to work with.
Great place for the value. Close to the airport. Easy check in. Be ware that there is no air condition or window so it can get hot. Not sure if it’s safe to leave the screen door open at night.

Hors de la foule touristique, cet emplacement est parfait pour découvrir l'île.
Arrivé à 23h à l'aéroport, nous avons utilisé Uber pour 11$ pour nous amener en 10 min. Ensuite, le bus s'arrête au pied de l'escalier.
Lieux propres et fonctionnels.
Pas de climatisation mais le ventilateur au plafond est efficace et silencieux.
Le petit balcon bois est charmant
Great Location to explore O’ahu!

Perfect little space for my needs ( a place to sleep and shower). Very clean with a beautiful view. I loved that there were dishes available for my small breakfasts and snacks. The mini fridge kept everything nice and cool. The outside shade worked really well in keeping the room a little cooler and the second fan helped as well. Would definitely book again in the future!
Die Unterkunft was sehr sauber. Es hat alles was man benötigt. Ohne Auto ist die Unterkunft leider etwas ungünstig gelegen.
Michael and Christina’s studio is in an excellent location for getting around Oahu. They were quick with their responses to our questions and the studio is in great shape! Hope to come back!

Cute space with awesome views. Good value and pretty close to everything if you have a car. We were able to find parking during our 4 night stay. Good communication. Met Christina as well. She was very nice.

I highly recommend Michael and Cristina’s home, they were so welcoming from the start. We booked our stay for 1 month because we moved to Oahu! And we actually requested half way thru to change our res. and check out 2 weeks early since we found our permanent apartment in Honolulu quickly! They were very accommodating. There are a lot of stairs leading up to the place, and though they say there are 2 parking spaces for guests out front, we only got to park there 2 nights out of our stay... we had to part about a mile away and on hills most of the time! It is a pretty packed neighborhood full of hills, so maybe don’t book if you rent a car! There are TONS of lizards and geckos around, which is fun. But also at night the cockroaches come out in full force, not so fun. We actually found one creeping around in our folded towels but there was roach spray ready for us! This place is perfect for a short stay, for 1 or 2 people. It is also VERY hot, no A/C and a small fan. We had a great start to our new lives thanks to our hosts!
Nice place. Clean. Great price.
The place is great. Everything you need from beach chairs to simple kitchen utensils.
Please be aware that parking is difficult.  There is no TV, WiFi, air conditioning and room is small.  Two people is crowded.  Constant moving around upstairs and a bus stop out front.

The studio was perfect for my husband and I for the short weekend trip. We loved how close it was to all sides if the island, very easy check in and out, great communication with hosts and very clean and cozy. The house alone is very well kept, prettiest landscape and stair case compared to the other houses on the block, easy parking areas, not loud at all and the morning views of pearl city was amazing! Best street in the area. There are stairs to the studio but we used it as our excersizing advantage :)

Le Honu Studio est vraiment parfait! 
Petit cocon sympa et plein de charme qui se trouve dans un quartier typique hawaiien à mi chemin entre l’agitation touristique du centre ville et le côté un peu plus nature, calme et sauvage de l’île. Nous avons vraiment adoré cet endroit! De part la vue, le calme, le quartier en lui même, le côté pratique, la localisation, etc. 
Le studio est vraiment parfait pour les voyageurs seuls ou en couple. Très fonctionnel et pourvu de pleins d’équipements. Nous ne regrettons en aucun d’avoir effectuer notre séjour chez Michael & Cristina. Quant à eux, ce sont des hôtes vraiment superbes. Très gentils, très présent pour la moindre question ou requête.
Clean, modest space with nice decor. Beautiful view from the deck. Note that you share the deck with another studio tenant whose room is right next door. Easy to find street parking nearby.
Very clean and home like. The only issue was parking but overall the location is great with an amazing view.

Very true to the pictures/ descriptions. Overall had to give 3 stars because the people up stairs were extremely loud (walking, doors, etc.) and the shower makes a very loud screeching sound after being on for a short period of time.

name: A 2-story, 2-bedroom house - 20min to Downtown
summary: This 2-bedroom, 2-floor home is the perfect home away from home. Located two blocks from the subway, with beautiful decor, antique rugs and light filled rooms, featuring: private entrance, fully-stocked kitchen, 2-bedrooms including a master suite and a kid's room with crib plus a single bed, a spacious, open living and dining room, and a spacious garden -- a rare find in the city! 20 minutes to downtown Manhattan. Perfect for 6 or less. Please note, there is a cat who lives here.
space: A sweet 2-bedroom, two-floor apartment in a private, two-family house on a quiet tree-lined street with a private entrance.
