Its a great place to stay, its very confortable, clean, quiet (despite the train sound) you get all what you need. I will recommend 100%!! Eliana is a tremendous host and will always be accessible for anything you need.

This place is honestly great. We came to NYC for NYE and this Airbnb was a great place to relax between excursions. Location is great--very close to the subway and many restaurants. The coffee maker and Starbucks coffee added to its appeal. The hosts were helpful and friendly.  I’d come back.

The apartment is very clean and comfortable. It is less than five minutes walk from a subway station.  We were pleasantly surprised to find everything we needed provided even an umbrella and soaps.
Eliana is a very good host; I would recommend her place to anybody who is looking for a place to stay in Queens.

Der Aufenthalt hat sich gelohnt. Nany hat uns warmherzig aufgenommen und besonders hervorheben möchte ich die Flexibilität beim check out, wir konnten es zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt wie vereinbart verschieben. Die Lage ist top, nur 1 min. Gehweg zur 52nd Station und danach max. 20 min. bis Manhattan. Nany war auch bereit uns mit ihrem Auto die Sehenswürdigkeiten zu zeigen. Beim nächsten Trip nach NY, werden wir bestimmt wieder die 52nd Street auswählen - THANK YOU FOR YOUR HOST!
Good for the price!

Eliana always answered my calls and questions promptly. She was very kind and was there for us when we needed to drop off our bags earlier than check in time. The apt was very clean, which we appreciated very much. There were even things like shampoo and toothpaste that was provided for use. The location is right next to the train stop so it was convenient to ride into the city.  You could hear the train coming and going but it wasn’t as loud as I thought it would be.  The noise level was tolerable. All in all we had a great stay. Would definitely recommend this place.
Amazing!!! Eliana is an incredible, generous, attentive host.  Great location, super clean, check in was easy as can be. Would highly recommend!!
i can say in one word.. AMAZING !!!!

Eliana ist eine sehr freundliche zuvorkommende herzliche Gastgeberin, zeigt so manche sepzielle Geheimtipps. Die Wohnung ist geschmackvoll eingerichtet, liegt nahe an der uralten Subway 7 in Queens, daber sehr verkehrsgünstig. Lokale sind keine zu bewerten, 1 sauberer Minimarket an der Hauptstr. NYC ist sehenswert, wir kommen gern wieder, Ilse u Andreas
Great place to stay.

Her place is even more beautiful in real life than in pictures... she herself is charismatic and has a great sense of style... we found great restaurants and loved sitting outside taking in the city... was a fun weekend getaway...
El apartamento de Eliana es un lugar muy acogedor.  Tiene todos los servicios que un huesped necesita para descansar.    La decoración es la ideal para el espacio.
This apartment has it all - great location (half a block from the train), great amenities and attention to detail on the host’s part, nicely furnished and good communication with the host.
so close to the metro system, but it could be noisy if you were a light sleeper｡ check out sunnyside nearby for groceries. it's so cute
Awesome value great location . I would love to stay here again.

The apartment was much better than I expected to be honest. When I showed up the space was immaculate, well decorated and had everything I needed. 

Eliana communicated very well throughout my trip and was a great host.

Eliana was a wonderful host! She greeted us upon arrival and stocked the apartment with lots of refreshments and any amenities we may need. The apartment was very clean and close to public transportation. I would highly recommend staying at her apartment!

Die Kommunikation war sehr einfach und schnell. Eliana hat uns sogar am Flughafen abgeholt und uns sehr herzlich empfangen. Die Wohnung ist sehr sauber und stielvoll eingerichtet.Um die Ecke gibt es einen Supermarkt und alles was man braucht. Zur 7 Bahn sind es nur wenige Schritte und die Fahrt nach Mannhatten dauert ca. 15 Minuten.
We had great experience staying at Elaine's beautifully functional and clean apartment. Elaine is a wonderful person and a generous host.
Very nice place and good hospitality
Terrific place right by the subway!  I highly recommend

Eliana’s apartment provided everything I look for in an Airbnb rental: trusted host, sparkling clean space, comfy bed and luxurious linens. She made sure I understood how everything worked when she checked me in and encouraged me to call if I had more questions. But I had no questions and no problems. The 7 train was extremely convenient. It was loud but didn’t keep me awake. I will definitely stay there again while visiting my daughter in Sunnyside.

Nettes Apartment in Queens, gut via subway 7 an "the City" angebunden. U-Bahn-Station 52nd in unmittelbarer Nähe, leider ist die U-Bahn entsprechend auch zu hören...
Gastgeberin sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit! Würden mich sofort wieder für einen NY Aufenthalt dort einquartieren!
We have stayed here previously.  The location is perfect, the apartment immaculate and the host very helpful and welcoming.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about Eliana and her beautiful place. We were absolutely blown away by the cleanliness, design, location, space, and the thoughtful touches that were added by our host. She was waiting for us when we arrived late at night even though she wasn’t feeling well. She had wine, champagne, bottled water, chocolates, tea, and coffee all available for us. There were more than enough toiletries and linens, so we could’ve forgotten everything at home and we would’ve been taken care of. The bed was extra comfortable, and the sheets felt so good, I looked them up to buy our own. The train didn’t bother us at all, and we slept like babies. It does not get much better than this in NYC. We will be back!
Place was great! Super close to subway system, not far out from the city. Eliana was so friendly and even provided wine for our stay. Would highly recommend.

Probably best Airbnb I’ve ever been in. Eliana is a very gracious host and the apartment is nicer than I even expected. The location is great to hop right on the 7 train (2 min walk) and be in Midtown Manhattan in 15 minutes. Highly recommended!
Very cute and convenient space with thoughtful host. Best Airbnb experience to date. Eliana made sure we had everything we needed and added a few things extra.
Great location, super clean, lots and lots of amenities, great communication and super safe area - would definitely stay there again!

The apartment was very attractive & extremely clean, the location was excellent, and we appreciated the amenities; Eliana left us juice and milk and wine. she was very responsive & helpful, overall stay went extremely well.
Nice place and good location

name: 6th floor very sunny flat
summary: 15 min from the center of the city. full equiped flat.
description: 15 min from the center of the city. full equiped flat.

reviews.comments: Adrian was great host, he went above and beyond to make us feel at home. We stayed here during the primavera sound festival. It was the perfect location, his apartment is a block away from the L1 metro which takes you directly to the trams for the festival. I also liked staying in a area  that is far enough from the tourist traps and loud city center. However if you do want to visit the city center it's only a 30 minute metro ride away. His apartment was clean and tidy. Our living space was comfortable. His two adorable cats were also very sweet! Thank you again Adrian! I'll hit you up next year when I come to Barcelona :)

Had a great stay with Adrian! We arrived late at night the first night of our stay and he was very welcoming and offered anything in his fridge. His apartment was very conveniently located, 4 min walk to the Metro and near lots of shops and restaurants. There's a lovely balcony with a view and he has two friendly cats! Highly recommended!

Adrian was a amazing host and was very caring, welcoming and friendly host. I recommended Adrian's flat to everyone who want to get to know Barcelona, spend time with to lovely cats and stay with peaceful and lovely neighbourhood. 

Adri, you are amazing!

It was possible to stay very spontaneously at Adrian's flat. We've booked on the day we arrived. He was very friendly and relaxed. He always asked if we'd like something from off the fridge. One night he cooked a meal for us which was very delicious. In general an awesome host! :)

name: Hancock House cozy Garden Level
summary: Beautiful 19th century garden level apartment in classic brownstone Brooklyn home. Enjoy this lovely sunlit floor-through with original details including parquet floors and original kitchen hearth.  Updated wiring, plumbing, and appliances. Prepare meals in the charming full kitchen.   Shared backyard access.
space: This is the garden level railroad style floor-through of a 19th century brownstone, c. 1880, with exclusive access from a common hallway.  Most of the original details are in tact, but we have modernized the wiring, plumbing, and appliances.  The tin ceilings in the kitchen were added in the 1920's, when tin came into vogue as a decorative detail.  You will have exclusive use of this  railroad style apartment which is warm and cozy with everything you need to feel comfortable during your stay in Brooklyn.  Four sleep comfortably on the full bed and queen fold out sofa. There's a grocery store down the street, so feel free to prepare your meals in the full kitchen.   David, myself, and our two children live upstairs.  One of us will be available to you to answer any questions and to get you comfortably set up downstairs during your stay.
description: Beautiful 19th century garden level apartment in classic brownstone Brooklyn home. Enjoy this lovely sunlit floor-through with original details including parquet floors and original kitchen hearth.  Updated wiring, plumbing, and appliances. Prepare meals in the charming full kitchen.   Shared backyard access. This is the garden level railroad style floor-through of a 19th century brownstone, c. 1880, with exclusive access from a common hallway.  Most of the original details are in tact, but we have modernized the wiring, plumbing, and appliances.  The tin ceilings in the kitchen were added in the 1920's, when tin came into vogue as a decorative detail.  You will have exclusive use of this  railroad style apartment which is warm and cozy with everything you need to feel comfortable during your stay in Brooklyn.  Four sleep comfortably on the full bed and queen fold out sofa. There's a grocery store down the street, so feel free to prepare your meals in the full kitchen.   David, myself,
neighborhood_overview: Bedford Stuyvesant is a diverse, vibrant, and wonderful mash up of culture, color, age, and economic level. The neighborhood has been predominantly African American since the 1930's. Before that, the area was a mix of Germans, Irish, Jewish, and Italians. Recently, there has been an influx of immigrants from the Caribbean and Mexico, and from other Brooklyn and Manhattan neighborhoods. These brownstone lined streets are shared by the rich and the poor alike,  with a mutual respect for each other.  We are living in a dense urban environment, with all of its pros and cons. All around us on Hancock Street are working class families, Wall Street types, writers, artists, social workers, city workers, and professionals of all kinds. As I write this, kids across the street are playing a pick up game of basketball.  The music of Brooklyn. This is a real neighborhood with real history.  As more people move into the neighborhood, more shops, restaurants, and bars are opening to join the ones tha
notes: Bedford Stuyvesant borders the always hip neighborhoods of Bushwick and Williamsburg. The B46 bus will take you into the heart of Williamsburg for a fun night out!  Also nearby is Crown Heights and the Brooklyn Botanical Garden.
transit: The subway (A and C) is about 8 minutes away, and the A train will get you into Manhattan in about 20 minutes.  The A train also has service to and from JFK airport.  We are also about 10 minutes to the J train in Bushwick.  The B46 bus will pick you up at the corner of Hancock Street and Malcolm X, and will take you into Williamsburg, or just use UBER!  We can also provide you with the most reliable car services that we use ourselves.
access: Guests may use the backyard.  Feel free to enjoy your morning coffee, cigarette, or evening cocktail outside at the table.  In the summer months I try to have many flowers in bloom.  Smoking is allowed outside only.  Also, sit on the stoop in the front if you want to take in our lively and eccentric neighbors!   Sadly, I must insist that jumping on the trampoline is strictly off-limits.
interaction: David, myself, and our two children live upstairs.  One of us will be available to you to answer any questions and to get you comfortably set up downstairs during your stay.  The doors to the apartment lock for your privacy.  We seldom go downstairs into the common area hallway, so you could go days without seeing us.
house_rules: We want you to enjoy your stay with us at Hancock House, so please enjoy your cigarette outside.  Please no smoking of any kind inside. Keep front door gate locked tight day and night whether you are at home or out. Keep back door locked when out or at night. Hot water in shower is at the "beginning." Please recycle.  Refer to the helpful stickers on inside of the recycling can.  Please flush only the toilet paper provided. All feminine products, Kleenex, baby wipes, etc can be disposed of in the trash can.  Please no burning of incense or candles.  Please do not allow anyone into our home who is not on the reservation.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Hello. We live in Brooklyn, NY with our two daughters, Olivia and Ingrid. David is in advertising and I work in TV/Film as a costumer.  My husband is a doer while I'm more of a ponderer.  We work a lot and hang out with our kids and as much as possible.  We like old movies, and sitting outside on a  nice summer evening.  We enjoy spending time together as a family.  That's about it!

reviews.comments:
Nicci and David were fantastic hosts! They were incredibly helpful and friendly right through the booking process, answered our queries promptly, greeted us with a smile and gave us tips on what to go see during our stay. They were there whenever we had questions but left us to enjoy our stay otherwise. 
The place itself is absolutely gorgeous, beautifully fitted out and decorated and with a comfortable bed. The couch arrived on our last night so we can't give feedback on the fold out but it looked good! Finishing touches such as bottled water, coffee, tea and some snacks to get us through our first jetlagged sleep & breakfast was very generous and much appreciated after a long flight. 
We didn't really explore the immediate area around the flat but we always felt safe and welcome in the neighbourhood. The subway is close by and makes it super easy to get around Brooklyn and Manhattan. 
We feel lucky to be the first ones to stay here and had a fantastic stay! Highly recommend it, would definitely stay  here again!

Nicci and David have really created a warm and inviting home. Everything you need is there from a few snacks to just the right amount of toiletries. It is a warm and inviting space that I would recommend to anyone!

Nicci made us feel very welcome! She has great tips, and is a wonderful host. Apartment was clean in a typical Brownstone house in a Brooklyn neighborhood. Esp. bed was very comfy :) 
Overall; very recommended !

Nicci and David went to great lengths to make us feel welcome and Hancock House was a lovely, functional, and comfortable space. It was truly a home away from home,  located conveniently close to public transportation on a quiet block and within walking distance to some great restaurants and shopping. The space itself is balanced and thoughtful- the wonderful hosts had everything we needed to make tea, water, wine (:+)), and snack! The shower water pressure is amazing, the mattress superbly comfortable and beautiful sunlight in the morning. Nicci was a truly gracious host, and Hancock House is absolutely a gem.

Great space. Nicci was super helpful and gave us loads of information and help with various things. Beautiful apartment only a few blocks from the subway. There was four of us and there was plenty of room. The snacks and milk etc was amazing as we arrived late at night. 
Thank you so much for a great stay.

David was very welcoming and explained everything we needed to know about the apartment! He was in touch and super helpful throughout our stay. The apartment itself is cozy and warm, a bit smaller than the pictures, but it was absolutely comfortably sized for the three of us! I'm sure it would also be glorious in the summer months when it's warmer to spend time on the patio in the backyard. The sofa bed and the bed were comfortable and the kitchen was super functional with a great sized stove in case you feel like cooking!

Nicci and David were incredibly hospitable.  The place is very well stocked. I stayed here with my husband and two children.  We were very comfortable and had plenty of room.  We felt truly at home.  

The neighborhood is quiet and has several wonderful restaurants within walking distance.   The walk to the train is fairly short and the A train takes about 15 minutes to downtown Manhattan.
Take a walk down Stuyvesant avenue often.  It goes right by Stuyvesant Heights which has beautiful architecture.

Nicci & David contacted us before our rental period started and arranged to meet as at a convenient time. A friend of their's showed us around the property. They had provided us with a lot to make the stay as comfortable as possible - fresh towels, extra blankets and sheets that could be used for the pull out couch, DVDs to watch on the TV in the lounge, and even wine, sparkling water, and food items and cooking supplies. Nicci had also left a book with all the details for local cafes, restaurants, bars, and the local grocers. My husband and I were very comfortable and we really liked the flat. It for the most part fit what we imagined based on the photographs and description.  Throughout our stay Nicci was a gracious host and even helped to lend us their iron when asked. I would recommend their listing.

We had a wonderful stay at Hancock House.  Our hosts Nicci & David were warm, friendly, and very thoughtful.  Our garden apartment was charming and immaculate.  All the details from the lovely bowl of fruit to the selection of teas were well thought out and beautifully executed.  The bed was quite comfortable and the linens were fresh and cozy. Having a kitchen was a pleasant bonus for us, and while we just ate breakfast there, it was outfitted well enough to cook a full dinner.  The neighborhood is walkable with a number of interesting restaurants and bars.  We will definitely return and would highly recommend this home to our friends.

The Hancock House was the perfect little getaway immersed in Brooklyn culture. It held all the comforts of our own home. Nicci and David were the perfect hosts and were available to us via phone if anything came up. The location was accessible to all our necessities (Subway, groceries, restaurants) and was very safe. We would definitely recommend staying here, and also look forward to coming back ourselves!

this apartment was really nice and very clean with great character. David let us in and gave a little tour.  he was very friendly. the weather was very cold, and the apartment was chilly at night, but as soon as we asked them for some more heat, they really cranked it.  Its really out there in West Brooklyn, but the neighborhood was fine and parking was way easier than if you were in park slope or even further west in Bed Stuy.   all in all it was a good experience. i would visit again.

Nicci and David were both wonderful hosts. They accommodated our early arrival and they kindly showed us around the place. They also left us a booklet filled with places to eat within the area. Nicci left us a bowl of clementines and the fridge had a few items in it incase we got hungry. The apartment was clean, cosy and very beautiful. We had everything we needed; fresh towels, a dresser for our clothes, a TV and some movies too!  The heating seems old so expect a few unexpected sounds! I suppose it added to the old charm of the place. Nothing a fellow city dweller can't get used to. Thanks again xo

Had a great time at this apartment, very clean lovely little home. Would 100% stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone! Nicci greeted us in the evening on the first night and showed us around the apartment and explained how everything worked. The apartment was very kindly stocked with water, food and even a bottle of wine, a very nice touch, we also had a later flight on our last day and Nicci kindly let us check out later, this really helped us not having to carry around big cases all day, the apartment also has great connections to JFK so was ideal to get there via subway. This part of Brooklyn is very residential and quiet with some lovely restaurants and wine bars around, only a ten minute walk to the subway it is very easy to get around Brooklyn and NYC. Again would highly recommend this apartment.

Nicci and Dave were friendly and very communicative. Their home is exactly as pictured. It's very clean, spacious (eat-in kitchen!) and tastefully appointed. Would absolutely recommend staying here, without reservation.

We had an exceptional stay and Nicci and David's apt! They are both friendly and responsive.The listing is very accurate.The apt was clean and comfortable with so many nice touches that made us feel right at home! We even extended our stay by 2 days! We appreciated the white linens that were all soft and warm. Fruit, waters, coffee, teas, 1/2 & 1/2, wine, and basic cooking neccesstities supplied. I like that there were no scents like air fresheners or candles around and that many items were organic. They recycle too! Subway A train is within walking distance and a quick ride into Manhattan! This is an up and coming urban neighborhood but we always felt safe and the street is filled with families and beautiful brownstones. There are some great neighborhood restaurants close by as well.

Nicci and David were wonderful hosts. I was able to easily pick up the keys from a local grocery through key cafe. The place is just beautiful... Simple and elegant decor. It is very comfortable and you can settle in as if u were at home. I highly recommend the Hancock House.

Lovely home, lovely hosts.   We were greeted on time, shown around the space, and best of all there were fruit , soda,  coffee, and other necessities stocked in the fridge and awaiting us. We were starved and didn't feel like trekking out, so it meant a lot.  Very comfortable bed and sofa.   We cooked a bit in the kitchen and found everything satisfactory.  The neighborhood seemed safe enough.  Nicci and David answered all of our texts promptly and came down to assist us when we couldn't get the TV to work.  They allowed us to stay a few hours past checkout time in order to accommodate our flight.   All in all, an excellent experience in our first brownstone.  I would recommend staying with them.

This is a very nice appartment.  The kitchen is really nice, although we only used it for toasting bread in the morning.  The bathroom is clean and the bed is comfortable.  You can just sit down and relax after a busy day in Manhatten :-).
Nicci and David were very friendly and ready to help whenever needed.
Great stay! Apartment is nice. Bed very comfortable. Kitchen absolutely amazing. Recommended!

Nicci and David were exceptional hosts, from arrival to departure, they were available, friendly and very helpful.  They have created a beautiful, warm, and tastefully decorated garden apartment which mixes timeless vintage touches with the comforts of modern living. The neighbourhood is tree-lined, with beautiful brownstones on both sides of the street.  It is less than 10 minutes walk to the MTA Station for connections to Manhattan and other Brooklyn neighbourhoods.  The listing photos of the apartment are very accurate, the neighbourhood is friendly and close to stores and restaurants - we tried Peaches Cafe for modern soul food and Saraghina for Italian food - both were exceptional and only a short walk away!

Nicci and David were great hosts. Nicci met us with the keys and gave us a good tour of the apt. along with some things we needed to know, where all the light switches were and lock up process. The apt. was spotless and the furnishings beautiful. There were drinks in the fridge and fresh fruit in a bowl for us, a very nice touch. Check out time was 11:00AM but Nicci text me it was ok if we were a little later.
Great weekend in a beautiful home!

Our hosts Nicci and David were great - communication was quick and accurate and they were super nice.  They checked in with us over the weekend to make sure we had everything we needed. David met us on arrival and showed us the apartment.  Location is great - really close to all the good neighborhood restaurants, grocery store etc.  I liked the apartment, but it did lack a door to the bedroom, which I failed to notice in the pictures. (My fault)  The bedroom is located between the living room and the kitchen and it's really small.  The bed was a little low, and only a full size, which we aren't used to, but very nice linens and comforter.  There is an outside area with a table which we didn't take advantage of, but it is a nice space.  The hosts provided a bottle of wine, fruit, coffee and half and half, and some breakfast stuff in the refrig, which was much appreciated, since we got there about 7PM on Friday night.  I loved their vintage kitchen!  Really cute, lots of pots and pans for cooking, great stove.  All in all it was well priced and a convenient location. It's a ground floor apt, so there isn't a lot of light with the curtains closed, which you really need to do since you are on the street level. If you don't care about a large space and a big bed, book it!  Great hosts!
We had a great time staying at Hancock House. It was the perfect size for my husband, daughter and myself. Nicci and David have done a wonderful job making this a comfortable, easy place to stay!
Beautiful apartment, that looks just like on the pictures, very nice and helpful hosts, I truly recommend it!

We recently stayed at Hancock House for six nights. Nicci and David were extremely warm and accommodating hosts. The apartment is lovely and comfortable.  Visitors should be forewarned that some of the neighbors can be loud at night.

Loved staying in Hancock House! Nicci was so helpful from booking to departure - giving travel advice & directions, recommendations and always responding to messages. We greatly appreciated that there were drinks in the fridge, and tea & milk as we had flown from Scotland. When it became extremely hot in New York Nicci kindly thought to bring us a electric fan. Nicci & David were very relaxed hosts; we met them on departure and they were lovely! The apartment itself is beautifully decorated & furnished - there are lots of original features, and everything is of a high standard. The bed was lovely & the mattress very comfortable. They have extremely good taste and the flat was a pleasure to be in - well laid out and impeccably clean. 

The area, Bed-Stuy, is great and a lot of fun! We found it convenient for Manhattan & other parts of Brooklyn - you can walk to the nearest Subway through brownstone lined streets, and the residents are very friendly and greeted us often. Bed-Stuy is a very lively area - when we stayed in June, lots of folk were out on the streets having a good time. There seems to be a good sense of community. Nicci & David recommended a great coffee shop, Brunswick, and pizza restaurant, Saraghina - food was delicious at both & staff were very friendly. 

All in all, staying at Hancock House really enhanced our time in New York and Bed-Stuy feels authentic and is an experience in itself. We'd definitely stay here again. Thank you Nicci & David!

Nicci and David were great hosts and we had a very good experience in Hancock house. The apartment is beautifully furnished, very comfortable and nice and private.  Hancock street and the general area around Bedstuy is full of colour and because we were staying with in a distinct community it felt more authentic as an experience. Sometimes hotels can have an impersonal feeling where as staying here gave a strong sense of place. There are also some very nice places to eat close by.

Just wow. I recommend Hancock House 110% Nicci & Dave were absolutely the ultimate hosts. They were quick to respond, helpful, professional and so welcoming. Down to the smallest detail everything was perfect. We couldn't have had a more pleasant stay at Hancock House. 

The stunning apartment is beautifully decorated and immaculately kept. It looks exactly as pictured. The entire house was spotlessly clean on arrival.
The garden terrace outside  was our perfect haven for a morning coffee or a cold afternoon beer.

The kitchen is well equipped to cook at home and Nicci was kind enough to stock the fridge with the essentials for us, including a lovely welcome bottle of wine. 

The location is great and has some great spots to eat and drink nearby, on our hosts recommendation!  Bed-Stuy is a vibrant, fun neighbourhood. Utica Avenue subway is only about a 10 minute walk and connects you to C and A trains to Manhattan. 

We would love to return again to stay with this wonderful family!

My 17 year old daughter and I went to New York to celebrate her high school graduation.  I wanted a place where it was comfortable and safe.  Staying here was like staying at "home".   And that was the number one thing I wanted when looking for a place to stay?  It was comfortable and very cozy.  Everything you need to prepare a meal was available in the kitchen.  Nicci made it a point to have some fruit, half and half, butter, English muffins in the fridge.  And of course the two bottles of were a nice treat after waking all day in New York.

All the basic things one would need are available at the apartment.  The queen size fold out bed in the front room was good and my daughter stayed in the adjoining bedroom.  If you are staying on a hot time of the year, make sure to have the AC in the front room and the fan in the kitchen running during the night.  It keeps it perfect. 

Everything about the apartment meet our needs and it was very clean.  If you are looking for a place where you can make a meal and head out the door for the day and return for the evening for a meal and restful place, then this is the place to stay.  

Walking to and from the subway was about an 8-10 minute walk to the Utica station.  If you want to catch some of the local eats, Nicci has a book on the kitchen counter that proved helpful.  We suggest Manny's and Emerline's for breakfast.  The food was very good at each.  For an evening of Italian food, Nicci has Sereghina's listed.  Excellent choice for Italian food.  My daughter and I highly recommend treating yourself to the Tiramisu for dessert.  It was superior. Walking through the neighborhood we felt safe.  As with anywhere, be ware of your surroundings.

Now about Nicci,  What an angel!  And I mean that.  She was so kind enough to wait up for us for a midnight arrival.  And before we even arrived, she was in constant communication with regarding the accommodations and the numerous questions I had about the area.  During our stay she would periodically check on us to make sure everything was going well.  Just a true blessing to us.  She is part of the reason we will be coming back to her place.  Forget the high priced New York hotels.  Stay here because it like staying at a cozy home.  Also, the area is going through revitalization with new restaurants, businesses, and remodel of apartments.  This area will be the next "place to stay" in New York area.

I am most definitely bringing my wife  and mother to stay here or any time I am in the area for business or pleasure.  Loved the apartment and loved Nicci.

Nicci and David were so easy to work with and their house is gorgeous. I had rented it for my parents as they were coming to visit from Ohio. I wanted them to stay in Brooklyn for this stay and I think Nicci and David's place was exactly what we were all looking for. The space was as clean as could be and, even though Nicci and David were out of town, they were extremely hospitable with checking in on the daily to make sure my parents were ok and they were comfortable.

If you're in Bed Stuy and need a place to stay, I'd highly recommend The Hancock House.
This place is awsome, i was able to move back qnd foward to the city. Great people. #Houston
Nicci was a great, generous host and was really accommodating with our awkward arrival and departure times. The apartment was lovely, stylish and spacious (especially for New York).

My fiance and I came down for a wedding nearby and were so happy we found the Hancock House! It was our very first AirBnB experience and it was a great one. We would 100% stay here again. Nicci and David made you feel right at home and completely comfortable and were very accommodating. They were very responsive from booking to check out, even helping us know which subway lines to take. It was super close to the subway station which was convenient for us as we were carrying a bit of stuff. The house is exactly as pictured - super clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. The fridge had the essentials in it, which was greatly appreciated. The patio out back was nice to sit in at night with a bottle of wine. There are a lot of great restaurants close and the book they have in the kitchen is great to help you find them. We felt safe walking around, even late at night but as with anywhere in the city, be aware of your surroundings and where you are walking. 
Looking forward to coming back some day and hopefully for longer!

Nicci and David were the perfect hosts. Regardless of our unorthodox check-in/check-out time, both Nicci and David made themselves available to greet us at the door. They were always easy to get a hold of by text or email.

My wife and I have a tendency to be more private and stay to ourselves. That being said, Nicci and David managed to still be very helpful. They left more than enough linens and essentials for us to use. They were even kind enough to leave us an extensive book of recommendations for dining and shopping within the neighborhood if we were so inclined.

The listing was EXACTLY as listed. Not a single thing looked out of place. It was clean and all the amenities (wifi, A/C, etc.) worked as advertised and kept us comfortable.

During the day, the neighborhood was bright and lively. You felt safe walking everywhere. I would caution that walking home at a very late hour (4 AM) might feel a little less safe but this could be said of almost any neighborhood in the world. Regardless of the time of day, we felt perfectly safe and sound when we stayed within Hancock House. The security to the house seemed like more than enough.

If we visit NYC/BK again, we will be sure to stay with Nicci and David again and would HIGHLY recommend them to everyone we know!

We can really recommend this apartment located in a charming and pleasant street in Brooklyn. It is relatively close to public transportation that can take you into Manhattan. But there is also much to see in the immediate area. New and nice restaurants of different variety, such (Website hidden by Airbnb) which is absolutely worth a visit.
The hosts to the home, David and Nicci has many more tips on restaurants and bars, and they will gladly tell you.
We had a wonderful week and can most trust to recommend others to rent this apartment.
The apartment is cozy and in very good condition, private entrance and with the possibility to use the patio for example, eat breakfast or just relax for a while.
The hosts were very helpful and easy-to communicate with.
Anders & Ulrika

We really enjoyed our stay at Hancock House!  Nicci and David were great hosts.  The brownstone was full of charm, extremely clean and the little touches of providing coffee (and REAL cream!), books on history of Brooklyn as well as directions to nearby restaurants were very much appreciated. This was our first AirBnB experience and we highly recommend Hancock House.  If you enjoy architecture and going off the beaten path, Hancock House is perfect!  Many thanks!  Brad and Lisa

Het e-mailcontact verliep erg goed. David en Nicci zaten op de stoep voor het huis op ons te wachten, dat gaf een welkom gevoel. We mochten alles aan hen vragen, maar we hebben ons prima gered. Nicci had in een boek tips voor restaurants gezet en dat waren hele goede keuzes. 
Het huis is ruim, met een prettige woonkamer. De woonkeuken is ook erg mooi, de koelkast was gevuld met dingen om de eerste dagen een ontbijt thuis te nuttigen. Heel erg attent. 
Wij moesten wel even wennen aan de buurt; veel sirenes etc. Maar het is een hele gezellige wijk met gezellige en originele restaurants. Ga beslist lunchen en bij "Peaches" op 393 Lewis, dit kan tussen 11 en 16 uur. Fantastisch eten en de sfeer is geweldig.
De metro is op 10 minuten lopen en je bent binnen 25 minuten met de expres in hartje Manhattan. 
Wij hebben een heel fijn verblijf gehad.

We had a brilliant stay at the Hancock House. The flat was great, lovely sized living room and a kitchen  stocked with essentials which would've been great to cook in had we not been so busy eating out! 
Nikki and David were fantastic hosts with excellent communication and some great recommendations of local haunts (don't miss the cocktails at Casablanca!).
We felt so at home living in the flat for a week...we didn't want to leave!
We'd definitely recommend staying here and would book again if/when we return to NY.
Emily & Nick

We loved the apartment at Hancock House. It was very close to the A and C trains which took us all over NYC. The local restaurant recommendations in Nicci's book were spot on. Due to a change in our flight we had to check in early and Nicci and David were amazing! We were greeted with fruit and english muffins :) Thank you guys for a lovely week in NYC.

Íbúðin var falleg og snyrtileg. David og Nicci voru mjög almennileg og ábendingar þeirra um veitingastaði voru frábærar. Við mælum með að prófa Peaches - þar var góð stemning! Í ískápnum voru drykkir og helstu nauðsynjar, það var mjög þakklátt fyrsta kvöldið. Það voru svolítil læti á laugardagsnóttina, kannski eins og við mætti búast í þessu hverfi. En þrátt fyrir það mælum við tvímælalaust með því að búa hjá Nicci og David.

We enjoyed our stay in Brooklyn with Nicci and David.  Convenient to Manhattan and many places to see and visit in Brooklyn.  The garden level apartment is beautiful and cozy.  Loved the decor and the original fixtures to the house.  Much better than a hotel and Nicci and David make the stay inviting!  Loved meeting your daughters and hope to be able to talk more on our next visit.  We will definitely stay here again!

The place is absolutely lovely! So well decorated and comfortable.  It felt like our own little NY apartment for the few days we were there.  Nicci was easily reachable, and such a thoughtful host.  Can't wait to come back!

My wife, two kids, and I stayed in this lovely apartment for a weekend trip to New York. Nicci kindly met us at the door despite our very late arrival and was very accommodating with letting us return the keys late on Sunday.

The apartment is very nicely decorated and comfortable. The book of restaurants in the kitchen was helpful and accurate. We were able to find parking  on the street without trouble.

The walk to the subway takes about 15 minutes with kids, 10 without. We enjoyed our stay.

Nicci and david were very hospitable and have an excellent booklet of recommendations for reataurants and bars to visit in the neighborhood. Their place is beautiful and clean, i highly  recommend it as a great place to relax while you're exploring brooklyn.

Nicci and Dave made sure that everything was arranged upon our arrival. Communication was great and LOIS super friendly and welcoming. When we entered the cozy cute apartment it was very clean and tidy and lovely decorated. We really loved the personal welcome note for Liam and also the fact that basics such as bagels and even a bottle of wine was provided. On our check out nite I could not reach a taxi and Nicci was so kid to order one for me. Thank you so much for that.

Nicci and David were fabulous and accommodating hosts with great local recommendations. The flat was immaculate and beautifully decorated. Very comfortable. The kitchen is lovely and quite large. We also very much appreciated the drinks and snacks. Thank you!!

The flat was really cosy and Nicci & David were extremely helpful. Our stay there was very comfortable and we enjoyed relaxing evening in the flat after the long walks through NY. Concerning the neighbourhood, it is probably not the nicest area of Brooklyn but it was totally uncomplicated for us. The subway is about 8 min by foot and the lines A and C bring you directly to Manhattan in 30 - 45 min.

My trip here was just as great as the first time! There was plenty of amenities. I had a busy work schedule so I was back and forth but they were extremely accommodating and even took my boyfriends number for when I wasn't there! I would 100% recommend this apartment to anyone!

This was our second trip to NYC, but our first time staying in Brooklyn. We had a fantastic time exploring Brooklyn. Nicci and Dave were very friendly. They were very helpful in suggesting plenty of places for us to visit and booked our cab to the airport. Can't wait to plan our next trip to Brooklyn!

Appartement charmant, meublé et décoré avec goût, et très pratique.
Dépannage dans le frigo très apprécié pour passer le premier jour, et informations sur le voisinage très fournie.
Emplacement idéal pour découvrir Brooklyn, et à moins d'une demi-heure de Manhattan.
David est très sympathique, dommage que nous n'ayons pas eu l'occasion d'échanger plus longtemps.
This is a great little spot, cute as a button! The apartment was well stocked with all sorts of goodies in the fridge. The hosts were very accommodating and I'd give this place an A+.

Nicci and David had the bnb setup in a manner where I felt welcome upon entering. We didn't necessarily want to run out and find food immediately upon arrival, so it was wonderful to see a few items around that we could snack on (actually they lasted throughout our week's stay) before getting a formal meal. There was also an assortment of cooking odds-and-ends that were in the kitchen area (olive oil, salt and pepper, etc) that made being away from home easier. The area of the bnb is a neighborhood called Bed-Stuy. It's a beautiful and historic neighborhood, a neighborhood that has a great vibe, but it's also a neighborhood in Brooklyn. It's not in Midtown Manhattan or a popular tourist area for first time NYC visitors. We absolutely LOVE the area, it's near where we lived in Brooklyn in the past with our kids, but be aware of the neighborhood before you jump into the bnb. I'd encourage you to stay in Bed-Stuy, but only after you realize that it's a bit more "rough around the edges" (it's not an unsafe location of course) in how it appears to a tourist than popular areas in Manhattan. That being said, if you're looking to stay in a real Brooklyn neighborhood, you can hardly do better than this spot. The house is in amazing shape. It's been beautifully maintained and has great decor throughout the bnb. This is no shabby tourist hotel! You'll be staying inside a beautiful piece of history built in the late 1800's. David and Nicci are warm and helpful when any assistance is required. They have great recs for the neighborhood (places to go, etc) and keep a great space for their guests. Also, as far as transit you'll be close to multiple helpful bus lines and have access to the express A train, which is helpful in getting around town.

Après un long voyage, se faire accueillir avec le sourire, découvrir un appartement conforme à la description ainsi que quelques denrées dans le frigo pour se restaurer avant de decouvrir le quartier!!! Mais quel bonheur!!!! Surtout passer rapidement sur la première impression que nous donne le quartier!!! Logement situé à 5 min d'une ligne de métro qui fonctionne 24/24h et vous emmène à Manhattan en 30 min, 2 épiceries bio et une superette autour du bloc. Des voisins sympas qui vous saluent et discutent facilement avec vous. Et puis Nicci et David qui sont si soucieux que notre séjour se passe pour le mieux. Présents pour répondre à toutes nos questions, nos demandes de conseils et nos besoins!!!! Quelle charmante famille!!! Hâte de revenir cette fois ci avec nos enfants!!!! Nous recommandons sans hésiter cette location. Merci encore à vous!!!!

Nicci and David were great hosts. The place is nice and just as pictured. Even though the neighbors were partying late outside in the front of their place, we didn't hear a thing and slept well on a very nice bed.

We had a great 4 weeks at Nicci and David's apartment.  It was comfortable, tastefully decorated and a good size for such a long stay.  The bath was also a big plus for us as we did lots of walking as was the comfortable bed. Friends joined us for the last week and it accommodated us all easily.  The large kitchen, the use of the outside area and two sitting areas meant four of us had plenty of room.  We all found it very homely.  We really appreciated Nicci and David's flexibility in terms of check in and check out to accommodate our flights and the advice on taxis.  Nicci and David are great hosts - very friendly and hospitable and they were responsive to our needs,  They are also good company and we enjoyed spending time with them talking about the area and life in the city, watching the girls having fun on the trampoline.  Certainly that made the place feel very much our home for the month.  The apartment is close to 2 subway lines and it has 2 bus routes on its doorstep.  This made it very convenient for getting around and it was a relatively quick trip on the A express train into Manhattan and back at night.  The area is safe to walk around at night and we found it interesting particularly as it is changing due to re-gentrification.  Mannys' nearby has the best coffee we found in NYC and good food as does the restaurant Saraghina with good bread at their bakery.  The little grocery on the corner opposite Saraghina is also good for fruit and veges as well as other staples.  Oliviani has a good wine selection. The bar Lunatico has great music at night.  We enjoyed being able to go out in the neighbourhood after a day in Manhattan and also spending the warm nights in the quiet of the back yard.  So great hosts and an apartment with everything you need in a location that isn't upmarket but is safe and interesting.

Nicci war sehr hilfsbereit und sehr nett, die Unterkunft ist perfekt für einen Aufenthalt in NYC, Brooklyn und Williamsbourg...alles sehr gut erreichbar. Bietet genügend Raum für bis zu vier Personen. Wir fühlten uns sehr wohl! Würde sofort wieder hier buchen!

Large, clean and beautiful apartment with a super well equipped kitchen.  Nicci was an excellent communicator and was able to accommodate our arrival even though our flight was delayed by more than 7 hours.  The neighbourhood can appear a little edgy, but nothing that a dose of self confidence can't overcome.

Il quartiere di Brooklyn e' immenso e molto interessante. L'appartamento di Nicci e David si trova in una magnifica posizione, molto vicino ad una fermata della linea A che collega direttamente il quartiere a Manhattan. Anche un giro a piedi nella zona merita. Il sabato mattina nelle vicinanze c'è un mercato etnico molto carino.

Nicci and David are amazing hosts. They made me and my wife feel very welcome. They also made every effort to make our visit enjoyable and easy. Nicci and Dave also gave us good tips where to eat and what to see. Check in was easy and check out flexible. Apartment was great. Clean and spacious with nice 1920's twist. We had great New York experience and they played major part in that. We have nothing but good things to say! :)

It was very easy to stay in contact with Nicci and David prior to & during our stay, and they were very welcoming when we arrived.
The apartment itself was lovely, it's very spacious and nicely decorated. The whole place was spotlessly clean. The shower was incredible, the bed was comfy and there was a coffee machine. What else could you ask for?

We have to say "Thank you" for your accommodation!
It was very comfortable and we would to recommend your apartment.

Nicci and Dave are very helpful and the communication between us was excellent.

Great thanks to you, Nicci and Dave.

This was a great appartment! It is decorate with taste and they provide some drinks and breakfast food in the fridge at the arrival which is really nice. The location is pretty nice and David recommended us some really nice places to eat and drink. Nicci was really reactive when we asked her to turn up a bit the heater ;). We woud recommend this place warmly!

Beautiful, quiet and clean. We had a fantastic stay for two weeks in this appartmentn in this charming neighborhood. Easy access to the train to get into the city and surrounded by great local food spots. Nicci & David were great hosts and on hand for anything we needed while we were there. Highly recommended

This place was really beautiful, better than the pictures. It was really comfortable and had all the amenities I could ask for. Nicci & David were beyond friendly and accommodating, and really great at efficient corespondence.

The best! I can't recommend David and Nicci's place enough. What a good find in NYC. 

This is one of the nicest Airbnb's I've ever stayed in. The apartment is in a beautiful condition having been recently lovingly renovated and the area is great. 

Super quick (and easy) to get there from Manhattan and near all of the cool stuff in Brooklyn. Loads of nice amenities nearby and the best healthfood Deli ever on the corner right next to the apartment. 

Nicci and David are super nice and friendly. They were in constant communication and really easy to get hold of. They were so flexible about when we arrived and left, even though we messed them around a bit and the apartment had everything you need in it. Right down to breakfast muffins and little cosmetics in the bathroom cupboard. Made it such a comfortable and convenient stay. 

I'll definitely be back if I come to NYC again.

This place is great - it looks exactly like the pictures and is very clean and comfortable. Nicci & David were great hosts and were quick to reply when we had questions so communication was a breeze. The place is a short walk from the train into Manhattan so getting around was easy, but there are also plenty of places around Brooklyn to check out. It was helpful to have Nicci & David's recommendations for the area as well! We also appreciated that there were some items in the fridge in case we were hungry or thirsty - nice touch. Totally recommend this place and would stay there again.
Great place decorated with great style.
Nice place convenient for visiting my daughter.

We stayed here for 4 nights and could happily have stayed for even longer. Nicci was really helpful offering recommendations for meals and a drink, and the apartment was very clean and comfortable and had great historic details and style. We slept well every night- the bed was comfortable and cozy. The bathroom shower was very nice and felt more like a hotel- nice towels, great water pressure and very clean and new. We enjoyed morning coffee in the back room (it was a bit rainy otherwise we'd have enjoyed the backyard!) and felt at ease throughout our stay. I would recommend this apartment to anyone looking for a nice slice of Bed-Stuy, well within easy access to the subway and great cafes and meals within walking distance.

Their garden apartment is super cute and wonderfully decorated. The patio was such a plus; so charming!!! The kitchen was also perfect for making a meal; and they left breakfast necessities in the fridge!  I will definitely love to stay here again!

Nicci and David are the ideal hosts. Everything was beautiful and immaculate. The apartment has lovely furnishings and fixtures, the garden in the back is delightful.  An amazing large kitchen and elegant bathroom. All the charm described was accurate!

We thoroughly enjoyed staying at David and Nicci's. The apartment was hip and elegant, the bathroom was beautiful, and the kitchen was stocked with everything we needed to o enjoy meals in the apartment. There was also a guidebook for guests with recommendations for local dining, grocery shopping etc that we found very helpful. David warmly communicated with us as needed, allowed us a later checkout, made us aware of local events, yet our stay still felt very private.

Wonderful accommodations and great hosts. Charming garden suite with so many special little touches (like snacks and wine upon arrival). Really fantastic place and good location. Highly recommend Nicci & David's place!!

My husband and me stayed for 9 days at Hancock House. Everything was just perfect. From the personal and easy check in and check out, the cleanliness, the comfort bed, the little details and personal touch of the apartment, the fully equipped kitchen, even we got changed the towels after a few days! The apartment is just a little walk from the train station "Utica" that takes you easy to Manhattan and around Brooklyn. Just around the corner there is a new supermarket and several nice restaurants and coffee bars.
Nick and David are perfect and kind hosts that made out trip to NY just more unique. 
Thank you for everything! We surely come back.
This was our first time in Brooklyn and we found great cafes, restaurants and good public transport close by. Nicci and David were terrific hosts - responsive and helpful.

Nicci and David were exceptional hosts - warm, communicative, and made check in and check out super easy. Even left us a little gift upon our exit! Their garden apartment is so beautifully renovated, cozy, and well stocked with the comforts of home. We would absolutely stay again. Thank you Nicci and David!

This was our second visit at Nicci's and David's place and for a good reason. They are possibly couple of the nicest, most hospitable and most helpful people whom me and my wife have met on our journeys. And the garden level brownstone apartment felt like home. It is clean and cozy. We could go on and on listing the pros. We have literally only good things to say.
Pretty place

Nicci and David's place is a lovely classic brownstone in Brooklyn. My wife and I arrived on a late flight and was guided by text from them to the house. The suite is on the bottom level of the house with its own entrance. It was very clean and well laid out. There were snacks in the fridge and a bottle of wine waiting for us which was much appreciated because we were hungry after the flight. With hot weather the nights were muggy but fortunately they had a fan and an air conditioner that made for a comfortable stay. We enjoyed having our morning coffee (also provided) while sitting in the backyard.
We'd venture everyday out to Manhattan on the subway which is about a ten minute walk away. I wondered how safe this neighbourhood would be late at night but every night we'd return in the AM on the subway and felt very comfortable .The people in the area are friendly and community minded and it's quiet at night. There are a number of stores, cafes and restaurants with a good selection. Nicci and David are great hosts and very helpful. We enjoyed staying there and would recommend it to friends.

The photos don’t do the apartment justice. We stayed for 1 week for our honeymoon from Australia, and we didn’t want to leave. Casablanca bar is amazing and close! Very easy to get to Manhattan. Close to Dumbo. Everything we could ever want was at Hancock house!

The most beautiful home I have stayed in, with the greatest hosts ever.  This place has everything you could need, it is incredibly beautiful, comfortable and well worth every dollar. Nicci was amazing to us. The place also had cable which was amazing for my boyfriend who loves watching sports. If you're looking to stay outside of Manhattan, this place is amazing.

si vous avez la chance de tomber sur cette annonce, n'hésitez plus réservez les yeux fermés !!!
les hôtes vont même jusqu'à vous prévoir le petit déjeuner du premier matin pour se sentir comme à la maison.

El apartamento es excelente, la dotación, la limpieza, los anfitriones muy amables, nuestra única dificultad fue por el ruido del sistema de calefacción que se comparte con el anfitrión y el ruido de la nevera un poco molesto en la noche, sin embargo ellos fueron muy amables y trataron de no poner la calefacción durante nuestra estadía pues de hecho el apartamento es calientito y no la necesitaba en esos momentos que aun el invierno no había llegado

Great place with gorgeous period interior features.
A subway ride to all the main attractions of NYC but the local Brooklyn area has some great places to visit too.
This is a wonderfully cozy spot in BK with great restaurants nearby. Nicci & David are lovely hosts and very hospitable. Would defiantly stay here again.

The space is cozy, comfortable and well-appointed. Looks just like the photos, but even more charming in person. Nicci & David have added lovely touches, like teas & snacks for breakfast or late-arriving guests. Nicci was very hospitable & checked in after a night to make sure all was going well.

Gorgeous apartment. Nicci & David generously stocked the fridge and cupboards with some extras and provided a useful, well thought out list of locals restaurants, bars and amenities. Would highly recommend!

Bed Stuy is great for a more lived-in New York experience. From what we discovered, there's more of a young, edgier crowd that's started to slowly move in. It's at the stage where there's a lot of lovely local spots popping up but it hasn't gotten close to being over-saturated (like a lot of heavily gentrified areas in Brooklyn). Also it's where they shot Do The Right Things, so what's not to like!

Wow, wow, wow, you won't be disappointed when you stay at Hancock House. Not only is spacious, beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, hosts Nicci and David truly are the hosts with the most!

Extremely friendly and welcoming they anticipated our every need, just when I thought we could do with clean towels Nicci messaged me asking if we need clean towels! One morning we woke up and it was pouring rain and at our door were two umbrellas! Seriously this woman is a hospitality goddess!

At first the neighborhood and trip to Manhattan can be a little intimidating however we found both to be really quite fine. The neighborhood has a lot of great little restaurants and bars like Chez Oscar (a gorgeous little french place where you must try the truffle fries and the cheese plate) there are also a handful or laundromats who will wash, dry and fold your washing for about a dollar a pound. We used Marmies on Malcom X, they were quick and friendly and everything came back lovely and clean in a vacuum sealed bag. 

Getting to Manhattan is also very simple, do your self a favor and and get an unlimited Metro card, we got one for $33 for 7 days, this will allow you to ride both the buses and the subway. Buses stop on Malcom X regularly and will take your right down to Utica station where you can get the A or C or  to Kosiosko station for the J and the Z lines into Manhattan, the bus will also take you right down to Williamsberg. 

I can't speak highly enough of our stay we loved New York and we loved Hancock House.

This is a place we will never forget, it was so amazing to stay here! Nicci and David’s place is so cozy, clean, and comfortable, it made staying in Brooklyn a dream. They have included all the amenities you will ever need. We arrived when it was starting to warm up, but it stayed cool and fresh in the apartment, and having the fan available to use made our stay very enjoyable. During our last day there, it looked liked it was going to rain, and they had extra umbrellas in the closet that we could use, thank you so much for that! They had fresh fruit out, and even coffee and bread for us. Nicci and David are the nicest people ever! Thank you for hosting us and checking in on us during our stay! Nicci was always available to answer any questions we had. Another plus is the subway is located a short walk away, which takes you anywhere you need to go around the city. There are also many great restaurants around the neighborhood. Nicci recommended we try Manny’s down the street, and we ended up loving that place! Thank you again for your great hospitality! :)

Nicci & David’s place was a wonderful place to stay while in New York for work. Space is clean, stylish & comfortable. They live in an incredible neighborhood close to great coffee, restaurants & shops. Amazing soaking tub for after a full days walking in the city. Highly recommended!

Мы с женой получили много удовольствия, живя в данном месте. Никки очень дружелюбная, добрая и отзывчивая хозяйка. 

Дом расположен в достаточно спокойном месте, где есть множество кафе, несколько баров и магазин продуктов прямо за углом. 

От Бруклинского моста буквально 7-8 минут на метро. От Даунтауна - 10-12 минут, до Центрального парка можно доехать чуть больше чем за 20 минут. 

Спасибо, Никки и Дэвид, за чудесный приём. 

Ваши русские друзья, Дмитрий и Варвара.

Can't say enough good things about Nicci and David's place.  Quiet, comfortable, cool enough on a hot summer evening.  They've added so many touches that make you feel welcome from a bowl of clementines to some extras you might have forgotten.  They've thought of every detail, and the apartment itself is impeccable, comfortable, roomy, and just gorgeous.  Can't wait to visit our daughter in NY again and stay here!

Fantastic clean place in Bed-Stuy. Great nearby places to eat and just blocks from the subway. Nicci was super responsive before our arrival, during our stay, and even as we were leaving. We hope to stay here again on future trips.

Nicci and David were simply amazing hosts and so helpful and hospitable. The apartment is like something from a period movie set - elegant, comfortable and with top notch amenities. We fell in love with the Bed-Stuy neighbourhood on our first trip to NYC and now can’t imagine staying anywhere else - it just wouldn’t be New York! Highly highly recommended.

Nicci and David were amazing hosts! So considerate, kind and accommodating. Their place was immaculate, thoughtfully stocked and decorated. It's absolutely beautiful inside. They had curated an extensive list of restaurants and were always there if I and my girlfriend needed anything. The apartment is conveniently positioned close to the A and C line. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Nicci and David are simply wonderful hosts ! They make you feel that you are almost at home by putting attention to small but important details when you are travelling: bread and fruits are ready for you for your 1st breakfast. Both of them respond quickly to email questions and they are always generous for suggestions. For our 1st stay in NY as a family, it was quick useful and reassuring. The apartment is decorated with a lot of taste. We really appreciate the garden where we had all our evening meals. Very enjoyable while you are in Brooklyn.

Nicci and David are excellent, responsive hosts with a beautiful garden-level apartment. The neighborhood is hip and accessible and we'd highly recommend the apartment for anyone visiting Brooklyn. 10/10 would stay again.

This place in the Bed-Stuy area is an endlessly charming garden apartment in a beautiful brownstone. David and Nicci have retained a lot of the classic charm of the unit (beautiful wood floors, embossed ceilings, a wide deep kitchen sink, molding along all the walls) and updated it with really thoughtful design, lighting, and details. The days I was in New York was a stretch of particularly hot, humid, stanky days like only NYC has, so I was endlessly grateful for the air conditioner that my hosts had installed in the front sitting room of the space. It definitely worked hard, and kept the place pleasant. 

Check in and check out were smooth and easy, and during my stay, I saw David several times, and he was a paragon of friendliness. That kindness extended to Nicci's thorough book of advice for nearby food, drink, groceries, etc. They even had a loaf of brioche in the fridge as a welcome! I prefer sleeping with plenty of pillows, and the bed had piles of them that I really appreciated. 

As I've come to expect in New York in the summers, the trains running to and from Brooklyn were more unpredictable than at other times of year as several lines were serviced, so each day involved researching the most reliable routes around the area. 

I would definitely stay here again. A great retreat for a single traveler with work or plans in Brooklyn.
Nicci and David's apartment is a lovely place to stay while in NYC - the apartment is very stylish, clean and comfortable, and there are lots of amenities close to hand too - would recommend!!
Nicci and David are amazing hosts with a beautiful space. Would highly recommend staying here to anyone looking to visit Bedstuy.

Clean, cozy and comfortable! We loved our stay in NYC with Nicci and David! We felt very at home, welcoming amenities and lovingly accommodated our scheduling from the West Coast! I can’t wait to visit again!!! Perfect home away from home!

Very charming room and atmosphere. Sparkling clean. Kitchen has plenty of pots and plates. Plenty of nice breakfast places in the neighborhood. Close to subway stations. Quiet at night. The stay was perfect! I would definitely recommend this host!

Wow! What a beautiful place to stay while visiting New York and of course Brooklyn. Location was perfect and it was a great place to return to after a day of exploring. I would definitely recommend and we can't wait to return!
Nicci and Davids home is just as they have described it and more.  We immediately felt at home and would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting NY.

Tolle Wohnung mit guter Anbindung an Manhattan. Die Wohnung selbst ist großzügig geschnitten, sehr sauber und gut eingerichtet. Die Kommunikation mit Nicci war hervorragend; nachdem das unser erster AirBnB-Aufenthalt war, hatten wir viele Fragen, die sie alle geduldig beantwortet hat. Erstklassige Gastgeber!
PARFAIT À TOUT POINT DE VUE.

Nicci and David's apartment is perfectly comfortable, and is an easy distance away from the subway, plus numerous stores, bars and restaurants. A couple of the better restaurants we went to during our NY stay were very nearby (Chez Oskar and Trad Room)! As hosts, they were in regular touch to make sure all was okay, and were quick to offer suggestions for the area. It can take a bit of time to get into Manhattan for a day of sightseeing, but it's an easy enough trip, and the upshot is being able to get back out to somewhere a little quieter at the end of the day. I can highly recommend this as a base for people looking to explore New York, or even just to get to know Brooklyn a little better.
We enjoyed our stay here. The apartment was well situated with amenities and thoughtful touches. We would definitely stay here again.

Can’t thank Nicci and David enough on their hospitality and having us in their house during our visit to New York. Highly recommend to anyone that wants to stay in Brooklyn like a local - to stay in Hancock House. Nice and safe neighbourhood as well as a great host!
Nicci and David’s place was very clean and easy to get to. They left great tips on places to be sure to check out and made us feel right at home. Would definitely recommend!

We felt instantly at home here! Expertly decorated and in a great location. We really appreciated the tips on local places to eat and drink. I would definitely recommend Nicci and David's place, a real treat.

The Hancock house is awesome! We absolutely loved roaming around the Bedford Stuyvesant neighborhood and Nicci and David‘s restaurant recommendations were on point. We explored all over Brooklyn, and those were by far our favorite restaurants! (Especially Saraghina‘s and chez Oscar) The house was clean, cozy, and really beautiful.

Nicci was very friendly and most accommodating. 

Hancock House is beautiful! We loved the space, the warmth and comfort it had to offer especially after our eventful days.

The location is only minutes away from public transport which is very frequent. Manhattan is only 20- 30 minutes by train. The 7 day metrocard pass (unlimited buses and trains) was beneficial and cost effective.

The neighborhood has great places for food and coffee. We especially enjoyed coffee at the Trad Room (also a restaurant), Halsey Traders Market was great for essentials and more... There's also a Vegan cafe next to the market.

There's a few laundromats all in short walking distance. We used The Laundry in BK - great customer service, top of the range washing machines and dyers. They have all your laundry product essentials as well as money change machines for your convenience.

Overall we loved our stay at Hancock House and would recommend to anyone visiting Brooklyn for the local experience.

Here you can enjoy a clean & comfortable area as like a Hong Kong local citizen!^^ One double bed, one bunk bed and a sofa bed are provided for you in this apartment!

Our apartment is fully furnished and we believe you will find in it all that is necessary for a comfortable stay. Come and stay in my unique Hong Kong townhouse! In the bedroom: - You can find one 4ft x 6ft double bed in one of the bedroom and one bunk bed (upper:3ft , lower:4ft) in another one.   - One sofa bed is also provided in the living room. - Perfect for up to 7 people! :) - Clean Bed linen and towels are provided. Cleaning and linen change for stays are done before your arrival. In the kitchen: - Wanna make a meal?
