Great Neighborhood, 10 min walk to subway station (N/W trains) Last stop at the N/W trains. Pl
neighborhood_overview: Safe and nice neighborhood. Great restaurants, bars, supermarkets available.
transit: 7-10 min walk to N& W trains -20 min to Manhattan midtown by train
access: kitchen and bathroom is shared by other guests.
interaction: I am usually not at home, I have other guests in the house. My assistant cleans the common areas everyday.
house_rules: IMPORTANT: Please read/ print reservation details before you arrive. Its easy and simple/ flexible. Please make sure the door password and your room name before the check-in. No additional guests allowed No Smoking in the house.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
Hi, I am a Turkish-American female professional. I work in international trading for footwear. I have been travelling to many countries with airbnb. I think it is a great website to connect people. 
I am an experienced airbnb user as a guest or as a hostess.

reviews.comments:
My sister needed to stay in New York for an academic examination. I'm posting her experience staying at Funda's place below:

Funda is sweet and friendly. Before I arrived, she gave me her phone number. Every time I asked the direction, she always replied and helped me.

The train station to Funda's place was a bit far for me, about 15 minutes walk. But the neighborhood was very quite and safe. It was safe for me to walk alone at 10 PM  there.

When I arrived, she was very welcome. Her brother helped me to carry my luggage upstair to my room. The room was pretty big for 2 people. But I felt the bed sheet was not as clean as I expected and the odor suggests that it has been used by other person staying before me. Because it is already midnight, I didn't asked her to change it. However, in the morning I told her about the sheet and she apologized. She asked me to put the sheet in the kitchen and she said she will change it.

There was also a bit problem with the water. When was I in the shower, the water suddenly stopped. But luckily I almost finished my shower. So it doesn't matter.

I was going to stay there for 2 days, but a friend told me I could stay at his place because it is much closer to the place I took the English test. So, for the second night I didn't use my room.

Logement propre et conforme à la description.
Funda est disponible et se plie aux demandes.

The room  looks the same like the picture. The house is close to public transportations and the area has a lot of shopping/dining  possibility. Convenient system to receive keys. Kitchen and bathroom well stocked. No living or dining room. Funda was always reachable. Good place for budget travel.

Funda a été très disponible durant tout le séjour (réponses très rapide aux questions).
L'appartement est propre, calme et dans un quartier très sympa, proche du métro (15 min de Manathan). Idéal pour notre séjour.
On recommande !

Funda was great host, quick to answer any questions and good communications.
The location of the house is great, there is a subway line nearby and it can take you directly to Time’s Square Central park and there are a lot of shopping and restaurants nearby the house.
 The room is comfortable, and when you just need a place to sleep and don't expect to spend a lot of time in there, it's just enough. Kitchen and bathroom well stocked.. 
Good place for budget travel 
We would recommend this place!
Yes she did. Simple but polite approach explained everything that needed to know. The place was quiet and convenient, very easy to commute into Manhattan which I needed due to my work.
we had a lovely stay at Funda's place. We met her once, felt very welcome. The neighborhood is great - safe and not far from the subway.  I would definitely recommend her place to my friends.
I Love this room! Very quiet, very clean and very affordable. If you're looking for a place in NYC to stay this is it!! It's only 20-25 minutes to manhattan!! Funda is very responsive and generous!!

Funda's place was great! I never actually got to properly meet her, but the expectations were clear and easy to follow. There was access to the kitchen and the bathrooms were very clean. It was great coming back here after traveling in cold NYC weather.

The room was great and the bed very nice. There were towels, big en comfie and also the kitchen got what you need. I just didnt use it because I was out all the time.
Is's very easy to get to the appartement, 3 blocks away from the subway.
The shopping street from astoria is also that many blocks away.

It takes you 20 min to get to Manhatten which is a very nice ride with the subway.
On your way to the sub you'll find a great little sandwich store! Def pass by it'll feed you for the whole day and isn't expensive.
Walking back home at night felt very safe, I was traveling alone and it was perfect.

I would really recommend this place!
Thanks a lot!

The location is perfect because it is a short walk to the subway to get to Manhattan. We had no problems at all, saw Funda only once and she seemed very friendly. It is also in a good neighborhood. When it comes to the house, it is a bit old and the house itself is not very clean.

I was really under the impression this was a home and we were renting a room but it's a house with 3 or more rooms, all which are rented by are rented by airbnb so a little different than expected but it was ok. We had a comfortable stay. The building is old and could used some  updating. Overall was a good clean stay and very affordable.  Only complaint: washcloths not provided and towels were old.

I really enjoyed my stay at this place. It was really well kept and easy to find. Furthermore, it was really close to the metro (N and Q line), and you also had a lot of restaurants nearby, so there was always something to do. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.
I booked this room for my friend and he was very happy. clean and quiet place! Thank you!

I had s good stay at Funda's place. The room was the same as in the airbnb pictures. It was clean, the bed clean and convenient. The bathroom, although shared was clean as well. I did not use the kitchen as I came late and left early. It is 10 minutes walk from the metro, and the commuting time from the metro station in Astoria to Times sq. was about 26 minutes. But there was always trains, and I didn't have to wait long in the station. 
Also, the walk from the apartment to the station and back felt safe to me. 
Considering the low price, it's a good stay.
The place is great. Everything was clean and organized. The price is good and close to Manhattan. I loved and recommend.

La habitación estaba más o menos limpia, aunque, el techo se caía (sí, tal cual). Además, la habitación tenía una ventana que conectaba con la habitación contigua (suite room) y si ellos encienden la luz se te ilumina toda la habitación como si tú la hubieras encendido. 
Otra cosa, la cocina, no existe. El microondas es de hace 20 años, súper pequeño. Apenas cabe apenas un vaso, y no hay fuegos disponibles para cocinar, su estado es lamentable. 
El apartamento, en cuanto a transpoete público está bien conectado durante los días de diario. Los fines de semana estás bien jodido para llegar siendo alrededor de 1h y 15min. Todo esto sabiendo bien qué lineas y donde debes cogerlo (Gracias (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps). Si además vuelves un sábado a partir de  las 8-9pm, puede llevarte aún mas. Las lineas N-Q que son las que hay que tomar durante nuestra estancia, no dejaron de tener alguna incidencia, no se si fue Spring Break o qué.

 El transporte en general de Nueva York en cuanto a información al viajero es muy decadente, con información contradictoria, en algunos casos. 

La guinda de todo, fue llegar al apartamento a las 12:45am y que una chica que trabaja para la dueña (a la que nunca conocimos) y que dijera que tenia que llamar a su jefa porque estábamos haciendo el check-out tarde e insinuando que nos podían cargar algo de dinero. Finalmente no pasó nada mas (muchas gracias).

La zona, pues está bien. Es una zona obrera y antigua, pero aparentemente segura, no tuvimos ningún problema.

We had a good stay at fundas house. We doesn't meet her in person. It seems like whole is rented to Airbnb guests. The trashcab in the kitchen and in the bathroom (where you have to put in the used toilet paper!) was not made empty in the 3 days of our stay. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. The sofas in the room was not clean (one was on really bad chape)

This apartment was an ok place to stay in New York, though for the price a few things would need to be improved to make it competitive.

Pluses:
Room was a good size
Bed was comfortable
Plenty of chairs and sofas to rest on
Instructions were very clear, easy check-in and check-out
Location was lively but not too loud, with public transport to the centre nearby.

Minuses:
No reply to emails (two sent over two months), however Funda immediately responded when called, so not a big issue.
Nail heads poking out of the floorboards in the bedroom and kitchen - this ended up ripping my sock and hurting my foot, could easily be fixed.
Window frames in bedroom were covered in electrical tape - windows  appeared to be slightly open but could not be adjusted (opened or closed), letting in cold air and noise.
Water was pooling underneath the floorboards in the kitchen near the sink.
While cleaners were present and the place wasn't dirty, it was also not well-cleaned.

In its current state, the apartment isn't at the same standard as others in its price range, however with a few improvements it would be a good place to stay.

Everything was OK, Funda was helpfull, we arrived at night and she called us to tell us, how we get to the house, beacause we didn´t read the instructions very well :-) . 
The house was clean, room was OK, bathroom next to the room. Subway - 10 minutes walking and then 20 minutes to the center. Next time I would stay here again.

The house is a little bit old, but the room is clean and comfortable. It's close to LGA airport. The only problem is that the host was not home and when I sent the message to her, she did not reply me

Actually we didn't see Funda or anyone else. Just because there was no need :) Beautiful, quite and secure region. Groceries and Coffee stations are nearby. Room was clean and nice. I think in our next trip we will stay here again. Thank you!

We stayed for 9 days to Fundas place , we are satisfied with the accomodation, the picture of the room was exactly the  same  on the house , she replied to our queries promptly , there is someone who cleans the rest room and kitchen  everyday , and gave us new towels and sheets after 4 days , the cleaning lady is very accommodating , but the rest room  you share to the other room  would cause problem  because you share the rest room / shower room to other people,  on the other room of 6 people and the amenities like free coffee and hairdryer is only available upstairs accomodation  but you can get it if nobody uses it,  and  there's  no mirror in the room, perhaps ms Funda could provide one ,,

Pros: The location is good, it's a quiet neighborhood and it is in walking distance to train and bus stations. It also have really nice restaurants just a few blocks away. House is clean and easy to access. There was always paper towels, toilet papers, clean towels and hand soap available. It's great for traveling on a budget but there's always room for improvement. 

Cons: First night without a/c or fan and only one window could be open. The third night the a/c wasn't working properly (due to rain going inside the unit), I ended up turning it off and going back to the window option. There are skylights between the bedrooms and if one leave the lights on, the other room also illuminates (not fun when you're trying to sleep). I never had the chance to meet Funda, which I think would have been nice. A nail head is poking out of the floor by one of the windows, I stepped on it but luckily noticed it on time without getting hurt.

The inside of the house is basically multiple rooms that are rented individually, this could be a pro or a con, depending on your taste on sharing spaces with other guests (e.g. having to wait for 3 or more people to use the bathroom before you can shower).

Me and my bf stayed in the room for the weekend. The neighborhood is quite nice and quiet, Funda gave detailed guidelines in the house manual and also inside the room. It's an old house and but the room is tidy, the only thing is the room is right next to another airbnb room, the  re is less privacy.

Overall, I had a very nice stay. The neighborhood was safe, 10 minute walking distance from subway and near plenty of good food. The air conditioning worked well and the room was basic, but comfortable. Funda responded quickly and was helpful. She also provided towels and shampoo. I would definitely stay here again, although, I would bring my own sheets-- I wasn't 100% sure they were clean. Either way, I slept great. Bottom line: $50 (ish) a night for a safe room in NYC... I'll take it!

숙소가 있던 동네가 안전해서 좋았습니다. 그 전숙소에 동네는 다소 위험해보여 일찍들어오고 했습니다. 지하철이 가까운듯 먼곳에  있습니다. 물론 적응하면 괜찮아집니다. 
 숙소가 낡았었습니다. 그러다보니 걸을때 삐걱거리고 첫날 밤에는 숙소가 오히려 바깥 동네보다 더 무섭다고 느껴지기도 했습니다.

My stay at Funda's house was very good. From the very beginning to the very end I felt comfortable. Although I didn't meet the owner, I was provided with every details needed to enter a house and the room, how to use everything. The written briefing was clear, so I hadn't have any confusions. 
Public transportation is few minutes away, travelers can easily reach Manhattan in 30minutes.
Hi altough I did not meet Funda she was always available and comunicative. The neighbourhood is nice and safe easy enough to get to manhatan and rest out of the hussle and bustle.
Excellent

I was welcomed by Nelson the house Menager, room was ready for my arrival,  
public facilities were clean, shower & toiletes, kitchen.
We came in an unconventional hour & nelson Checked us in,
that was very helpfull.

We were welcomed by the house manager and found everything according to the listing. Public transportation is about 10 minutes away and Manhatten about a 30 minute ride. We were were comfortable and would definitely stay again.

El lugar es recomendable. Empiezo por las cosas negativad, tuvimos problemas edilicios, al llegar el techo del cuarto estaba a punto de caerse y a las pocas horas se desprendieron muchos paneles. Lo repararon el mismo día y no nos causó daños porque no estábamos en ese momento en el cuarto. Luego el co host nos quiso mudar de cuarto para pintar sin poder especificarnos por cuanto tiempo. Le expresamos que no queriamos mudarmos porque era mucho trastorno y pospuso el trabajo de pintura sin inconvenientes. El segundo día no hubo agua caliente en todo el día, tuve que bañarme con agua fría. Hacia la noche estaba resuelto. Nos desapareció mucha comida de la heladera que teníamos preparada para una noche y el almuerzo siguiente. Aparentemente la tiró personal de limpieza provisorio que trabajó en ausencia del co host. Nos recompenzaron económicamente, aunque con una pequeña suma que no llegó a cubrir los costos y el esfuerzo de haber cocinado y luego tener que salir muy tarde a la noche a comprar. En el anuncio dice que está a 20 minutos de Manhattan, pero son 30. La limpieza y organización del lugar en general fueron muy buenas, la ubicación está muy bien, el barrio es pintoresco y parece ser seguro, no tuvimos problemas. El cuarto era luminoso y amplio, acorde a la imagen. El co host estuvo siempre disponible (excepto un fin de semana) y nos fue resolviendo los inconvenientes de manera rápida.
Well we didn't see funda but she left the keys at the door for us coz where late when we got there... I have no problem staying in the it was really nice.. can't wait to come back again
I never met the host, but arrival was great as only needed a code for outside door and key was in room door.  Very convenient location to restaurants.  10 min walk to train.

It's a very old house and you hear every movement made. Our room was really cold and the radiator did not work. There was no seating area in the kitchen and the kitchen itself was not appealing. The house is rather far from Manhattan, will definitely pay more for location next time.

Clean & Quite 
Close to restaurants & bars

¡Gracias por todo a Funda!, aunque no tuvimos la oportunidad de conocerla personalmente, estuvo al pendiente desde nuestra estadía. Buscamos otras opciones  para Nueva York y esta fue una de las mejores en cuestion de costo; sin embargo, se encuentra un poco retirado de Manhattan y evaluando transporte sería cuestión de considerar esta parte para la próxima, ya que el Transporte es muy caro.
This place is awesome for staying!

O lugar é simples, mas corresponde ao preço cobrado. Fica próximo do aeroporto e de estação de trem para chegar a Manhattan. Os lençóis estavam limpos e o banheiro também. O único problema é o piso que é de madeira e faz bastante barulho. Não existe um isolamento acústico dos quartos. Os outros hóspedes não fizeram barulho, mas a gente fica sempre preocupado em se movimentar e incomodar.

If you prefer sleeping in quiet and darkness, I don't recommend. If you're ok with a hostel-type situation, go for it. The room is huge (there are two couches!) and the house is immaculate. 

I was here for a week on business and the people in the room next to me (there were five or six people) were so loud late into the night (after 11-11:30ish). They slammed doors, stomped, yelled, etc. I didn't mind it on the weekend, but it was obnoxious on the weeknights. Fortunately when I contacted Funda she spoke with them. They were quiet.

This also meant sharing a single bathroom between 6-7 people. That can be problematic.

My last complaint is that, unless the neighboring room is unoccupied, you may not have the luxury of sleeping in the dark. There is, for some strange reason, an opaque window between the two bedrooms. My neighbors were night owls (whereas I had to go to bed for work) so there wasn't a single night that they were there when I was able to sleep in the dark. I had to put a shirt over my head.

Like I said, Funda and Nelson were wonderfully. I would absolutely recommend the place for those who appreciate cleanliness and don't mind a very communal environment.
Worth it. Good place indeed.!
I will recommend this place for short and long stay. I think it is the best guest house in Astoria Queens New York.no problem except for a few nails in the floor.
Nice location
P
As my previous stays all went smoothly and I will be back
Funda's place is clean and tidy. Really friendly too!

Although the pictures on the app looked much better than the actual space itself, this air bnb did its job, and it was very cost-efficient. Was hoping to meet the host, maybe next time. Excellent location in Astoria. Would definitely stay again.
Great, clean, easy. I'll definitely come back.
Friendly hosts, convenient location!
D
It's nice and cozy, it's basically a bed and bathroom you get which is what is advertised. Didn't have any problems.
房屋地点非常好,出行方便｡house用木地板,所以隔音效果欠佳,房屋略旧,总体感觉还行｡房东很好,回复非常及时,在墙上还贴着推荐的餐厅和附近可以游玩的地方｡
Very worth it; comfortable bed and couches.

I stayed at Funda's place for board exams and the room had everything I needed. I would stay again. She let me keep my luggage near the door when my room wasn't ready yet so I would not have to waste a day in NYC dragging my luggage around. 

Room: The bed was very comfortable. It came with 4 pillows and I slept like a baby at night. There was two couches, study table, and a/c available in the room. It has everything you need if your the type to explore the city and come back home to rest at the end of the day. I got a room key so that my stuff will be locked and secured. 

Bathroom- I was given towels for my stay. Very clean bathroom, they cleaned it everyday. It was a walk-in shower. 

Transportation: It was a 4 minute walk to the 101 bus station or a 10 minute walk from the N/W train stations. About 15-25 minute subway to Manhattan. 

Other amenities: The kitchen was shared. I used the microwave and refrigerator and didn't have any problems with them. Entering in/out was convnient as there's a keyless entry. Wi-Fi was fast and never had a problem with it. 

Overall: Great value, quiet neighborhood, extremely clean Airbnb.

The house is super clean and comfortable, the host was very nice and the communication was smooth. In case you decided to cook, you can find all the equipments you need in the kitchen. 
The neighborhood is very quiet, close to alot of restaurants and bars. There is a grocery store across the street, they have good bagels in case you had a lazy morning. 
Very close to the subway too.
We will definitely come back if we decided to stay in Astoria again!

Great place to stay. Quite. I was travelling continuously and was looking for a place for a full day rest. I got the right location. Grocery and restaurants are just steps away from home. 

Communication about the place and house rules and well provided. Would definitely prefer to stay here again.
Great place to stay - as described - good location!

I had a wonderful time here! Not too far from the subway, and was a very quiet area. I've stayed in the area before and I used to hear the subway all night but this location was perfect! I think this is a great place to stay for someone's first trip to New York on a budget because the price is unbeatable and depending on the person, it allows them to kinda relax after a long day in the city with a lot less people in the area vs staying somewhere in Manhattan! Overall I had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again!

혼자 여행하는 여자분이라면 절대 피하세요. 우선 숙소가 위치한 동네는 밤이 되면 상당히 위험한 분위기를 풍기는 동네입니다. 할렘가도 가봤는데, 오히려 할렘가가 더 안전해 보일 지경이었어요. 혼자 걷기에 무서워서, 밤이 되면 우버를 타고 집으로 돌아와야 했습니다. 숙소 컨디션 역시 사진과 매우 다릅니다. 사진은 매우 코지해보이지만, 실제로는 모든 것이 아주 열악합니다. 쇼파 곳곳에 곰팡이가 쓸어있는것은 물론이고, 방문 역시 때가 타고 매우 낡은데다 허술합니다. 제공하는 수건에서는 안좋은 냄새가 나구요. 마지막 날은 누군가 제 방문을 열려고 시도해서 결국 숙박을 하지 못하고 도망쳐 나와 공항에서 노숙을 해야했습니다. 이에 대한 집주인의 답변 역시 충분하지 않았습니다. 동네나 숙소의 상태 모두, 여자 혼자 숙박하기에 적절한 곳은 아닙니다.
The neighborhood and location are perfect. There are local restaurants and grocery stores around.

Funda's place was exactly like the pictures. The room was very clean, comfortable and for the summer has a great AC. It was easy to find and the check in was a breeze. The location is great and very walkable to the subway.  The price was perfect. Because there is other rooms also for guests be prepared that it feels a little bit like a small hostel. Though interaction with others is very limited, besides sharing the bathroom. If you have that expectation in mind then it shouldn't be a problem. If you want very secluded experience that's basically a private hotel, than this isn't it. Overalls as a single female solo traveler I didn't have any problems and felt relatively safe for being in a city. I would stay here again!
Thanks Funda!  Comfortable lodging  - would recommend and stay again!
Not good than the pic shown. The floor is noisy and the public area is not clean enough. The host is almost unreachable.
Nice large bright room, easy commute to Manhattan
Great Host and good comfortable place to stay - highly recommend.

5-6 rooms across 2 floors, 1 bathroom and minimal kitchen each floor; property is undergoing renovations as I type; property noticeably "more worn" than pictures show, with renovations addressing some of wear-and-tear issues; excellent communication during reservation process but not after arrival, even about serious maintenance issue (couldn't open our door; we were stuck inside until we figured a way to squeeze out then in).  operates more like a boarding house than a "real" AirBNB.  great location for us - near relatives and excellent places to consume food:  Queens Room for coffee and more; Brooklyn Bagels for, well, *real* bagels; Loukoumi for the best Greek food and hospitality we've found outside of Greece.
Η φιλοξενία είναι πολύ καλή , η τοποθεσία ικανοποιητική,ο χώρος καθαρός, αξίζει !

Funda’s place is a great option to stay in NYC. The room is spacious, peaceful and comfortable, with the bathroom and the kitchen next to, both always very clean. The location is one block to a bus stop and three to Astoria subway station, who is 20 minutes to Manhattan center. Funda and Johanne are very kind people, always available to help. TOTALLY RECOMMENDED!!

Okay value if you're just in New York visiting and not plan on being in the room the whole time. Don't expect extravagance for the price you are paying. The pictures aren't an accurate representation of the room.
Best AIRBNB deal in NYC!! I stayed here 2 years ago, the improvements are amazing! Funda is a great host, very responsive!
This apartment’s in a great location to enjoy Astoria and a quick subway ride into Manhattan. Everything was clean and prepared.
There was problems with the heating and we spend 7 days in cold room. They fixed it for the last couple of days. The house was really clean.

We did not stay to this house, we were transferred to Funda's personal apartment and we were sharing the kitchen and bathroom with her. The place is quite good and comfortable except the very old bathroom style. But it is quite ok for those who want to spend just a couple of days in NY in a quite area but very close to Manhattan, just 10 min away by metro. It is a good value for money.

If you are on a real budget and looking for a cheap place to stay in a very over inflated airbnb market this place is probably a good place to stay in New York. But it is very basic and you should bear in mind there are a lot of other airbnb guests in the building , in particular next door is a room for up to 6 people which can make it quite loud and crowded if occupied. It is also a good 10-15 minute walk from the subway which might not normally be an issue but in the winter months when I stayed.
Nice place to stay!
Great value clean, quite comfortable space.
Check In is simple and a very easy bus ride over from LGA. Basic room, shower, and good WiFi.
En la casa se quedan más personas, es muy incómodo y yo no lo sabía. Tenía que compartir baño con muchas personas, no me sentí segura durante mi estancia y había basura en el piso.

I did not like the place and left after 1 day of my stay, 
Funda was co-oeprative and made full refund the days i did not stay.

Funda's place is quite basic and comes as described. Price-Value is very good for NY and the connection to the Times Square is easy (40 mins max., most of it is the relaxed ride on the metro). During our stay the window wouldn't close completely and was fixed with some foil. This was okay with the electric heater in the room but made the room always be a little drafty.
We didn't meet Funda in person but she was really quick to respond when we needed help, for example to figure out that the shower would turn warm when turned up completely.

La maison est en mauvais état globalement. Fenêtres à refaire car il y a plein de courant d'air dans la maison, planché cassé etc.. Heureusement le chauffage de notre chambre fonctionné bien, les sanitaires sont en bon état et c'est propre. Un peu roots selon moi.

Funda’s place is awesome and worths it, the neighborhood is safe. The pre-arrival communication with funda was great that she responds quickly and answer all the question. 
After- arrival: the place is so close to LGA, ONLY took less than 10 dollars by taxi to get to the place. 
Pros: close to the airport, and able to self-check in, dishes/cooking supplies are provided
- room conditions: great condition, bed is cozy and blanket is warm, able to lock the door, shared washroom is clean
Con: the closet subway n/m lines close from Friday 111ish pm- Sunday evening, so if you wanna take subway, the second closest one is 30-min walk for E line. I took taxi. Also, it only cost $16 to get to soho by Uber pool. 
- room: I stayed in the first floor, so I heard some noise while people who lived in the second floor were walking. Other than that, everything’s perfect. Really worths it for people who wanted to live close to LGA.

I recommend it.

It’s great for the price of the room. Needed an inexpensive place to stay for a few nights. Has more of a hostel feel than someones house. i could walk to the train in under 10 mins. Like that the train is the last/first stop, can’t get lost on my way to Manhattan! Took me about 45 mins to get to midtown.

This was a pretty no-nonsense place to stay while visiting NYC on a budget. It's easy enough to get to Manhattan on the subway from this place; if you're the kind of traveler who doesn't need a lot of guidance or hosting, this is a good place for you. You can check in and out easily without coordinating with the host. The whole place was clearly just an AirBnb and very minimally appointed, so if you're looking for a slice of home life it's not here. That said, it's hard to beat the price.

Highly recommended!
We had a very pleasent stay at Fundas house, only 15  subway-minutes away from Manhattan in a very nice neighborhood in Astoria (Queens)!
Cousy little bedroom, a kitchen and 2 bathrooms to use and fast wifi connection! 
Perfect for a citytrip you wont be in your room for long anyway!
All that at a very affordable price!
Communication with Funda also worked perfectly via (Hidden by Airbnb) /phonecalls,
so thank you for everything,

Serap & Peter
Funda’s place was perfect for our night in NY just what we needed affordable, great location and comfortable accommodations.
It’s good find for the price. Only if you’re staying by yourself.

This airbnb would have received 5 stars if it weren't for two huge issues. First, the wood around the lock on our door was chipping away badly. The screws to the lock itself were coming out and I had to push the screws in every time I wanted to close the door. Secondly, there were rusty nails sticking out of the floor by the foot of the bed. This is a terrible potential health problem.

Great place to stay if you don’t want to spend too much money! Easy access to Manhattan. The location is lively with lots of places to eat nearby. It’s also quiet at night. Funda responds within minutes, which is great and reassuring.

Hospitality of hostess and especially Johanna were absolutely outstanding. I can rave enough about how clean and accommodating Johanna was. She made sure that everything was immaculate, which is extremely important in an Airbnb. She recommended local areas that I could eat and hangout. She went above and beyond to make my stay welcoming. Funds is very lucky to have such an amazing employee.
Good location. In the greek district. 10 minute walk to the closets subway station
Worth the price. Nice location and nice host

Pretty decent Airbnb for the price. Relatively clean. Relatively quiet. The locks are a little iffy. Getting to the subway is about 10-15 min walk. Easy to come and go at any hour. Bathroom was decent. Nothing really spectacular but just a good value for decent quality and convenience.

There is quite a bit to say about this place so I tried my best to point-form it into "The Good", "The Bad", and "The Ugly". If you'd like a detailed description please read on! I tried my best to make this a totally impartial view of my stay!

The Good:

1. The Neighbourhood:

 I couldn't be happier with the location of this Air B&B is. The train is a 10 minute walk from the house and it runs 24/7. There are lots of great  coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance all with great food and prices! 

2. The Price:

 Much more affordable for a trip to NYC. We were able to stay more days with this house without breaking the bank! 

The Bad:

1. It's Shared Living:

 The simple room is next to the Astoria Suite (which holds up to 5 people) this also means you'll be sharing a bathroom, hallway, and house with more than the guests in your party. Get ready for bathroom wait times and noise from the hall. Our neighbours happened to be 5 teenagers who liked to indulge in the night life.

2. Broken Amenities:

I understand it's hard to keep up with a big house... The problem here came with the doors and the toilet. All the doors in the house don't shut properly (due to age and damage) and the toilet barely works... The flusher was falling out. There were some holes in the floor and holes In the windows (which caused problems when it poured rain one night.)

3. Not the cleanest place:

The floors were dirty. The bed was stained. The carpet was filthy and the couch was musty. We were able to handle it as we were just sleeping in the room but still we were expecting cleaner from the pictures. The carpet is also covering a whole in the floorboards. 

The Ugly:

1. ANTS???

We found an ant on the bed... Then another.... And another... Soon we realized the room was covered in ants. The first night we slept uneasy... Not even going under the sheets due to the amount of ants. We would come back to the room to find ants all over the table and furniture... So we had to be extra careful about leaving food and garbage. A few ant traps could fix this problem.

2. A Weird shared window.

So there are glass bricks at the top of the ceiling which are shared between both the simple room and suite. If one light is on both rooms are lit. So we had a sleepless night when the neighbours kept their light on. I'm not sure why this window is even there... It could be fixed with a curtain.


In Summary:

The place is great if you want a simple place to stay. If you're looking to be in town for longer than a week though may be a bit tougher.

Other rooms in this home are rented out to other airbnb residents so you get to interact with a lot of other people from other places. However, there was only one bathroom downstairs for everyone so communication was definitely key if you wanted to plan to shower and leave the house at certain times. The room is private so you still feel like you get your own place, even though it can get loud at times if your neighbors are not respectful. Overall, Funda was great with responding to everyone's needs and concerns to make the place feel safe.
Great location, clean and easy instruccions.
The location of the house was really good and it was easy to go to the city centre bye public transport. Our room was cosy. Thanks for the nice stay!!

Close proximity to multiple Metro stops. Motion sensor lighting makes coming and going at night easy and safe. Room was spacious, and homelike/very comfortable. The Astoria area is friendly and very walkable, too!
It's a safe and quiet neighborhood.  It's a place for those who are in a tight budget to stay in a big and expensive city like NYC.

Funda's place was just as described and perfect for a simple stay. The check in and instructions were very helpful and clear.  It's 10 blocks to the N train.  The place was quiet and comfortable and clean.

Loved this neat little room! I saw some review that made a comment about it not being clean, or having ants or something... couldn't be further from the truth... you can tell Funda takes great care of this very stylish little space. The check in and check out process is great and easy.   The bed is comfy.  Great having a full couch, shelf, and desk and chair as well.
The place is not monitored and needs maintenance.
The location is close to the subway. Overall not bad!

She didn’t let me know that the water was going to be turned off that morning as the maintenance man came to work on it. So much for the convenience of it being next to the airport when I couldn’t shower or brush my teeth before I left. 

Also, take a really close look at the pictures to get a better sense of how the place isn’t as pristine as the first couple of photos would suggest.

My stay at Funda’s was truly a classic example of “you get what you pay for”. The first problem I had was how hollow the walls were. You could hear everything from the room (people walking up/down the stairs, loud conversations, the ppl next door/upstairs). She didn’t have basic accommodations like wash clothes or an iron/ironing board. The kitchen had 3 microwaves and only one of them worked and the oven was out of service as well so we had to eat out the whole time. I’d recommend this spot to someone on a tight budget in need of a room for a night or two. That’s about it, I wouldn’t stay there again.
Very good place and will plan to be there again.
The location is nice!
What you see is what you get. Quiet area and a friendly host
Nice location, fairly clean, but unorganized check in. No clear instruction on what room was ours and what they gave us was not the room in the pictures.
Basic room but clean. Price is reasonable and location is close to subway. Hospitability great by Funda. A few newer amenities for kitchen will make it  5 star
Alojamiento barato y muy bien comunicado con el centro

Window air conditioners in both bedroom and living room. Full size bed in bedroom. 3rd Floor walk up. You can travel to midtown in 25 minutes. Good access to restaurants, grocery stores, laundromats, banks, and hospital.

Located 2 blocks for 168 subway stop (A-C-1 lines). $1300 per month or $2500 for July 1 - August 25th This apartment features a separate bedroom, separate living room with door that closes, and kitchen with dishwasher, gas stove, and full size refrigerator. Window air conditioners in both bedroom and living room. Full size bed in bedroom. 3rd Floor walk up. You can travel to midtown in 25 minutes. notes: Looking for a gay friendly individual who is clean, relaxed, and friendly.

A copy of the bill will be supplied if usage exceeds threshold. No smoking, no pets. No loud noises permitted between 11PM - 7AM The apartment must be left in a clean condition upon check out, including bathroom and kitchen left in sanitary condition.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I am a pretty friendly and sociable guy. I like spending time with my friends and family. I enjoy reading, writing, and a variety of creative projects. I am the General Manager of an Off Broadway Theatre Company, and also own my own company helping emerging artists developing their career. I enjoy enjoy cooking, hiking, and trying new things. I spend a lot of time working, but I love my job so I dont mind it. In my spare time, I like to see friends a family....going to movies, dinner, walks, or just visiting. Overall, I think I am pretty low key and laid back, but I definitely am also up for an adventure.

reviews.comments: Honest host who helped me in my first week in NYC to learn a few things. Comfortable place in entertaining neighborhood.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Very out going

reviews.comments: The apartment very accurately met the description provided on Air BNB. Not just cozy and spacious but also very clean, accessible and in a GREAT part of Astoria. Leo Mizrahi was incredibly kind and accommodating. Without a doubt, the best person I have dealt with on Air BNB. I would recommend this apartment to anyone staying in New York for more than a few days.

This apartment is not glamorous and Astoria is an area of New York little visited by tourists.

But Leo was a very friendly, helpful host, the place was comfortable and clean and we really liked Astoria - a place where people really live, with real shops and great supermarkets and cafes.

Leo's apartment was perfect for our stay.  The three of us were very comfortable.  Beds were great and the apartment was very clean. Location was close to wonderful restaurants and a grocer around the corner.  Because my flight came in early, Leo made arrangements for an early check-in.  If we needed anything we knew we could call Leo.  Looking forward to returning to NY.  Thanks Leo!!!

If you are looking for a charming non-hotel environment in which to stay near NYC, consider Leo's apartment.  Convenient to the subway (four blocks away),  shopping (Key Foods is one block away), with numerous restaurants and shops everywhere in the neighborhood, but yet very quiet inside, it was the perfect place for our NYC stay. To cut down on our expenses, we were able to cook our dinners using Leo's kitchen equipment.  In fact we kind of became like true New Yorkers taking the subway home from the city in the evening, hitting Key Foods for groceries and not sitting down  to eat until 8-9pm!  Anyway, Leo keeps a lovely and immaculate apartment, one I would most definitely rent again.
Leo's apartment was great ! It was cozy and had all the amenities you would ever need. I stayed there for about 5 weeks and had a great time !

We spent the Labor Day weekend at Leo's place. We got late in Astoria because of traffic but he accommodated us and made sure we were all settled. We arranged a late check out which saved us some hassle. The place is in the mids of everything. It's was very clean and cute! Leo was a great host and I would rent his apartment again!

Leo was very nice and hospitable. The apt is very well kept and clean. Leo left clean towels and sheets, a hair dryer, blankets. The apt has air conditioner, tv with cable + teevo, playstation to watch movies. it is near the heart of Astoria, it is a very safe area and served by the metro, so it is very easy to get to Manhattan. I def suggest this place to anybody who wants to stay in NY comfortably.
My parents stayed at Leo's apartment while visiting me and my family in Astoria and it was a great location for what we needed.

The apartment was excellent. Lots of room. Well maintained and clean. Quiet. Everything worked well. Leo was very flexible regarding check-in and check-out. Astoria is a great neighbourhood to stay in. Lots of resources locally, and easy to get into Manhattan.

We were scheduled to arrive in NYC on the day of the Superstorm, and Leo was very flexible in allowing us to change our arrival and departure dates. He also made a tremendous effort, in very difficult circumstances, to get the apartment ready, despite power outages and transportation difficulties. During our stay he was available by phone to answer questions and get help as needed. The location is convenient, with lots of stores nearby; the apartment was clean, comfortable and very suited to our needs (even having 2 friends come to visit). The  kitchen was well supplied for cooking and preparing meals. Overall it was a good place for us to stay, even in the midst of the aftermath of the storm!

Leo was a perfect host... the place was as advertised... clean, spacious, nicely decorated with a male's taste.  The area was great....within blocks from dry cleaning, supermarket, gym, restaurants, night life.  Great area, great location!!!  The apartment was quiet and cozy.  I certainly enjoyed my stay there.
Me fue excelente, bien ubicado el apartamento, todo en buen estado lo recomiendo

Leo was really kind in meeting with me and showing me how everything worked in his apartment. It's comfortable and very clean, with a good location and a neighbourhood vibe. Very convenient if you're going to Upper Midtown, only a couple subway stops. Thanks Leo!

I recently stayed at Leo's apartment, and recommend the experience.  Leo was courteous and responsive via text when I had questions during my stay.  The apartment is quiet (on the back of the building) and has all the basic necessities.  The Astoria location is very convenient to New York Sports Club, supermarkets, restaurants and a short walk to subway.

Leo's place is very comfortable, and I enjoyed staying there. It's in a great location, close to everything on 30th Ave. 

Only thing is that he does not have a well stocked kitchen. So if you are staying for a long time and want to cook meals, it might not be the place for you. There are so many great places to eat nearby, so most likely this will not be a problem. It's a good thing I asked Leo in advance if he has a coffee maker, because he does not. Fortunately, I have a little drip thing that goes over the cup, which is easy to take with me. Otherwise there are lots of places close by to get coffee (I just like to have mine first thing in the morning). 

Leo was very nice and helpful. He communicated with me via text, and replied very promptly to my questions. So, yes, I would recommend staying there.

Very stylish apartment (awesome chandiler) and excellent location.  It was an easy walk to all the local bars. Our stay was super comfortable and Leo was an excellent host and very hepful. A true NewYork experience, I definitely recommend staying here!
Leo's place was great! Clean, neat, and looked just like the pictures.Great neighborhood, with quick access to everything you need, it was perfect and Leo was a great host.

Astoria is fantastic if you want to see how New Yorkers live. The apartment was very close to a number of subway lines taking you to manhattan or to JfK, very convenient.

Leo was a perfect host, has thought of every detail, courteous and made an effort to keep in touch leading up to our stay.

The apartment is a decent size for New York and had everything we needed for our 10 day stay. The description listed is precise and and other reviews left are accurate. My wife and I would stay again.
The reservation was canceled 15 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Cozy, well appointed, clean apartment in a great part of Astoria. Convenient to shops and restaurants. Enjoyed our stay very much.

This was my first Airbnb experience and it was GREAT! Leo was out of town but he answered really fast all txt and e-mails, gave us clear explanations, was helpful and cared if everything was OK. He replied my first inquiry in 30 minutes (other people took 8 days to reply!). The apartment was clean, cozy, with this funky decoration we loved, and it was very quiet (no noise from street or neighbors). It’s exactly as in the pictures but a little bit bigger. Clean sheets and tons of towels, comfy bed, super-comfy couch. Very conveniently located, close to 2 subway stations. Safe neighborhood. 
Astoria is a great area, very lively and authentic (not a touristic spot), a real ethnic melting pot!. People seem to know each other on the streets and stores, like in old time neighborhoods. My recommendation is go towards north 30th Ave instead of Steinway St. 30th Ave has more cafes, restaurants, bakeries, fruit and vegetable stores, flower stores, etc. I think Astoria has a lot of things to explore. Great place to sense how other real newyorkers (not just manhattanites) live everyday life. Though it’s close to Manhattan, it’s a peace oasis compared with the craziness and fast speed of Manhattan. Good place to chill out!
Overall a great experience! I highly recommend Leo, his apartment and Astoria. I will definitely repeat!
The reservation was canceled 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The reservation was canceled 11 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

A host with quick and flexible responses. Nice place but the light is quite dark in all rooms. Sometimes it didnt work well and I had to use his candles. Other things are perfect. He has clear rules, instructions, house stuffs even for whom who need to cook in the kitchen. The place is about 10 mins walk from subway.

Leo's apartment is perfect for a NYC visitor. It's a quiet, hip retreat in a bustling, diverse and gentrifying neighborhood. It's close to two busy subway lines that take you downtown quickly. Highly recommended and I'd love to return one day.

My stay at Leo's was comfortable and easy to coordinate. He was in touch with me by text/email the entire time and very clear about household and check-in/out instructions. The apartment was clean and prepped upon arrival and the neighborhood is fab. So many great restaurants and bars along 30th Ave. A good Airbnb experience!
nice apartment and very convenient place

My stay at Leo's place was amazing... 
Firstly, i wasn't disappointed at all it looked like pictures and everything that i needed was here. The neighborhood is great with shops and plenty of restaurants. There are subway stations that i could take easily to Manhattan (which is very close)...
Besides, i could reach Leo easily and he helped me when i needed to. 

I would recommand this place to everyone who want to visit New York!

Our host Leo was the best we could have. He welcomed my husband at the arrival while he was cleaning and preparing the super cute (Website hidden by Airbnb) is located in one of the best neighborhoods in Astoria right off 30th avenue, where we could find lots of restaurants and bars as well as 7 minutes from the subway station!!!
Great

Leo's location is right in the heart of Astoria, close to Steinway and accessible to many bars and restaurants.

Leo had accommodated us pretty well and made sure we had everything we need.
I had a great experience at Leo apt easy check in and great location nice and clean and everything you need for a comfortable stay

Leo was flexible about the check in-out time, which was very helpful. He was very responsive, easy to communicate with, and very hospitable. The apartment was clean and comfortable, and was an easy walk (10 mins) to the subway. There are good restaurants and shops nearby.

We had a pleasant stay at Leo's apt.Very responsive even he was out of town.Its a nice and safe neighborhood.Close to 30 Av train station, 7 min.walk or you cant take Q18 bus 50m from ap.to the train station if you have a metro card unlimited.Lots of restaurants in the area.20 min.to manhattan with N or Q train.i saw that people say about low light in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) a tiny little dimmer near switch.We recomend Leo's apt.

Leo was absolutely fantastic. Super helpful and really friendly! His place was awesome, the only downside is that we had to leave (wanna trade homes Leo?) The area is really fun, lots of great bars and diners, and it's super easy to get into the city.

Leo war ein super Gastgeber -obwohl wir ihn nie gesehen haben war er jederzeit erreichbar für uns!die Wohnung ist perfekt für einen städtetrip nach New York!in ca 20 min ist man mitten in Manhattan.direkt um die Ecke sind viele Bars, Restaurants und Möglichkeiten zum einkaufen.
Die Wohnung selbst sieht genauso aus wie auf den Bildern!
Wir haben uns wirklich sehr wohlgefühlt!

Astoria was wonderful. I've had never stayed in Queens while in NYC, but will be sure to visit/stay more often because of its serious old school charm. The apt was just what we needed for Gov Ball. Close to food, shops and metro lines. The place was clean and we found everything we needed.

Leo is great! We had last minute extra guests and Leo was very accommodating to our needs and got us an extra items for us. We arrived a little earlier than expected so he was able to give us a quick tour of the apartment. He is very quick to answer texts when you need something.
Very nice apartment. Good location.
We are glad to have had such a cosy apartment in a decent neighbourhod.

Me and my friend had a great stay in a great neighbourhood at a nice, quiet and perfectly located place.
Communication with Leo was easy and everything worked out 100% fine.
Thanks, Leo
Leo was amazing and quick to respond. Highly recommended. Very great location and everything was great!!!

Great apt in a perfect location - Astoria is a great place to eat and drink...very easy transportation to city (various subway lines very close by).  10-15 minutes to midtown Manhattan.  Leo set everything up perfectly, and check in/out was a breeze.  Communication was great as well.  Cozy yet modern apartment right up the block from all the new (and old) restaurants and bars...would definitely stay again.
Leo was really great at communicating and a great host.   The place is pretty basic and clean.  It is in a cool area and it is easy to get go Manhattan on the subway.   We had a nice stay.
Great location, secure place, cute apartment, close to the subway and awesome local dining.

name: Spacious apartment just by Las Ramblas
summary: The apartment offers fantastic location in a Neoclassical building with lots of character. This is one of the most beautiful and vibrant areas of Barcelona and you will not find anywhere more central. License number: HUTB (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
space: Despite its modern facilities, this building has been refurbished retaining its Classical character which dates back to the 19th century. The apartment is located on the 4th  floor with a small elevator for your bags. The apartment has 2 rooms that are cosy and comfortable, with free 24-hour WI-FI internet connection, Queensize double beds on 2 rooms and a double sofa bed in the sitting area, a large bathroom, a lounge area and a equipped modern kitchen. There is a public car parking 1 minute´s walk away from the apartment.  Our accommodation is family-oriented and non-smoking so no stag or hen parties allowed. You have a business center and a gym with swimming pool a few meters from the apartment, available during your stay for free. If you need to leave the bags somewhere on the day of your arrival or the day of your departure, you can leave it in the luggage room that I have next to my office.

This is one of the most beautiful and vibrant areas of Barcelona and you will not find anywhere more central.
