You have a business center and a gym with swimming pool a few meters from the apartment, available during your stay for free. I
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Barrio Gótico, without doubt one of the most beautiful districts of the city. It has and huge number of services as restaurants of all kinds and for all tastes. It also has a very interesting cultural offer, in this district we can found the Cathedral, Plaça Sant Jaume where the City Hall and the Palau de la Generalitat are located, as well as many other museums just a few blocks from there.
notes: Non smoking apartment. No parties of any kind are allowed. There is a phone in the apartment that you can use at any time for free national phone calls within Spain. Tourist tax of 2,48 € per adult per night is not included and is to be paid upon arrival. You can come to my office at any time and book a tour like Camp Nou, Bus turístic or Sagrada Familia.
transit: The stops "Liceu" and "Drassanes" are both within walking 5 minutes form the apartment. To Plaza Catalunya is just 10 minutes walking and from there you can take the metro, the train and buses that take you around the city. As well as the "Aerobus" that take you to the airport. The office is next to the apartment, right on Las Ramblas 42, Bacardí passage 1, office 2. To enter you can call the bell "Las Ramblas Bacardi Apartments" and then enter the office with the access code 63635. The office is located one minute walk from the apartment, at Ramblas 42, Passatge Bacardí, 1, office 2. Ring buzzer "Las Ramblas Bacardi Apartments". Access code is 36363 to the office.
access: Free access to nearby business center and gym. Also by request we can provide traveller cot. If you have a late flight I also have a storage room free of use that is nearby. The office is located one minute walk from the apartment, at Ramblas 42, Passatge Bacardí, 1, office 2. Ring buzzer "Las Ramblas Bacardi Apartments". Access code is 36363 to the office.
interaction: In case you need to contact me during your stay, please call me to my mobile phone numb (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) or call me from the landline in the apartment to my office (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) .
house_rules: This apartment is familly orientated, stag or henk parties are not allowed. Noise is strictly forbidden after 22.00.

reviews.comments: The reservation was canceled the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
HOST PERFETTO, APPARTAMENTO NUOVO, PULITO POSIZIONE SPETTACOLARE DIRETTAMENTE SULLA RAMBLA, CONSIDERANDO CHE FREQUENTO BARCELLONA SPESSO, SONO SICURO CHE TORNERO' QUI.
perfect apartment great location
Muy buen servicio de parte de Carolina y su equipo, nos sugirió distintos lugares turísticos para visitar y fueron muy atentos en todo momento. Altamente recomendable

the location is great but not all apartments are nicely decorated!
we asked to be moved to a different apartment since the one we received wad truely unpleasant and not atrctive. the second apartment was better.
We had to ask for extra towels and toilet paper and hair dryer.
We did enjoy the stay but a bit disappointed from the flat!
The apartment was clean and the receptionist was really nice.

Gli spazi sono ampi e direttamente sulla rambla.
La struttura non è nuova ma tenuta bene.
In un appartamento vicino stanno facendo dei lavori ma non disturbano molto il riposo.
Nel complesso direi che va molto bene.
Unico appunto è quello di avere la TV con anche dei canali europei.
Muy buena ubicacion
The host canceled this reservation 7 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This place was amazing. The location is right on La Rambla - one of the most popular streets in the city. The apartment was very large, quite clean, and well equipped for a vacation. 10/10 - would recommend.
Excellent place, confortable, excellent location, and the support of Maria was exceptional, the stairs inside the apartment are not the easy option to move with luggage.
Excelentes anfitriones, departamento con todo ok sin problemas. 100% recomendable!!!!
Apartamento be localizado e limpo. Ideal para qualquer tipo de família, perto do centro e pontos turístico. Anfitrião atencioso e cumpridor das suas tarefas. Esperamos poder voltar novamente.
Le logement était très propre et confortable, la literie était très bien même le canapé-lit. L'appartement est calme bien qu'il soit situé sur les ramblas.

Appartamento nuovo, pulito e ben arredato. Ubicato in zona centrale, tranquilla e comoda per i turisti; non lontano sia da Casa Batllò e Casa Milà che dalla Barceloneta, a due passi si trovano supermercato, fast food, ristoranti,  fermata della Metro... Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo e personale molto disponibile. Consigliato.

Nice, simple apartment with plenty of beds and space.  Great location right on La Rambla with lots of shops and restaurants around and within walking distance of the Metro.  We were a group of four girls traveling on vacation and the apartment always felt safe and secure as there are several locks you have to go through to get to the apartments.  The apartment is plain but has all the necessities you need and we were not in there much so it was perfect for our budget.
Un buen apartamento, cocina bien equipada y los habitaciones y los baños muy buenos también. Está en la rambla, muy central y fácil de coger el metro o ir a pie!
the situation was great and the apartment was very spacious

This apartment is in a prime location - on a side street between Plaza Real and Las Ramblas. We were only there one night, but it was the perfect place for our family of five. The apartment was clean, and check-in was a breeze. There is a washer and dryer in the apartment which was nice, and the A/C worked great!! That was wonderful given the heat wave Spain has been experiencing. Overall it was exactly what we needed and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if we ever return to Barcelona.

name: 10 MINUTES TO TAXIM
summary: My house is very cosy safe and close to main attraction centers in Taksim. I am a independent artist. A time for art A time for living. Sometimes the two can be conflicting so i decide to be a member of airbnb world :)
space: I rent this house so that i can provide more supply for my Phd programme for next september in London. Untill this time i will be happy to host you.
description: My house is very cosy safe and close to main attraction centers in Taksim. I am a independent artist. A time for art A time for living. Sometimes the two can be conflicting so i decide to be a member of airbnb world :) I rent this house so that i can provide more supply for my Phd programme for next september in London. Untill this time i will be happy to host you. -The room has a very comfortable double-bed, a wardrobe.  -Although the flat is right in the middle of the city, the street that the apartment located is very quiet and peaceful. It's 5-7 minutes-walk to the metro station and the second-oldest subterranean urban rail line in the world after the London Underground. Just 5 minute-walk to the bus station. An "Istanbul Card" which you can use for your public transportation is provided. Make sure that all the famous night clubs, bars, cafés, restaurants; and most of the historical places are walk distance away. You'll enjoy Istanbul nights and days and come home safely. -Whole eq
neighborhood_overview: Because the district is very important part of Istanbul in the sense of people from different cultures and nationalities, and also the living neighbors in the building are from different countries as well. So you can have the chance to see very different cultures at the same time while you are enjoying important historical part of Istanbul.
transit: Yes my house is very close to the Sishane Metro station and also public transportations like busses and ferry.
access: -The room has a very comfortable double-bed, a wardrobe.  -Although the flat is right in the middle of the city, the street that the apartment located is very quiet and peaceful. It's 5-7 minutes-walk to the metro station and the second-oldest subterranean urban rail line in the world after the London Underground. Just 5 minute-walk to the bus station. An "Istanbul Card" which you can use for your public transportation is provided. Make sure that all the famous night clubs, bars, cafés, restaurants; and most of the historical places are walk distance away. You'll enjoy Istanbul nights and days and come home safely. -Whole equipment kitchen. (stove, kettle, dishwasher, toaster, juicer, etc.)
interaction: I'd like to guide you about your travel in Istanbul in our spare times and i'd love to help you about your questions during your travels.
house_rules: 1) If you're a smoker, please smoke on an open or nearby window. 2) Please do not listen loud music after 00.00 3) Please do not give your keys to anyone else.  4) Please do not consume city water for your own health. We're supplying drinking water in our flats.  5) Please let me personally know if you've a serious health problem, this will allow me to be in touch with hospitals in case of emergency.  6) Please take of your shoes at home. 7) Please feel free to ask any help about anything.

reviews.comments: Pinar was a great host. She suggested the best way from an airport, came to pick us up to the bus stop and helped with orientation in the city. Her apartment is absolute spot on for two persons near Taksim square and Istiklal Street area. Still has easy and quick access to get over the Bay to Sultanahmed.

Pinar is a great host, she was there to help with any questions I had. She even waited 2 hours for me when my bus from the airport was stuck in traffic. The apartment is very nice and comfortable. The neighborhood makes it easy to get around Istanbul. I really enjoyed my stay here.

Alles war hervorragend gut. Pinar hat sich sehr gut um uns gekümmert. Die Wohnung ist sehr gut ausgestattet für 2 Personen. Wir haben uns sehr zu Hause gefühlt. 
Die Wohnung ist an einer sehr steilen Strasse und man muss gut zu Fuss sein.

My girlfriend and I stayed in Pinar's sweet house. Every thing is perfect. And she is so kind. We had some luggage problem in Istanbul airport. So we arrived her room later than we expected. But she was waiting with beautiful smile and helped us. 
Second day, we forgot to bring our key. But she came by taxi and solved our problem perfectly. Both her room and she are perfect. Thanks for her, we made wonderful experience inIstanbul!!! Thanks :)

Pinar is a very careful hostess.
Her flat is comfortable, clean, well located with small shops around and bright.
Our stay there was a great pleasure.
Pinar est une hôtesse très attentive.
Son appartement est confortable, propre, bien situé à proximité de petits commerces et lumineux.
Notre séjour a été un grand plaisir.

Pinar was a great hostess! She was a great communicator from the moment of booking, gave great details for finding the location of the flat, and provided great suggestions during our stay.

The flat was spacious and clean and the neighborhood was perfect! We felt very safe walking around both day and night. There are some big hills to and from the place and when we were tired of walking cabs were very inexpensive and came by frequently.  We recommend Pinar's place.

Pınar was a great host, and although we didn't get to meet her in person, she was very helpful over the phone and messages. The apartment was clean and cozy, and close to Taksim and Istanbul's night life. We enjoyed discovering how locals live without the intrusion of tourism. The little shop downstairs was very convenient, and the owner simply lovely. The climb to Taxim is ultra steep so not recommended if you have health issues. Highly recommended!!

Pinar si è rivelata un host molto accogliente e disponibile nell'aiutarci per qualsiasi cosa. La casa è molto carina e dotata di tutto il necessario. La casa ha un'ottima posizione per spostarsi e visitare la città.

We had a good experience staying in Pinars place. It was very clean and well maintained. The places of interest could be reached by a bus, so it was no problem . We didn't get an Istanbulkart from Pinar, but it was no problem buying one. We didn't have much contact with Pinar, but the place was really nice and well kept.

Pınar is one of the most friendly and helpful host I've ever met! She pick me up at the bus station and was so kind in giving me all the information I could need about the apartment and the city. Her apartment is exactly like the pictures, beautiful, bright, clean, I felt home (and the fridge was full of good foods!). The location is perfect: the area is calm and safe, and even if the city centre is so close, it's outside of the traffic of Istanbul. Near to the entrance door there is a market where you can buy everything you need, and the owner is extremely kind and joyful! Just be ready to climb, the house is at the end of a down sloping street, but this is common in every area of the city. It's definitely the best accommodation you could find for this price! Highly recommended!

Pinar was a great host , she waited for our arrival when we arrived late at night and will try to attend to our queries, although some time she was a bit slow in responding but that was due to her hectic jobs. On the last day, we had some issue at home and she came over to accompany us all night long, which show that she is very responsible and accommodate to ensure our safety is taken care of. 
We love her comfy apartment, it is very clean and in safe area. The only problem is the area that is located in hilly area and will have to walk about 15 minutes from nearest bus station. For me I have to no issue to walk about but not recommended for unfit or people with health issue. To take bus to Eminonu  area would takes about 7-10 mins (flat walk), and walk back from bus station will take about 15 mins walking down the hill. The route for going and back within Istanbul is not using the same route, so it can be quite confusing.

Overall, i would highly recommend this clean and trusted hosted.

Pinar's apartment is clean, light, cozy and full-equiped.
It is situated in good location. If you want to use public transport to explore Istanbul, Pinar's apartment is right for you. In 12 minutes walk is metro station (to get there you have to use the steep street, better - Tepebasi street) and in 12 minutes walk is stop of touristic sightseeing Big Bus tour (to get there you have to use a very steep street). In 8 minutes walk by flat street is bus stop to get Eminonu (Egyptian market, New Mosque, 10 minutes walk from historical centre and Sultanahmet square). From this bus stop you can also get Taxim square, Miniturk park. But one of most interesting public transport is the ferry boat. Ferry pier is also in 8 minutes walk by flat street from apartment. By ferry boat you can get to Eminonu, Karakoy and even to Uskudar (in Asian part of Istanbul). Price is the same as the bus.
Next to the entrance door there is a small grocery store where you can buy everything you need. 
Pinar is extremely good host and if we had some questions she promtly gave the answer.
So we highly recommend Pinar's apartment.

Pınars Apartment ist groß, sauber, zentral gelegen, voll ausgestattet. Pınar war vor und während der Reise dauernd erreichbar und wirklich, wirklich hilfreich. Die Lage im Bezirk Beyoğlu ist toll, in der Gegend gibt es auch alles, was man braucht (Bäckerei, Bank, Apotheke, Supermarkt, Greißler) aber vor allem Richtung Tünel/Taxim ist es echt wirklich steil. Stellenweise steiler als Lissabon. Pınar kann aber Tipps geben, wie der schlimmste Hügel umgangen werden kann. Ich würd jederzeit wieder Pınars Apartment mieten und kann es nur fitten Reisenden wärmstens empfehlen.

Pinar hat in ihrer Wohnung auf unsere Ankunft gewartet, obwohl wir Verspätung hatten. Das hat die Schlüsselübergabe sehr erleichtert. Außerdem hat sie uns alle paar Tage gefragt, ob alles in Ordnung ist. Wenn wir eine Frage hatten - bspw. wo man gefüllte Müllbeutel entsorgt -, dann antwortete sie meist innerhalb einiger Minuten. Insofern blieb sie sehr im Hintergrund und stand dennoch jederzeit für Fragen zur Verfügung.

Die Wohnung war ordentlich und sauber. Alles dort hat funktioniert.

In der Nachbarschaft hat man kleine Supermärkte, eine gute Verkehrsanbindung und es ist ruhig (abgesehen vom Muezzin, der ja gehört werden soll). Restaurants sind 10 min. zu Fuß entfernt.

Die einzigen zwei Kritikpunkte, die völlige Nebensächlichkeiten sind, waren: (1) Das Bad ist klein und vor allem um die Toilette herum ist es eng. (2) Die kleine Wohnung hat nur eine mäßige Küchenausstattung: Kochen kann man durchaus, aber man sollte von aufwändigeren Gerichten absehen. Weitere Kritikpunkte fallen mir wirklich gerade nicht ein.

Absolut empfehlenswerte Adresse und Gastgeberin, um Istanbul zu erkunden!

Definitely an amazing host! Easy to contact and fast at writing back. We had an amazing vacation and the apartment was perfect for two. However, I have to say that it wouldn't fit for more than three people. 
It is close to Taxim and a lot of caps drive by the building so you don't have to wait long for one. 
No doubt that I recommend others to stay at Pınar's apartment and I wouldn't mind going back.
Thank you Pınar! :)
The host canceled this reservation 61 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

name: Floor Through East Village Lux Apt
summary: New Englandy deluxe apt on the most famous East Village St, in an historic building, rich hardwood floors and cabinetry, oak dinner table seats 10, balcony garden overlooking backyard garden, exciting night life, easily accomodates 4 luxuriously.
space: It is a floor through luxury apartment in a historic building on the most famous street in the East Village.
description: New Englandy deluxe apt on the most famous East Village St, in an historic building, rich hardwood floors and cabinetry, oak dinner table seats 10, balcony garden overlooking backyard garden, exciting night life, easily accomodates 4 luxuriously. It is a floor through luxury apartment in a historic building on the most famous street in the East Village.  Guests will have access to a balcony garden, overlooking a backyard garden, kitchen and full bath. We are on site and available if needed, and welcome our guests at arrival, and can give directions to many restaurants and attractions in the neighborhood. Our Building is listed in TimeOut Mag. as one of NYC's top ten buildings with unexpected backstories. The backstory is about me and my family...  (TimeOut New York issue 970) Feel free to ask me to tell you the story when you stay with us. The East Village is the heart of New York. I have lived here, for five decades and my family and I have been a part of the arts movement, which crea
neighborhood_overview: The East Village is the heart of New York. I have lived here, for five decades and my family and I have been a part of the arts movement, which created the East Village within the Lower East Side.
notes: Our building is noted as a destination in most New York City tourist guides and is a stop on most East Village walking tours.
transit: We are within three and a half blocks of most of the subway lines, and are one block from uptown, downtown and crosstown buses.
access: Guests will have access to a balcony garden, overlooking a backyard garden, kitchen and full bath.
interaction: We are on site and available if needed, and welcome our guests at arrival, and can give directions to many restaurants and attractions in the neighborhood. Our Building is listed in TimeOut Mag. as one of NYC's top ten buildings with unexpected backstories. The backstory is about me and my family...  (TimeOut New York issue 970) Feel free to ask me to tell you the story when you stay with us.
house_rules: We expect our guests to enjoy themselves, but respect that in a residential neighborhood, it is important to not disturb the neighbors and be mindful of the antiques in the apartment.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: 50 years on Saint Marks Place. A life time in theater.  The story of my building and I made TimeOut Magazine's top ten buildings with unexpected backstories. Also on the list is Gracie Mansion, the Empire State Building, and Grand Central Station!

reviews.comments: Our stay at this apartment was absolutely perfect! The space was even better than described. The apartment is full of old world charm with a balcony overlooking a beautiful garden. The apartment is located at a most ideal location,  walking distance to many destinations (such as The Blue Note and the Comedy Cellar), as well as, a variety of excellent restaurants.  The first floor of the building houses a theater and bar, where we spent a fun filled evening. Our hosts, Genie and Lorcan, were most charming, welcomed us with delicious tea and entertained us with interesting (Website hidden by Airbnb) about the building's history during prohibition. Overall we would rate this as a most wonderful experience and are looking forward to our next visit with Genie and Lorcan.

Lorcan and Genie were the ultimate hosts. This experience had everything, luxury, convenience, history and the opportunity to meet two delightful people.

When we arrived Lorcan kindly took us into his home for a welcome drink and the opportunity to get to know each other.

The apartment itself was grand with a great kitchen and rear balcony. it had natural light from both front and back. The location was superb for visiting all parts of Manhattan and also some of the best restaurants in the state.

Lorcan runs a beautiful little theatre and bar on St Marks Place both of which he kindly invited us to enjoy. My boys loved the shows which Lorcan very kindly invited us to enjoy free of charge.

I can't recommend staying at Lorcan and Genie's apartment more, it was super!

Thanks so much,
Chris and Caroline

Lorcan and Genie were extremely hospitable, greeting us with a cup of tea in their apartment on our arrival and regaling us with the fascinating - and occasionally shady - history of the building, which also now homes Theatre 80 and William Barnacle Tavern (where we enjoyed an excellent, and very welcome, Sidecar). My advice would be to check out the forthcoming schedule for the theatre in advance of your visit as there may well be something on that you wouldn't want to miss.

The apartment itself is full of character, consisting mainly of one long, wooden-floored room with windows to the front and the rear courtyard, and a bedroom off to one side at the front. There are antiques, an eclectic collection of photographs adorning the walls and even a rocking chair for when you just want to sit down and read (although our schedule was a little too packed to allow for that).  You also have access to a covered balcony, where, when the sun came out on Monday afternoon, we enjoyed an excellent pastrami sandwich from Katz's Deli, which is a just few minutes walk away and a definite "must" for anyone visiting the area.

The location is very good, with a range of excellent restaurants, coffee shops and bars nearby.  A few for particular mention (apart from Katz's) would include Saxon + Parole at 316 Bowery, Bluebird Coffee Shop on 1st and 1st, where they do a perfect "flat white" and is just a few doors down from Prune, where we enjoyed an excellent brunch, and the Clinton Street Baking Company, which serves -  what we all agreed - were the best pancakes we'd ever had.

We arrived on Halloween so understandably the party was in full swing outside and continued well into the wee small hours of Saturday. Earplugs came in handy!

I always enjoy visiting New York and particularly so on this occasion with my wife and grown up daughters. The fact that Lorcan was more than happy to allow us to leave our bags in the apartment until later in the afternoon (we had an evening flight) meant that we were able to make the utmost of our all too brief visit. We had a wonderful time.

This is a fantastic place to stay, we couldn’t recommend it strongly enough. Lorcan and Jeanie were brilliant hosts who couldn’t have been more helpful or made us feel more welcome. Lorcan’s stories about his family history were fascinating and added to the whole experience, as did the bar and theatre which are adjacent to the apartment. The apartment itself matched the listing description, was fully functional and also quiet on a night time. The local neighbourhood also has much to offer, with bars and eateries in abundance. SoHo & Little Italy are only 20 minutes walk away. We would most definitely rebook.

I have had a lot of experience with AirBnB places and this is easily one of the best. The location is a food lovers dream with some of the best food in NYC just steps away, definitely recommend the Guidebook already made by Lorcan. 

The apartment is large by NY standards and had all the luxuries we needed including a balcony. The kitchen was well stocked and all we had to get was Meat and Veggies. 

Most importantly, the hosts, are absolutely brilliant!! You could spend days talking to them without even leaving the apartment. Easily the best hosts I have ever stayed with. 

Ultimately, stop reading this review and just book the place already!

The last great neighborhood in Manhattan....A wonderful host and hostess...large comfortable apartment....Great restaurants….Great history….Perfect simply (Website hidden by Airbnb) warned not for those who are physically challenged. It is a three floor walkup.
Great apartment! :)
Lorcan was extremely kind and generous to us. We had a great time at his apartment for the night. I would definitely suggest his apartment to anyone interested in. Great location, too!

I told Lorcan before I left yesterday that there were no hotels in NYC that could match the 5 star experience that my family and I had staying here. (And I work in the hospitality industry, myself).  It was such a great feeling to turn the corner onto St. Marks Place and to immediately spot 'our place'. I never imagined how 'at home' I felt. My family never wanted to leave the neighborhood. It's the best neighborhood in NYC. Right across the street are 3 of the best restaurants in NYC, one of them (Xi'an)  visited by both Andrew Zimmern and Anthony Bourdain. Lorcan's speakeasy is another story. Located on the 1st floor, William Barnacle Tavern is one of the highest rated bars in the area as well. On Tuesday nite there were traditional Irish musicians (about a dozen) who gathered around a table and played some awesome music. Jeannie and Lorcan are the most gracious of people. They are very much a part of this amazing community and so much fun to talk to. I will be coming back to New York many times in the future, and I'll  always come here, and it will always feel like coming home.

You feel right at home from the moment you get there. The hosts, Lorcan and Genie are the best and welcome you to their home.
I was travelling with my parents (who are in their early 60's) and they loved the place as did I. It's the best neighborhood in Manhattan. The location of the flat is excellent- lively neighborhood, which has everything you need, Whole Foods, all kinds of restaurants and bars. 
The apartment was really cosy and spacious, perfect for 3 people like us. There's a huge living room and also a separate Kirchen where you'll find everything you need for cooking.
Would definitely stay here again if I had the chance.

All in all, a great place to hang out at and very convenient location to explore New York!

Excelente fue mi estadia con Lorcan Otaway, junto a su esposa nos atendieron muy bien, el departamento limpio, amplio y acomodado, vale cada dolar que pague!!! 
RECOMENDABLE 100%

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here in the East Village. From the start Lorcan and Genie were the perfect hosts, they allowed us to check in early and showed us around their home. The apartment was wonderful, it had everything that we needed and it was more spacious than we expected. The location was absolutely perfect, it’s so peaceful in comparison to other parts of Manhattan and there was a huge variety of bars and restaurants within a short distance. We’d highly recommend this apartment and we will certainly come back if we need accommodation in New York again.
Quelle belle rencontre et quel bel accueil de la part de Lorcan and Genie. L'appartement est spacieux, bien situé et plein d'histoire. Nous avons passé un très bon moment! Merci.

As an avid NYC visitor
I would highly recommend staying here.
Location was very good for people who want to go see as much as they can and come back to their room and change.
Hosts were amazing too!

The apartment is large and spacious, a LOT of room, and it's uniquely decorated.
Nice beds, great shower, and a well equipped kitchen.
The location of the apartment if terrific.
Lorcan and Genie were great hosts and very courteous.

This is a wonderfully cozy, yet spacious place to stay. Our hosts were super accommodating and gracious. The building is rich with history, (Website hidden by Airbnb) SITUATED IN THE HEART OF THE EAST VILLAGE! I would recommend to my closest friends and family. It's just that awesome!

It was at pleasure to be at Lorcan and Genie's apartment! 

The apartment is very spacious and perfect for our stay. 
Kitchen and bath was clean and in fine conditions. 
Both Lorcan and Genie were very kind and flexible with check-in and check-out times, which made our last day perfect! 

We enjoyed staying there and would recommend the place at any time!



ery hospitable, kind, and flexible with check-in and check-out times, which made this stay a breeze.

Apartment was very spacious and perfect for my family of four. Bathroom and kitchen were clean and in great condition. Jeannie and Lorcan were very hospitable, kind, and flexible with check-in and check-out times, which made this stay a breeze. This was actually my first airbnb booking and I wasn't sure what to expect, but this experience exceeded expectations.

Lorcan and Genie were incredible hosts.  They treated myself, my wife and our two young boys (9 and 5) like family the moment we arrived. Lorcan makes the absolute best Meat Pasties and the Crepes made in the bar downstairs are also incredible. The building and the Otway family hold such an incredible amount  of history it simply can't be missed.  I couldn't think of a better place to stay.  The very clean and incredibly spacious apartment is situated in one of the most lively, and unique areas of Manhattan.  The subway is within 6 blocks of the apartment making it very convenient to get anywhere you would like to go.  We go to NYC every year and will try to stay here from now on.

Lorcan was a terrific host! The space was lovely, clean, and comfortable. It was everything he said it was and more. The deck space is lovely and includes a retractable awning. There is terrific and interesting art done by Lorcan himself all over the apartment (Lorcan will happily tell you all about it). Lorcan largely left us to our own devices once we got settled, but he was happy to make sure we had everything we needed. 

We would certainly go back. Perfect for a small group of friends or family that doesn't need too many separate rooms. I was here with some friends, but as the father of three, I can see a family with a child or two finding this apartment very easy to manage. 

I hope I get back some time. Enjoy!

Lorcan and Genie's place is a find! Within one block we had the best shrimp tacos, blueberry rhubarb soup, ramen, pizza, crepes in the window just below from an actual Frenchman... and that's just food! They were lovely hosts- knew the whole neighborhood and told us where to find shoes for my daughter right on the next block since she'd ruined hers on the trip.  The place itself was full of history and character- and a floor-thru! The deck out back was beautiful- wish we could've stayed longer- will definitely be back if they'll have us! 
As far as amenities go it's a full apartment with kitchen, full bath- they even left a bottle of wine and an extra toothbrush. Plenty of blankets and there was not only the sofa-bed, pull out bed and a queen in the bedroom there was also an air mattress and plenty of space to use it. I'd say more but if you want a convenient NY neighborhood (it's a couple blocks to the 6 at Astor place or a couple more to almost any other train at west 4 or e. Houston).  If my kids were very small Id have been worried about them with the antiques but it was perfect for us- could leave the teenager to sleep while I took the youngers to the bakery or to get coffee (Porto Rico importing company is on this block- the OG coffee shop!) all in all so glad they took our last minute reservation request- my kids got to see some of downtown and it was easy to pop up to midtown to see the touristy stuff they wanted and come back to rest ourselves to go out someplace awesome for dinner.

This place is truly a hidden gem. If you want to stay in East Village, Lorcan's flat is the place to be. Not only were him and his wife perfect hosts (they left us a bottle of wine + roses), but the location is perfect. The apartment is massive and there's a very nice balcony in the back. I cannot think of one thing negative to say about the apartment and our experience there.

We had such a lovely time in this space.  A friend joined us for the weekend and we didn't have time to learn more about the buildings history, something I regret as it is a magical space.  The hosts were quite warm and accommodating and appointed the apartment thoughtfully.  It looks exactly like the photos, has a private entrance as well as a large balcony off the back.  We slept on the street side and it was peaceful for us.  Thank you for hosting us Lorcan!   It was an idyllic weekend.

Just spent 3 nights here. Lorcan and his wife were thoughtful hosts welcoming us and giving us a brief history of the location.  The area is why we chose this apt.  The area is quirky, funky with great bars, restaurants and shops.  

The apartment is clean but not very furnished.  We didn't think of this beforehand and the reviews don't mention it.  This means that there isn't any sitting or lounging after a long day sight seeing. Just a long wood table and chairs and a rocking chair. If you are using the beds in the main area there is no where to sit. A couch and a comfortable chair would help.  We couldn't really spend any down time in the apartment so any time spent in the apartment you have to stand or relax on a bed.  

The kitchen is functional but you really aren't going to do much cooking.  The bathroom is old but clean.  My wife prefers more modern bathrooms and a bit of luxury.  A note to Lorcan, consider a box or 2 of Kleenex. 

It should also be pointed out that though it is considered a first floor walkup, there are 3 flights of stairs to walk up.  They are rather narrow and steep and if you have mobility issues or young children it may be a challenge.  
All in all we had a fabulous weekend.
The house is very large and decorated. Also, the host and his wife is very nice. We are willing to choose this house again if we go to NYC next time.

We spent 7 nights in this lovely and spacious apartment. The location is perfect. In the heart of the East Village. As it was our first visit to NYC, we were out all day and we missed to visit the gangster museum. But we will come back another time.
Lorcan and Genie were perfect hosts. We would recommend this apartment to our friend (Website hidden by Airbnb) Henrik

Lorcan è stato un ospite accogliente e gentilissimo. Siamo stati nel suo appartamento per una settimana; il nostro gruppo era di quattro sessantenni (tre amiche e un amico). L’appartamento, il quartiere, tutto molto gradevole. L’appartamento è come nella foto, il salone molto grande ci ha permesso di dormire in tre, in tre letti separati, senza disturbarci, mentre in quarto amico ha potuto avere a disposizione la stanza. Il clima mite ci ha permesso di usare un poco anche la terrazza. Ci è sembrata una vera casa newyorchese, in posizione che ci permetteva di muoverci anche a piedi, ad es. fino a Union Square. Servita da due stazioni della subway piuttosto vicine, come pure da bus. 
Lorcan ci ha anche guidato in una visita al suo piccolo teatro di famiglia, ci ha raccontato di attori, e non solo, che l’hanno frequentato, del periodo del proibizionismo….
Un problema che si è manifestato in bagno il secondo giorno è stato prontamente risolto coll’intervento dell’idraulico (Lorcan abita nello stesso palazzo ed è, ripetiamo, molto disponibile).
Il quartiere tranquillo ha negozi aperti fino a tarda sera, come pure posti dove mangiare qualcosa, e ristoranti. La prima sera arrivati tardi, siamo andati a cercare qualcosa da mangiare e eravamo stupiti della gente che passeggiava per quelle strade, del clima tranquillo e a misura d’uomo.
Difetti? L’altro aspetto di un quartiere molto frequentato , da giovani e non solo, è che la notte non è molto silenziosa, soprattutto di sabato), ma ciò non ci ha impedito comunque di riposare. Un consiglio? Sostituire il frigorifero che, piuttosto antiquato, è molto rumoroso e si trova nella sala dove ci sono dei letti.
Conclusione? Ci siamo trovati proprio bene. Ci piacerebbe tornare (se magari cambi il frigorifero…) e consiglieremo l’appartamento di Lorcan agli amici.

Nuestra estancia en la casa de Lorcan ha sido muy buena. Se trata de un amplio apartamento situado en el East Village. El apartamento es muy limpio y ordenado. Tanto Lorcan como su mujer han sido muy buenos anfitriones ayudandonos en todo lo que hemos necesitado. Cuenta con una terraza muy agradable para desayunar o comer.
La zona en la que está situado es muy segura, con mucho ambiente tanto por el día como por la noche y muy bien comunicado(a pocos metros tiene conexión con las línea de metro L,6,N y R). Recomendaría alojarse en este apartamento.

Very nice host, but the apt needs to be renovated. Only one real permanent bed, and no place to sit and relax - like a couch. Badly isolated windows resulting in lots of noice from the street and cold draft in the night. Bad plumbing makes it almost impossible to take a regular hot water shower. Sorry to write this review as the hosts are such nice people.

Great location.  The east village has lots to offer, young or old.   Very roomy.  Totally private, the entire floor with a separate entrance from the owners flat.  Plenty of towels & blankets, the balcony overlooks a courtyard where you can have a smoke if your so inclined and the Mayor can't stop you.  A bottle of wine was waiting, nice touch.  You won't be disappointed.

We loved the apt, and our hosts, who were ultra friendly and very helpful. Its a long knock-thru, with polished boards and a long table with bench and chairs to one side. Galley kitchen was good enough to cook Christmas dinner for 9 people, but serviceable rather than stylish. The helpful thing was that if we needed something, Lorcan simply pulled it out of his kitchen. The 4 poster in the bedroom creeks and the bathroom tiles have seen better days, but that is all part of the charm. If you need 5 star chrome, this is mot a good choice, but for us, it was perfect. We had three adult children on the trundle bed and an inflatable sleeping in the living room, which means that everyone gets up at the same time - no hardship. There is street noise - sirens, trucks, and New Yorkers socialising on the street, 3 flrs below. We had our windows open, as it was unseasonably warm.  It is the Lower East Side, so the noise goes with the territory. Location is superb, convenient to transport, snd walking distance to shopping. Lots of deli's and coffee shops (again, goes with the neighbourhood, and a big plus). No soft chairs or sofas for watching TV, but we didn't turn it on once - too busy enjoying NYC.

It is bohemian, and hence perfect for the area, and in my view a perfect AirBnB. 

We would stay again, for so many reasons - the apt, Lorcan and Gennie, the district. We loved our stay.

La descripció de l'anunci es del tot correcta, si que s'ha de tenir en compte les escales per pujar a l'apartament, persones amb mobilitat reduïda no es aconsellable, la resta molt bé, però la cuina s'hauria de repassar una mica .
 En Lorcan i la Jane són realment fantàstics ens varen fer molt bona acollida i per tot el que necessitessim estaven disposats a ajudar-nos, son uns grans anfitrions, ens varen explicar la història del teatre St Marks, es realment formidable, varem poder veure el teatre per dins, la Jane ens va exp`licar com s'havia construit, etc no tinc paraules per ells . Excel.lent
La ubicació molt bona, esta clar que si tornem a Nova York pensarem en tornar a aquest allotjament.

Moltes gracies Lorcan i Jane

Lorcan es una persona muy simpática y muy amable, que le gusta tratar con gente.Nos mostró su casa, sus fotos familiares  y nos mostró los restaurantes de la zona antes de darnos las llaves del apartamento. El apartamento es tal cual las fotos, aunque las fotos no sean muy buenas. El barrio es  muy cómodo en cuanto a restaurantes, transporte y ubicación. A pesar de estar en un segundo casi tercer piso es muy ruidoso porque todo el tiempo pasan ambulancias y bomberos y hay mucho bullicio. pero así es Ny y así es esa zona. Conviene saberlo antes. Algunos  ya lo decían pero no había leído los 30 comentarios .El mobiliario es anticuado pero la casa también lo es,  como un museo en pleno barrio.  Lorcan todo el tiempo nos ofreció toallas limpias ya que nos quedamos 9 dias. Confieso que en los últimos ya me había acostumbrado al (Website hidden by Airbnb) calefacción funciona más que bien.
It was great. Super interesting place and very comfortable.

Hemos disfutado una gran estadía en el piso de Lorcan. Es un lugar con carácter e historia, ideal para adentrarse en la escencia del barrio del East Village. Es totalmente recomedable para huir de la impersonalidad de un hotel y conocer paso a paso las calles de Nueva York, en en recorrido de las calles menos conocidas y más sorprendentes. El departamento es muy amplio, luminoso y completamente equipado. Tiene un hermosos suelo de madera y muebles antiguos. El balcón es perfecto para pasar las tardes o desayunar. Pero sobretodo nuestro anfirtrión, Lorcan, fue lo mejor. Es atento, divertido, detallista y con muchas historias y (Website hidden by Airbnb) definitivamente recomedable.

Very characterful property. Lorcan gave us an good overview of the history of the property - the Gangster Museum of NY downstairs is excellent to get the full story. Lorcan was very helpful and welcoming. The accommodation and location was great - the listing accurate.

Lorcan was a very welcoming host, and his space is amazing. It's in one of the best parts of the city, and he even gave us a little background information about the history of the building. Amazing listing overall!

We had a great time!! St marks place is really in the heart of east village, close to soho, close to union sq. so if you want to be central and eat at amazing restaurants without using public transports or cabs, this is the place. Apartment felt typical New York, old and charming interior, good kitchen and an amazing BIG balcony facing the back yard. Lorcan was a great host, he was quick answering questions or fixing small perks that came up. He even installed a AC in the bedroom since it was super hot in New York when we arrived. 
Our stay was 3 weeks long so after we left it felt like we left our home away from home. Thank you Lorcan!!

After a month on the road through the States we needed  a place to spend the last two days in NYC and Lorcan's apartment was just perfect! Lots of room, funky and bohemian. And what a location! Lots of life happening right next to us. 
Lorcan and Genie were wonderful people. They told us about the history of the house and invited us to visit the Gangster Museum in the same building but we did unfortunately not make it. A good reason to go back!
El apartamento coincide con las fotos del anuncio. La casa es algo antigua pero se encuentra limpia. No es recomendable para más de dos personas ni está adaptada a familias con niños.

Lorcan and his partner were super friendly and attentive and generous. It was a very pleasant stay that suited all of our requirements and then some.

There were some things that could be improved at this price point (but it is NY) and their hospitality was second to none.

Thanks for a great stay, and for a tour of the museum!

Super location.  Tons of space.  The interior is a bit dated and could use some furniture to lounge around on while relaxing or watching tv.  Great outdoor deck.  

Host was super nice and all communications were easy.

Lorcan's flat was spacious and clean and we really loved staying there. The spacious balcony is definitely a gem! The bed was good and the shower had enough pressure and hot water.  The flat is located in a very old building so if you are super allergic to dust and mold, the staircase to the flat might not be your favorite. One cockroach had crawled in from the open balcony door, but since this is New York it's not really a surprise that those things live around old buildings.

There are a million good restaurants just steps away from the apartment. Earplugs are recommended for Friday and Saturday nights as the bars are quite busy then.

I would definitely recommend Lorcan's apartment to anyone who wants to stay in a lively neighborhood in New York.

Very helpful hosts, great location next to loads of great cafes and bars in East Village and near the Subway. Quite a few steps up to the apartment which was fine for us but may be harder for older guests. Overall very good spot.

This place was pretty unique and very clean. Besides, the hosts have been easy to reach out, very welcoming and flexible. The area is safe and lively too. Perhaps a bit noisy on saturday night but it is nyc after all! Will repeat for sure!
Great host-very responsive. Great neighborhood-very convenient.

Lorcan and Genie were amazing hosts! They were there to greet us when we arrived and stocked our fridge with essentials and even a bottle of great wine. The history of the building is awesome, so be sure to ask about it.  We couldn't have asked for a better stay in an awesome house!
Great place to stay and a very very nice location. Hosts were extremely helpful in giving us recommendations of where to go. Extremely fast to reply. Overall we loved the experience.

Our group of 4 (two couples) had a great stay here! There's a bed for two, and then a set of twin mattresses that go to the same height. We loved sitting on the back patio in the morning to drink coffee or just enjoy the weather during a fantastic spring weekend in NYC. The space was huge, more than enough room for the four of us to relax and spread out.
The East Village is obviously amazing, and there are lots of fun places to hang out, eat, and drink within 10 minutes walking from the apartment. I definitely recommend staying here, and the hosts made everything more enjoyable. Their communication was almost instant, and were flexible with our check in/check out. We stopped by the bar they run downstairs which was chill, and next time we will check out the Museum of the American Gangster they also run. Be sure to look into this place if you are planning an NYC stay!
Lorcan is an awesome host! The place was great - huge living room and a great shower.  Really great location too we were close to awesome bars and restaurants
Great hosts and spacious place, excellent location in the middle of NY city.
地点很棒!但是清洁不是特别好｡住进去第一天晚上就看到了一只巨大的蟑螂｡｡｡床单可能是太久没有使用过了,有一股奇怪的气味｡总体来说,如果对清洁不是非常介意的话,这个地方还是值得推荐的,毕竟是在纽约,这么便宜的价格已经不错了｡

Rarely does one get a feeling of spaciousness when renting a place in Manhattan, so imagine our surprise when we walked into this place.  It's a long, open apartment with beautiful cabinetry and plenty of room for whatever you like.  Best of all, it's above an absinthe bar, an old off Broadway theatre, and a great hot dog stand.  Lorcan and his wife live in the building and made us feel very welcome.  I recommend Lorcan's place without hesitation.

Lorcan's place was an absolute gem. Although it is surrounded by countless restaurants, bars, construction etc while we are inside it was quiet, relaxing and cozy, away from the hustle bustle. We sat on the porch out back in the morning with coffee and soaked up some sunshine. Although we did not cook on our trip the kitchen was well equipped to do so. They are truly wonderful people who want to preserve the character of the neighborhood and their home has just the character to match! Enjoy
Great location. Great space. Great hosts.

Lorcans place is truly an experience you should take time to enjoy - set in the best location in East Village, the room itself has so much history and character - a lot like Lorcan himself. Spend some time chatting with Lorcan and Jeanie - they are great hosts who have so much knowledge and such a great history that you'll be amazed at their great stories. Hope to be back one day.

We loved this location! So many great food options and great Nieghborhood! Lorcan & his wife we so quick to respond the blow dryer was broken and the got a new one immediately! The place is large and has a great patio to have coffee on. The large table sat our family we were meeting in NY we had many great meals there. We did not cook much but the kitchen had what we needed. There was a nice bottle of wine waiting for us when we arrived. We would definitely come back !
What a great space.  Couldn't ask for a better location.  I've never stayed in a NYC Airbnb so roomy.  Hosts were personable and helpful. Would recommend in a heartbeat.
fantastic location and wonderful hosts.Apt was cozy and warm.would stay here again!
Lorcan was extremely hospitable - very heartwarming to meet folks like this! Thank you!!
Such a great place and an interesting backstory too! The location was amazing; short walking distance to the best foods in New York..

Lorcan's place is in a really vibrant area with lots of great places to eat and interesting small boutiques. The building has lots of historic interest and the apartment is spacious. He and his wife are very welcoming and gave us a tour of the former speak easy on the ground floor.

Lorcan’s place was really amazing. The hosts are both very nice, responsive, and even had a bottle of wine for us when we got there. The neighborhood is very nice to walk around and very lively. The apartment was beautiful and I would stay again.
Great, quirky flat - charming hosts and great neighbourhood. Recommend.

Lorcan and Genie are amazing hosts. They were there to greet us and recommend us great places around the neighborhood when we first arrived, and were attentive to every communication we had with them. The apartment is great. It is located at the heart of Saint Marks, it is very warm and spacious, with a great terrace. Would 100% recommend and go back! Thank you!

Great apartment and great host. We had our flight canceled twice, and we arrived at a different time than expected, and the communication with Lorcan was very good all the time. He responded quickly to all our messages.

Checking in could not be easier.

Very fair photos. We had very good time at Lorcan's spot and definetly recommend it.

Positive points: 
- Location (fantastic neighborhood, close to great places and restaurants)
- Lots of space in the apartment
- Clean
- Host always nearby
- Amenities  (a bottle of wine, coffee, eggs, butter)
- Equipaments  (wifi, coffee machine, cook top, refrigerator, Iron, hair dryer, umbrellas, TV)
- The balcony (we had our breakfast there every day)

Negative points:
- Mattress was a bit noisy 
- Second floor but you have to climb three flights of stairs 
- Street gets a bit noisy on Friday and Saturday nights, but noise greatly reduces around midnight (honestly we were so tired that we slept quickly, even with the noise)

This is a huge space in the East Village. Lorcan was easy to communicate with and the place was very clean and comfy.  The neighborhood is lively, interesting, and walkable, and it’s easy to get around on public transportation. A good location for families—our teenage girls loved being there! We would definitely stay there again on our next visit.

I stayed here with my family of 4. Amazing location -- only a few minutes walk to the metro, and close to many great restaurants, even right across the street. The history of the building is also really cool! Lorcan and Genie were very responsive and told us about the area. Our only complaints are that the twin beds are a little thin (we could feel the springs in the mattress) and the AC was pretty loud. Still, definitely worth it.

I have travelled a lot the last 40 years. From 5star Hotels to simple hammocks in the jungle. That’s why i prefer privacy. More than the most beautiful hotels with all it´s luxury .
Lorcins place breathes  history!!. His Kindness and hospitality are outstanding. And the neighbourhood is simply perfect . The apartment with the beautiful wooden floor makes you feeling home.

l appartement de lorcan est situé au coeur de l east village. le quartier est très animé, beaucoup de bars et de restaurants, mais cela rend l appartement assez bruyant surtout le soir. l appartement est très grand, la terrasse est vraiment agreable. cependant les équipements sont vieux, la cuisine et la salle de bain auraient besoin d un grand rafraîchissement, il était difficile de cuisiner.

L’appartamento di Lorcan e sua moglie è un tipico appartamento newyorkese, di quelli che si immaginano dai film, arredato con stile anglosassone ma soprattutto artistico. Molto spazioso e luminoso, pulito e dotato di tutti i comfort, davvero comodo. La posizione è strepitosa, al centro di tutto. Noi siamo andati quasi ovunque a piedi, oltretutto la sera c’è l’imbarazzo della scelta tra locali e attività.
Che dire dei padroni di casa: fantastici. Disponibili, garbati, presenti ma discreti. Il prossimo viaggio solo per ascoltare i racconti sulla loro vita. Davvero una bella esperienza

We had an amazing time staying at Lorcan’s place which is very special and unique compared to other Airbnb’s. The apartment is very spacious and well located to explore the entire city. Lots of great restaurants and shops nearby. Lorcan and his wife are great hosts and very easy to communicate with! We would definitely stay there again!
Fabulous neighborhood with exceptional nightlife and restaurants!

Ideally located in the heart of the vibrant East Village this is a lovely and cozy New York apartment. The living room is enormous and beautiful decorated with wood panels. The space is ideal to host a nice dinner (although being there for work I had no time) and the back deck/terrace is a MUST. Apartment was perfectly clean. Hosts are extremely flexible, accommodating and responsive to any questions or needs one has, and a bottle of wine was waiting... I’ll definitely come back!!
My friends and I had a great time! The place is large. There is a cute outdoor area great for drinking coffee. Location was perfect! Lot so far stuff to do and see.
Easy check-in, nice people, spacious and great location!

Well this apartment is not for those wanting ultra modern but if you want to stay in an historic building and experience New York life then this is for you.  When we arrived Lorcan met us to store our bags so we could begin exploring.  He introduced us to the Theatre downstairs and the local restaurants and bars.  When we arrived back that evening to check in the apartment was ready and a guest package of Barry's Tea, eggs, milk butter and a bottle of wine awaited us.  The kitchen is basic but there are so many places to buy food on the block to either eat in or take away this is not a problem.  The area is buzzing at night with bars a plenty and one on the ground floor. Lorcan and his wife were hospitable, friendly and happy to help us in any way the could. We loved listening to Lorcan tales o growing up in NY.

Amazing location right in the heart of the East Village, close to great food, drinks, shops, music, etc. 
Lorcan was great - responded promptly, was accommodating and helpful.  The apartment features incredible woodwork by him.  He left plenty of towels and sheets.  I didn't get to communicate with him or learn as much about the history of the place, but he provided everything needed.  Beautiful and relaxing back deck.  Kitchen and bathroom are definitely older and weathered, but on the other hand, the main living room/space is huge and impressive.

The place was what we needed and thought it would be. Great area. A lot of locals and restaurants and cool bars. We only got to stay 1 day because we were delayed out of Ohare, but glad we made it the last day. Very convenient area and good place to be in the city. I would stay there again. Thanks Lorcan!!

Imagine the polished wood floor and length of a dance studio, surrounded by the beautiful wood built-in's of a boat, all in the center of the East Village and being surrounded by history, and you have imagined Lorcan's airbnb.  There is a private bedroom, lots of communal space (within the apartment), a fully functional kitchen, a great outdoor space, and a few extra items to make your stay special (bottle of wine, dozen eggs, butter, coffee, real half-and-half).  This is the place to pretend that you are a New Yorker!
Loran was a great! The apartment charming, cozy and right in the heart of The East Village.

name: Appartement dans quartier super!
summary: Joli appartement très bien équipé et très bien situé! Tout ce qu'il faut pour les séjours de longue durée. À 30 secondes à pied du populaire Marché Jean-Talon! À 4 minutes à pied du métro et près d'arrêts d'autobus de jour et de nuit. Très près de la Petite-Italie, de restaurants, de cafés, de bars. Quartier multiculturel où on trouve des commerces et des produits intéressants. Bref, appartement et quartier super pratiques où il y a tout ce dont on a besoin.
space: L'appartement est tout équipé : vaisselle, casseroles, drap, serviettes, machine à laver, lave-vaisselle, cafetière expresso, internet sans fil. Il y a une télévision, mais je n'ai pas le câble. L'appartement n'est pas neuf et c'est ce qui fait son charme! C'est un appartement typiquement Montréalais, il se trouve dans un immeuble datant des années 30. Il a de beaux planchers de bois franc, il est propre et confortable, notamment pour les longs séjours puisqu'il y a vraiment tout ce qu'il faut. Il est possible d'installer une personne ou deux de plus dans le salon puisqu'il y a un sofa lit. Par contre, tenez compte du fait que la chambre n'a pas de porte.
description: Joli appartement très bien équipé et très bien situé! Tout ce qu'il faut pour les séjours de longue durée. À 30 secondes à pied du populaire Marché Jean-Talon! À 4 minutes à pied du métro et près d'arrêts d'autobus de jour et de nuit. Très près de la Petite-Italie, de restaurants, de cafés, de bars. Quartier multiculturel où on trouve des commerces et des produits intéressants. Bref, appartement et quartier super pratiques où il y a tout ce dont on a besoin. L'appartement est tout équipé : vaisselle, casseroles, drap, serviettes, machine à laver, lave-vaisselle, cafetière expresso, internet sans fil. Il y a une télévision, mais je n'ai pas le câble. L'appartement n'est pas neuf et c'est ce qui fait son charme! C'est un appartement typiquement Montréalais, il se trouve dans un immeuble datant des années 30. Il a de beaux planchers de bois franc, il est propre et confortable, notamment pour les longs séjours puisqu'il y a vraiment tout ce qu'il faut. Il est possible d'installer une perso
neighborhood_overview: Le quartier dans lequel est situé l'appartement est un quartier multiethnique. On y trouve des marchés asiatiques, magrébins, latinos-américains et des restaurants du cuisine de différents pays. Au marché Jean-Talon, de l'autre côté de la rue, il y a des fromageries, des boucheries, des boulangeries, des poissonneries, des marchands de fruits et légumes, la société des alcools du Québec, des cafés, un pub, des restaurants. Super pratique!
transit: L'appartement est à 4 minutes à pied du métro Jean-Talon (ligne orange et bleue). Il y aussi de nombreuses lignes d'autobus, dont des bus de nuit.
access: Vous avez accès à tout l'appartement ainsi qu'aux deux balcons.
interaction: Je suis disponible en tout temps par message pour répondre à vos questions.
house_rules: Ne fumez pas dans l'appartement! Pas de musique forte s'il vous plaît! Pas de fêtes. Lisez les instructions de la machine à café et du lave-vaisselle avant de les utiliser. Merci!

reviews.comments: Catherine's home was clean, conveniently located, and well appointed. Being right across from the market and in Little Italy is a huge plus. We had a great stay!

Une expérience superbe chez Catherine! Les photos ne font pas justice, on à vraiment aimez notre séjour- elle à vraiment du style cette femme :)
J'ai hâte de retourner <3
The host canceled this reservation 52 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The place was perfect, we spent there 5 days and had the feeling to be home. Well equipped with all you can find to cook or to clean, the apartment is well located for exploring Montreal. Catherine is a great host, easily reachable. We did not meet her but she made things easy for us with clear instructions. Absolutely recommended.

The apartment was great (my partner exclaimed on our first day there that it was like the love child of Salvador Dali and Frida Kahlo) and being right across from the Jean Talon Market is a huge perk.  We were able to go shopping at the market and then cook rather than eating out for every meal.   Everything was clean and bright and colorful, and we had no problems finding the apartment or getting around the city- it's just two blocks from the metro station.   Catherine was very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay, it made me want to move to Montreal!

Le logement était comme décrit. L'emplacement près du marché Jean talon est vraiment un PLUS. Tout était propre et fonctionnel...
Joli appart. Aucun contact avec l'hôte mais une note descriptive des lieux était somme toute suffisante.

I didn't have a chance to meet Catherine but she gave me the proper instructions on how to get into the apartment with ease. I really enjoyed my stay and felt like I had plenty of space. The apartment was equipped will all the essential needs for a week long stay. Before I arrived, she had a family of 4 staying for an extend period of time. There was a little hiccup with the cleaning person getting around to the apartment before my stay. Nevertheless, Catherine apologized and rectified the situation by having them coming as soon as possible and refunding me for 2 nights. It was an understandable situation with the last guests staying so long and leaving the day I am arriving. I definitely would stay again and love the decor! The neighborhood is a great location by the Jean Talon Market and Metro station within steps.

the apartment was cute and cozy and the location was amazing. We were a short walk to the metro, to the Jean Talon market and to little Italy. If you are ok with long walks we even walked to the Mile end neighborhood one night. Buses are easy to from the apartment. Kitchen had all the utensils needed to cook some meals (which we especially since Milano market was nearby and we kept buying groceries just because everything there was so tempting!). Didn't meet Catherine but getting the keys was easy. A great place to stay!

Nous n'avons pas rencontré Catherine mais la communication a été très bonne (avant et pendant) le séjour. L'arrivée s'est déroulée très facilement. Les photos sont fidèles à la réalité quoique qu'elles ne font pas justice au logement. Très bien agencé, avec tout le nécessaire de cuisine (notamment une machine à expresso !!!! Un bonheur !!!). Couleurs vives et décorations "Frida Kahlo" :). Literie super confortable ! L'emplacement est GÉ-NI-AL  : à deux pas du marché Jean Talon, à 5 min à peine à pied de la station de métro Jean Talon, où il y a un supermarché Métro. Supermarché Provigo à 15 à pied environ. Rue calme et pas trop passagère, bien qu'à côtés de toutes les nécessités. Je recommande vivement !

Our experience in Catherine's place was really good. We spent a month there, and the apartment is just perfect for a long or short stay. The pictures don't do justice to the size of the place. We loved the neighborhood, there is a great big market right next to her place and also lot's of amazing restaurants. It's a privileged area I believe, because it's far enough from the center for things to be cheaper but you still have lots of options to eat. The location is just a little far from the tourist attractions, around 20-30 minutes by subway to each one, but her place is right next to the subway station, which is awesome!

Catherine's apartment is very vibrantly decorated, with each room a different bright colour and bold decorations. Our favourite thing about the apartment was the nice big kitchen, which was equipped with good cookware and a nice little espresso machine. There were many negative aspects about our stay. When we first arrived, there was no information about internet or other infos, so we had to search for an internet cafe to be able to get in contact with Catherine. We then had to wait quite some time before getting an answer -- an overall frustrating experience. We stayed in the flat for a month in the winter and had to go up precarious steps each day. It was our responsibility to shovel the steps and remove the ice, but no shovel was provided. Another major issue was the broken window in the bedroom. It was covered with plastic, which kept the heat in very well, but it didn't block any of the noise coming from the street, which was a problem some nights. Another thing to keep in mind is that only one set of keys was provided. This was quite inconvenient for us because we were 2 people. In general, whenever we had an issue, we were told to solve it ourselves. We managed to figure things out in the end, and the location close to the metro and nice restaurants made up for many of our frustrations.

We really enjoyed our stay. Catherine's place was warm and inviting, tidy, clean and well-maintained, and we appreciated that she had made room for us to keep our stuff. We also appreciated the well-supplied kitchen, so we could cook with the nice pots and pans, and use the espresso machine. the neighbourhood is also great. You're right next to Jean-Talon Market, which is the ideal place to get fresh groceries.
Nice place !
Agréable logement.  Facilité en tout points de vue, transport, magasin , marché, restos. Quartier agréable. A recommander sans hésitation.
The host canceled this reservation 24 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Catherine gave great directions from the airport!
The home was in great location an great heating!
It has everything you need for any length stay. 
Kitchen cupboard doors wont stay shut (bluetac must have been used in pics to keep the shut lol) an no handles on drawers an doors. My personal feeling about the bed placement ..I would like to be able to get around it. Need better tv reception. 
Overall the home needs some repairs..not quiet suitable (in my opinion) to rent out as is.
The host canceled this reservation 13 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Le séjour à Montréal dans l'appartement de Catherine à été très agréable.
Son appartement est très bien situé, à 2 pas du métro Jean Talon.

J'ai d'ailleurs beaucoup apprécié la touche de décoration avec Frida Kahlo, qui est présente dans toutes les pièces de l'appartement.

host.host_about:
Hi;
 I'm  Özgür. I'm interior architecture and interested with art and design.
 I'm easy going and helpful person so I will help you.
 I use airbnb new so I have no reviews.  I hope you have a good time in my house  and you will write good things:)

reviews.comments:
Ozgur was a very charming and friendly host. She baked us some food, greeted us at the door to help with bags, and was on hand when a few things went wrong.
The area was perfect, and there are decent bars all within 10-20mins walk away.
Sadly there was no wifi for the long weekend that we were there, and also the water cut out for half a day which wasn't ideal. This was a general problem in the area though and there was little that could have been done.
The view from the balcony was absolutely stunning and a reason in itself to stay here.

name: Sunset Beach Lodge Retreat
summary: Large 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms with Office Space on 1 acre property just 150 yards from Sunset Beach.
space: This amazing lodge style home is one of da kind home on the North Shore. Lovely & quiet, Private with 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom around 2000 Square Foot and 150 yards from famous Sunset Beach. The house is a upstairs Unit (downstairs is a 2 bedroom vacation rental) on our 1 acre of beautifully landscaped garden with tons of fruits like mango trees, orange trees, Jack fruit just to name a few. It is self catered with a fully equipped kitchen, dining area, living room , bathroom, master bedroom, queen bedroom, & double bedroom plus washer and dryer on site. This property has been renovated inside to give our vacationers the comfort of the modern houses with a large LED 60" TV, wireless internet (50 Mgbytes) and more. You will afford the best location with the best price the North Shore has to offer! The property comes furnished to the highest standard with tasteful furniture throughout the house. Bed linens are of the highest quality as well as the bath towels. Beach towels are provided for e

Lovely & quiet, Private with 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom around (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Square Foot and 150 yards from famous Sunset Beach.
